p89uEUNWxJby4WTeunnwRQ.text: As a avid Buffet Buff I love the New Menu here at the A.Y.C.E. The Menu is very diverse and has a lot of different styles to choose from. I will be back soon to visit .

kKWO0YY_PbJOBqIgk60lcg.text: Don't let the ratings and price fool you. Food was terrible. Low quality and very little selection. Way out of the way too. Do yourself a favor and eat somewhere else. You get what you pay for.

1-hC8n_3V_7enO6CoIy7ww.text: I'm not much for eating buffets but I went with a friend who wanted to go. It's nice looking but I felt the food could have been a little better. Half of what I ate lacked flavor and there wasn't a huge variety. Overall it was ok to me at best.

tPA1IJKs_ds3pz21pnNvkg.text: I am loving the update they did here. The food was great, but what really made our experience extra special was the service. We had a party of 14, and Blanca and Melissa took care of us. They were very quick and efficient. We were a needy bunch and they never once gave us any sort of attitude or sass. They were very professional. I appreciated all their hard work in making our dining experience enjoyable. Great job Palms for hiring a great wait staff.

mV7Hn-2wKhUCOcFOB4nfVQ.text: Super clean warm eclectic ambiance. We had brunch here which includes bottomless mimosa. Great service- always topping off whatever we had to drink! Our guy was very friendly and efficient!  Really like the variety of food offered and how well everything was prepared. It didn't look or taste like food had been sitting out forever which can be the case with many buffets here in LV. You must try the seafood soup with crawfish sitting on top. The clear broth is not too salty and full of flavor from the potatoes and various seafood.

QszQFh2j5XAEO-opL_3YkA.text: This buffet was better four years ago before all the remodeling. The brisket sucked, it looked tender and juicy but ended up being super dry. I couldn't get a piece of beef from the carving station Medium Rare. I asked the Lady she said that was all they had. The carne asada was decent. The ONLY thing my boyfriend and I cared for was the french onion soup that came in mini bowls the kind you would serve flan in, I had two little bowls. After finishing the second bowl I ended biting into broken glass what looked like a chipped piece of a plate. Turns out the dishwashers are not careful and too rough while cleaning plates. They chip plates! The manager was very nice but they didn't even OFFER to comp my bill. She only offered five $5 dollar coupons (which I don't care for cause I won't be going back) but I had to ask for my money back. I am just disappointed. The food wasn't all that great to begin with and then ontop of that I end up with broken glass in my mouth.

PK9mYyglRg0GgfNP3Hwhcw.text: I am not a fan of dinner buffets, but the reviews were good and I had a 50% off coupon from the Las Vegas Advisor, so why not?  Turnover early on a Wednesday evening was a noticeable issue with some small plates obviously sitting under the heat lamp too long. Equally disappointing was the absences of more ethnic dishes.  Our favorite pair of dishes were the duck cassoulet with white beans (me) and an ambrosia salad (wife). Some dishes just plain did not work, a New England clam boil that included a crawfish, but no clams and a ceviche with almost no identifiable seafood.  Unfortunately for my wife, the highly acclaimed bread pudding was dried out and could not be saved by copious amounts of caramel sauce. Service proved to be above average.

xtE5pt5u-sshL0t1acu1LQ.text: Although a little off the strip (not that far really), this place did indeed live up to the previous good reviews given. The staff was courteous and understood the meaning of service. The food was delicious, and cost rather reasonable. If you're willing to veer of the strip a few hundred metres, this spot would certainly be worth it.

0NT3JHDkwLAZaOHxVR85cw.text: We love the AYCE  buffet!! The staff is extremely friendly they are willing to help you with anything!! The food is delicious prepared well. Very clean wait staff are terrific. Today Rosa was our server terrific lady. Would highly recommend this buffet!! Staci who is assistant beverage manager is the best

gl0f9gXMgacxEVY0PNt9jw.text: Great Value.  The food is good, the decor is great and the service is great too.  I mean it's not the sterling brunch or anything, but for $22 it's worth what you get.  I just wish there were crab legs

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O2Vc5sughSVAgmiC7Tak8w.text: This buffet is a 4 step up from the previous buffet. everything tasted good. I really liked the buffalo Mac & Cheese the most and the onion sliders. The BBQ chicken pizza was really good. This buffet is actually better then any of the other buffets station owns. But I still have Bacchanal @ Caesars as my top 1. I   During my visit @ 12:16. They were testing the fire alarms every 2 minutes. The staff in the buffet said it's standard while they are renovating the whole resort

C7yrkjTrYLPRPMD7twmqHA.text: I was so surprised when I found out this was a Station Casinos buffet. So yummy and so many choices.

wAYmM5nB9GZ0BiJO2RN04g.text: Avoid this place. Don't know where to start. They allow dogs inside that aren't service animals, mislabel their food and have horrible food prep (see pics). Was very much looking forward to eating at this buffet after flying in from California to vacation in Vegas. First, they allowed a older man with a CHIHUAHUA to enter the casino and feed the dog from his plate as you can see in the pics the food on the floor and the lovely pooch waiting for his food. Second, their "paella" looked more like potato mush from yams. Rice was soggy and turned into a pile of mush (see pics). Third, their food labels did not match the dishes displayed. You can see a cabbage salad that was labeled "Cous cous salad" this was just one of many dishes mislabel. Their white rice tasted like plastic and when I asked the hostes about it she said "oh it's just hard". Huge disappointment, Horrible tasting food, infection control issues and safety hazards with food mislabeling.

TaHUEqsnYb3p2ETGB1HYAQ.text: Went during dinner hours. Was very clean and organized.   You have a limit of 2 hour eating time.  The food was meh. Meat lacked flavor to me (Brisket, carne guisada, roast beef). It was also served at a like warm temperature. Most of the food was actually like warm temperature.  The fruit was very fresh. However there were only 3 fruits to choose from, watermelon, cantaloupe & pineapple.  Located off the strip in the palms casino. Definitely need automotive transportation if you plan on getting there from the strip.

bOu8ZzYHMpS5iHXiElxSIA.text: The food was very tasty and the meat was very tender. The penne paste was my favorite plate & the dessert section was unbelievable. The staff was very welcoming and they took good care of us, very attentive. I recommend this place, it located inside the Palm Casino.

jVuP0L1E38RdzI3VJmj7ug.text: Great selection of food, good quality and fresh, great value.  All of the staff was friendly and outgoing, excellent for a Vegas buffet, highly recommend.

OQEzxRdh7vh-0MhIMyD8Bg.text: This might be the best buffet in town.  I've never been to the old Palms buffet, but hearing that it was going to be remodeled and taken over by Station Casinos, I knew I'd have to give it a try. Given that I knew Red Rock Hotel and Sunset Hotel had good buffets, I had high hopes and this buffet surpassed those expectations.  The variety of food you can choose from is crazy. They've got the best and deepest variety of of food of any Station Casino Buffet and also a few other hotels on the strip. The food itself all looks, smells and tastes great.   Service is good too. When we came in, we had Patrica and she was excellent. She was incredible friendly and made a lot of fun conversation. She also was very fast with refilling drinks and collecting dirty plates from the table.  Overall this buffet is fantastic, and is up there as one of the best in town.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom Quesadillas, Asparagus, Mashed Potatoes, Swiss Mac and Cheese, and Buffalo Cauliflower.

K0yksdRA3ci-l6nCZyi5wg.text: Was finally able to try this buffet and I just say their vegan and vegetarian options are amazing

-JoLCWVkmGVrXCmpmOJaug.text: We took a party of 14 to the lunch buffet and really enjoyed it.  The food was great, very fresh and tasty.  Our server was really good and all the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.  For the price  when you are feeding a lot of people you can't bear it.  Not a lot of cold seafood, but the hot seafood was good.

dKIm63OLjxGUtCyoPVLmqQ.text: We came here to see what the newly remodeled Palms Casino has done with its all new interiors and restaurants.  The designer has done a great job in transforming the previous dark and crowded casino into a more open and seamless layout.  The place looks larger and full of energy.  A line was already forming at the buffet when we got there around 6p.  The separate President/Chairman line didn't fare any better than the regular line.  The management needs to fix this problem !!  Once we were seated, service came quickly.  In addition to the standard buffet food staples, we also tried: onion soup, gumbo soup, seafood boil, honey walnut shrimp ... etc  Overall, the food quality is higher than the Feast Buffet at the Red Rock Casino Resort.  Good location and another buffet choice.

34nhVSgF3oKm7PdQDS9wbQ.text: We are locals.  We had high expectations, but they are completely unprepared to open.  We walked by the restaurant around 5:30 and there were lots of empty seats, so we hopped in line.  After waiting for almost 30 minutes without any line movement, we decide to leave.  We walked passed by again and there were still large sections that were not seated.  The cashiers weren't helping/seating anyone.  We were all just waiting for no reason.  Why market and invite locals to come if you aren't going to be ready?  It's a buffet, it can't be that hard.  Probably wouldn't try again.  Found it disrespectful.

p7OgUddujibTDsVCEkLysQ.text: Mediocre at most. Party of 13, 5 adults, 3 tweens (9,10,12) and 5 kids under 4, they charged for 2 years and over bill was 195$ including gratuity. We didn't even get a table together it was basically 2 tables with 3 chairs against the  wall the high chairs seperated the tables so I couldn't even talk with the rest of my party. Should have just said 2 seperate parties and saved us the 35$ tip. Didn't even have any seafood but some fried cod and assorted sushi. I enjoyed fiesta casino more and its cheaper!!

MHXOAIlaQiFG68oPtXcRWw.text: Came for dinner a couple nights ago. Lots of variety of food. Dessert selection is great! Our server, Joshua, was even nicer!! Only problem is that we noticed the servers bust tables AND take orders for drinks/cater to customers needs. You would expect that it would be two separate jobs so the customers get quicker service and speed up the line.

J02fH6359vEcDI9OI-KIqw.text: came in a bit late... really good price for a buffet in las vegas. there are a plethora of choices and vegetarian friendly choices which is fantastic! unfortunately, most of the food was very, very cold - not the ideal situation. i was a bit disappointed that our drink orders were taken by someone very rude... my grandma cannot have decaf and we basically had to beg to get some decaf coffee. it was extremely cold and when we asked if they could microwave or bring a new one, we got a stern "no can do". this place has a lot of potential; it is in a beautiful location and has lots of choices. it would be great to see some kind servers here and some hot food!!

PmTnGywajTP5cYGl8aNwQg.text: We went for lunch and it was pretty good. They had a great variety of food and the service was great. The desert bar was awesome. There were a lot of options. The only thing that kind of stunk about it was they were having a hard time keeping up with the amount of people. A lot of the food would be out when going to get a plate. I would come back again for sure.

wKnRaSBqkuw7pEydWyU9iA.text: Reading the reviews on here I guess I was expecting better. We have been to many buffets in Vegas on and off the Strip. While this buffet is not as expensive as most buffets located on the main Strip, I was not as satisfied. There were about 5 stations, then a station for dessert and another for soup and salad. Each station had very little options and we ended up eating maybe 1 1/2 plates each. The price for 2 kids and 2 adults was $83 or so. I do wish that the kids prices were a little more appropriate as I believe it starts charging kids the same price whether you are 2 or 10 and the cost is almost the same price an adult. Personally, I probably would not come back, they aren't the worst but I would rather pay the additional cost and just go to a different buffet. On a positive note though, free parking and the buffet was easy to find. Also, there was no line to get in.

uo8A-2cvINMuLh6Nshszwg.text: This is undeniably the best affordable QUALITY buffet for lunch at $12/person outside of the Las Vegas strip. The last time we stayed here was on June 12, 2013 and skipped the buffet. The JAPANESE restaurant nearby west of here was closed Monday so we crossed east to Palms. The Noodle place inside seemed a nice place for a light lunch. We decided to gamble a bit, wash up and come back, but passed by the AYCE buffet. We asked to take a peek inside and was surprised to find out that the Palms Casino became part of the Station Casino group since October 2016. Walking around the buffet stations, the presentation was three grades above last night's Sunset Station Fiesta Buffet (even better dressed) customers, the fresh looking smaller portion food selection. Roasted Calamari was tender, great Italian pizza, Stromboli, Carne Azada, tasty fried fish pollock, mussels, Asian, Italian, Spanish, American, European selections, friendly atmosphere and servers. CHOCOLATE and other  GELATO Ice cream and baked selections. I'm glad the Japanese place was closed and we did not go back to the noodle place next door. HAPPY BIRTHDAY to Marilou, my Most Beautiful Girl in the World! We've been eating too much, anyhow this is one place where you can enjoy quality at an affordable price and walk out gracefully contented and not bursting! We'll be back soon.

v0Ct0wcQ5rFhQsurKIb1dg.text: Super impressed! We went for lunch so it was only $12 which I couldn't believe. The atmosphere was nice, newly renovated and kind of had a hipster vibe. Everything I tried was good which is unusual for a buffet, they also had some unique dishes like flamin hot Cheetos elote (omg!) and buffalo Mac and cheese. I don't eat meats, only fish, but the meats looked really good. They had vegan desserts labeled which I thought was nice and gelato station. The service was good as well. I wouldn't hesitate to go especially for the great prices, you get $1 off if you have a players card FYI.

pk6FrgHbjvPX_DjdgCyvNw.text: Place is just as good as wicked spoon at almost half the price, can never go wrong here. Staff is friendly as well.

FpeUkFRYGbwOXdu7ziYEjA.text: One of the most convenient Buffets in Las Vegas, reasonable price for the huge food variety and amazing desert selection.. Seafood, Sushi, salads, Roasted turkey, pasta...Also the staff was very warm and friendly.

m_F0JMZKoD0dx9KDj5sYKg.text: The pictures just looked good. But it was just the pics that were good. Can't believe this from The Palms. Even as I entered the property, I felt this wasn't the Palms of 15 years ago. It felt sad. The Palms became that casino the cousin Eddy took Clark to when he down and out.

IE7OA6ZJnidTUq4n8dqcvw.text: Some people must have got paid for leaving a review. So far Lucky Penny's been offal. Try the breadfast buffet. Why much improvement in service and look. This buffet is even worst than palace station. You can't get any worst than that. Not much selection for the price. Overall food is dry cold and tasteless. Local been to many buffet. This is the worst. Palms used to have Wow!!!! Restuarant. Stations just ran it into the ground . Tasteless. Save your money . Try somewhere else

TII4hTttMWK92BjNGiT73g.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I visited this buffet. In Vegas I feel like there are only two kinds of buffet: the $55 buffet, or the $8.99 buffet. AYCE falls in the middle! The atmosphere here is really cool and new, Palms is doing well with the renovations so far. I've been to the GVR and Red Rock buffets but AYCE definitely offers some creative dishes. My favorites include the (pesto?) pasta during lunch and the small salmon dishes and different Mac and cheeses during dinner. My body is highly likely made of 35% cheese. Confused as to the reviews that mention "not enough shrimp in the bucket..." It's... a buffet. Go get... more? If you're a fan of buffets definitely try it out!!

XmBjY7rZLAZXXq8rdNk3Sg.text: The buffet quality w 4.5 stars.  Food quality s 4 stars.  Presentation is 5 stars.  Service is 5 stars.  Decor and ambiance is 3.5 stars.  And the Palm is a nice upscale casino hotel, unlike the other typical Station owned casino hotels. The pros of $10/person is incredible.  The only gripe I have is the lack of good seafood.  But at these prices there is no easy e can really complain.  Hopefully eventually they will add more seafood to their menu.

0F-VPc8fl8hiD3OCwbtXOg.text: Enjoyed a terrific lunch at the A.Y.C.E Buffett.  There were so many great food options.  I love love loved there Vegan selection from the fresh pressed carrot and beet juices to the jackfruit enchiladas.  The variety of salads is also excellent, the Arugula, fig and blueberry salad was my favorite.  Also, so many choices for dessert...too many great food selections to list, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  Will be back for breakfast and dinner.  A must if you have out of town guests.

okB4A9POsy0Wqw8YSfzyXQ.text: Awesome brunch!!! No hassle parking. AYCE is only less than a month old everything is new. Our server Glenda is friendly, courtesy and amazing attentive! Thank you for an excellent brunch experience! Food selection had something for everyone!...

XXblAHfctx3r5RUx6CqaDg.text: Got a mailer offering 2-for-1 breakfast buffet. Decided to come in to use it on a Sunday. After waiting in line for a half hour, we right next to the couple ahead of us who pulls out THEIR 2-for-1 mailer and gets told that they aren't accepting today. Sure enough, at the very bottom in very small print, they have something about how it's not good on Sunday. I wonder how many other people the cashier had to explain the fine print to. It makes me feel straight up cheated. I live very close to this place and would have been a regular, but they lost me for good. Completely ruined my morning.

e1p-NANq5nLpWjc7FKifYA.text: Currently eating at the buffet. Great foods, service, and atmosphere. My favorites included the chicken pot pie and cold pressed juices. My only question is why you would have your hard working hostesses wear hard heeled pumps. Every step they take, I can see the discomfort and pain on their faces. Who's ever idea this was needs to have their head examined. Save the hostesses feet and change their shoes.

jDDSZHWTZ-ibBwvL-u72kQ.text: Its the best Champagne sunday brunch in town. They accommodated my group of 16 with ease, especially Assistant Manager, Mary & her staff. The selection of food are great & served in small quality portion.

HjLMdZJNpuZomj6waP8qrA.text: Great food, great service and best value for your money, The place looks awesome, it was remodeled last year. Can't wait to comeback tomorrow for breakfast :)

XZ0ByNBFFjKv4vbrk7gepg.text: We like checking out different places to eat and when we heard that Palms is now a station casino we decided to try their buffet out A.Y.C.E! Everyone was nice the place is small line was moving slow and we liked the prime rib and roast beef but the ribs are not that good. Lets just say we have had better, but I think we will not be going back there!!!!

2LQyNeXgtb6yF-95E0ZIDA.text: Out of all the buffets that we tried this time for our trip in Las Vegas this buffet at the palms has to be the best and best priced. We are definitely coming back to this buffet in the future. It sure beats all of the strip the phase that are way overpriced all the food was very fresh and they had a huge selection sure to please everyone.

9U-Oms3OcG0SS6cAMLnF2w.text: Good service. Great selection of food. I like that they serve pineapple juice. I like the design of their tables and chairs. And we always get their BOGO.

YxyIJsPT_q2x7oJF-B6xFQ.text: Dinning luxurious in Vegas can sometimes be a mistake. You spend big bucks for tiny plates and leave unsatisfied all around. A fellow yelper told me that buffets in Vegas are the way to go. A.Y.C.E was definitely a hot spot for my friends and I on our most recent stay at the Palms hotel in Vegas.  Prices for a breakfast buffet is unbeatable. I believe we payed around $14 per person (get the rewards card in the lobby for $2-$3 discount) and for $10 more you could get unlimited mimosas. Ok when you're from Miami, you know this is a steal! Food was very tasty to my surprising, as I'm not used to going to buffets. My friend was addicted to the egg benedicts they had, my boyfriend loved the omelettes, and I loved getting there between breakfast and lunch to get their sushi!! I'm not the biggest breakfast person but I did enjoy the best of both worlds.  Remember that prices change from breakfast, lunch, and dinner. On the weekend, come early because you might get stuck in a long line and miss the price you want (Speaking from experience here)! Last but not least, they have an amazing section just for dessert!

XzCwC4toDOlUXg8mENKdHA.text: DEFINITION OF INSANITY!!! DONE. They don't get it. They really don't get it. Maybe Dinner management knows what they are doing, but lunch OMG. Twice now for lunch. Horrible. Dried out food, I'm done explaining this place.  There are enough places to eat here in town. No station coupon is worth aggravation and a waste of money.  Hi. I'm eating lunch here now.  there a disconnection. Things are mislabeled. Asked for eel sauce, something came out with red pepper flakes in it. That's not eel sauce. Also, staff is not friendly. The manager now on duty watched me ask for something and they did not understand she did not assist. Frustrated again. Sorry to bother you.  Thank you Freshta for trying.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Does that look like eel sauce. Eel sauce is dark like hoisin sauce. The kitchen brought this out  said it was eel sauce w red pepper flakes.
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert ... seriously? Lol

aPYidS2qJ45QR_2BKIiGIw.text: Hey do you want eat at AYCE? Yeah, for sure where at?! This was my initial response when a group of my friends asked me a couple weeks ago. In my mind I thought they were referring to an all you can eat restaurant, Lol. I quickly learned that a new local buffet just opened recently at Palms.  Upon arriving, there was a decent size line but it move quickly and seemed like the turnover is quick. Overall, the staff at AYCE were very friendly and had a great systematic way of clearing tables and refilling drinks in a timely and efficient manner. So kudos to the staff!! The ambience reminded me of Wicked Spoon at Cosmo with a bit of Social Libertine at Mandalay Bay. Kinda, of hipster style but value minded buffet that was surprisingly delicious.  Everything I had was pretty good. I personally like... -Beef Brisket, Tender and the spices was good. -Corn Bread, Moist and flavorful without being dried out. -Raclette Station, Build your own mixed veggie and meat with melted cheese on top.  -French Macaroons, these were amazingly delicious and they a good variety of flavors. -Gelato Ice Cream Sandwich Station, This was cool and satisfying. Build your own ice cream cookie sandwich!  Overall, a great value buffet and satisfying dishes that will pleased everyone's taste buds.  2018 Yelp Review #16

7clP9st7oSS1W0WDGjwSJg.text: Since my fiance loves buffets and we wanted to try somewhere new, we decided to try a place, which was a bang for your buck. We went here multiple times just to see if their items change on different days during lunch and dinner.   Inside the Palms casino, the buffet is not hard to find. We first went around lunch time, right at opening. Score! We got in right away and since my fiance has a station casino card we both paid $22 bucks and it came to $25 for an all you can eat buffet and unlimited drinks. The only thing you have to pay for is alcohol of course. However, you can get unlimited mimosas if you ask at the register which is normally $10.   Walking around the buffet they have salads, meats, Mexican, Asian, Italian, and the dessert station. Things to note: salad station was awesome they had different types to choose from and a huge variety. I ended up getting the cucumber salad. Every time I have eaten it, always on point. Enough sauce and flavor from the onions. Next up, their Asian food, would of liked more selection (more Japanese foods, Chinese foods, and Filipino food). But I sure did enjoy the pot stickers, spring rolls, and salt and pepper chicken wings. Pot stickers are my all time favorite and these ones are crispy on the outside with the perfect amount of pork and seasoning on the inside. Spring Rolls, perfect size, not too small or too big and add the hot chili dipping sauce it makes it to die for if you love things hot like me. The salt and pepper wings, sounds mediocre at first. Let me tell you, you gotta try these.Surprisingly, these are juicy, hot and reminds me of the chicken wings my mom makes for me.   You cannot stop there. The meats are pretty good, especially if you love pulled pork, turkey, chicken (chipotle lime) and chicken pot pies. All of them were tender, juicy, extremely flavorful. Only thing is, it can be hit or miss on some days with the chicken (it was a little dry the last time around). Italian food, wish they had more of a selection here too. You can find pizza, a pasta building station, garlic bread, Stromboli, and penne. Not a big fan of pizza, and the only thing was their pasta station did not have much to choose. The Mexican station opted out since I was not craving it at all.   Save the best for last, desserts. Just like most buffets, they have a soft serve station, gelato, mini cakes, and mini desserts, ambrosia and fruits. The best part was the apple cobbler w/the soft serve. Dipping your spoon into the hot, ooey, gooey goodness, of warm apple and cinnamon makes you want to go back for more.   All in all, good buffet to go to if you wanna save and still enjoy the food. Will be back to try breakfast in the near future!

QuklGaUckPQdKDQv5du34A.text: Breakfast was included in our stay at the Palms. Saturday we came about 9:00 AM which seemed to be the perfect timeframe. No line!  Much to choose from. Station offered:  Roastery, Greenery, Hearth, World Pan, Smoke & Fire, Sweet & Light, and Revival. Revival station is "wellness, power-boosting super foods & specialty vegan & vegetarian. World Pan include Moroccan lamb, congee, bao buns, and strogonoff, while the Roastery has installed a white oak and mesquite chip burning grill.   Restaurant is clean, staff is organized by getting the line moving & assisting guest. Employees handling the stations are prompt and professional. Please tip the wait staff. They work hard in providing good customer service, keeping your table cleaned off, getting your drinks replenished and catering to your needs.  BTW: Sunday brunch is an additional fee. However, included in the price is endless Mimosas & available from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AKvl8rJ51aiFAmRxmXZ5aw.text: I came here with a bunch of friends to celebrate a birthday. We went around 5:30PM, so there was barely a wait or many patrons. Service was attentive enough--no complaints there.  But the food. There is no seafood, which is understandable for the price you're paying for. There is a smattering of smaller prepared seafood dishes like a pail of shrimp cocktail, small small small dishes of poke, and cooked fish. The shrimps were super tiny and reminiscent of the ones you get in the freezer section that you can stir fry. It didn't taste fresh. The poke bowls barely had any taste to them. Bottom line, stay away from most of the seafood. The cod with lemon and capers was not bad though. There is a decent assortment of meats, but most of us felt that they were too dry. I think there was a general consensus that the food was dry because the turnover rate isn't as fast as those buffets on the strip. I think my favorite dish of the night was the wedge salad lol.  I think for the price, the food quality was fair. Would I come here on my own volition? Probably not. I think it's a good option for groups though since there is a decent variety.

opKWwi0u58AIoiEispNG6Q.text: Almost 2 weeks ago a group of me & my friends (about 12 ppl) came to try this place out for the 1st time. Staff was very patient with us since we were a big group, the food turned out better than I expected, and our server Dwight was just amazing and always on top of it - especially when we were ordering bottomless mimosas.   The only thing that slightly ruined the experience was when I was waiting in line at the buffet & a perverted man was talking to me very inappropriately trying to get me to "have fun with him" that night. I thought he was joking i said huhh???? Lol I had enough of him talking to me so I just walked away from him very uncomfortable. Thankfully, security & the assistant manager Mary saw what happened and kicked him out. Thank you security for handling that & Mary for talking/apologizing to me afterwards. It made me feel more safe. I really appreciated it!  Overall, I had a great time with my friends with great food & outstanding service.

NcV0OknkIsv_RVhREn93cg.text: Benji is beyond amazing! Super pleasant! We are so happy he served us. He made this buffet experience amazing! Thank you so much! Whoever his boss is, please give this man a raise! Thank you!!!

OW9aGq9UMzssSyIA76OCEg.text: It was one of the highlights of my trip to Vegas. Enjoyed the fresh Smoked Brisket and St Lewis style ribs!!! Not to mention the diverse selection!!!

UOVFZzSfx06j3czHi901wA.text: The most excellent buffet I have ever been to!  The food was all delicious and fresh.  The variety was impressive and so many interesting choices.  Loved the environment as well, very sleek and clean.  Took my kids on their summer break and it was one of the highlights for sure!

7ZKR4nHvTB0H6ymr9TUk8Q.text: I've heard such great things about this place, I had to come.   But within minutes I was quickly disappointed. The offerings are great but still the same quality that stations casinos lives up to.   The "hot Cheeto" corn was over cooked, I had one bite and put it away. The same goes for the crab boil, the Korean ribs, and the sushi.   The highlight was the prime rib and French onion soup.   The place is ok, the presentation is great, but I'd rather save up some hunger for other buffets in town.

iYi_2xhDDBKaxo6F95LQaw.text: This is a great place.  We had a group of 30 and were seated right away.  Our server Yanette came back several times to refill our drinks and took away our finished plate. Thank you, great place!!

e8VQkqdwpKBXOARNjqsO6Q.text: It's 4 PM on a Saturday and there's not any real food. Brunch hours are typically between 10 and 2 however there are cold eggs and pancakes still out. I usually enjoy this buffet but I don't see myself bringing my family back. Oh well luckily it's Vegas and there are plenty of others to choose from.

lp9M4QVKVO1376QILWxjsA.text: This place is pretty cheap for a Sunday brunch ($20 if you have a players card, also includes bottomless mimosas)  They have your typical salad bar, a small variety of different types of cuisine and then your breakfast cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AWkCZsBwwoCKCS2rE_uRYw.text: We had lunch today, and after what seemed like a forever wait in line we were seated. We were quickly greeted by our server Rhonda, who was absolutely awesome, friendly and attentive. Then we set upon our buffet feast. So much deliciousness...carnivores to herbivores (vegans) will find something to delight over. After a fifth round through the buffet (I like to pretend I am a competitive eater at buffets), we rushed the sweet & light dessert bar, everyone enjoyed the full bellies and all the great food that caused them.

f3ikdKVMr_942XC1_F2V4w.text: Great food and worth the wait. Food is better than any other stations buffet and better than any other strip buffet as well. Cooks are friendly. 3 action stations which you usually only see maybe 1 action station at other buffets if any; smoked brisket and ribs are pretty damn good. They smoke everything right their on the line. FOH managers are really nice. But mostly Chef Mike is the best. My kids are extremely picky eaters and he went out of his way and made them sliders and fresh mac and cheese.

-wYRcg3LE63FAy4aNcZrgA.text: Breakfast! It's one of the most important meals of the day. A.Y.C.E. Buffet, it's one of the best local buffets!  At $11 per person (with a "Preferred" Stations casinos card) it simply cannot be beat. It's not a typical buffet - it's what Vegas buffets should be - your traditional breakfasts dishes taken to elevated level with a chef's touch.    The food was better than expected. I really liked all the varieties of single-serving bowls; most or all of them had a poached eggs inside, great for mixing. With the poached eggs were corned beef, ham, rice, or bbq benedict. Of course they had the omelet station - gotta have it. Pancakes & french toast with fresh berries. Oh and the meats! Freshly carved ham, sausages, bacon, country fried steak... All so good.   There's lots more like an Asian section with noodles, potstickers, and pork baos, an Italian section with bready pizza and the like, a "Revival" station for vegan/vegetarian section for superfoods like yogurt and freshly squeeze juices, and of course since it's breakfast so much from the bakery - croissants, rolls, bagels, pastries and so much more I didn't get a chance at because I was so full.  I'm getting sleepy from the food coma so I'm going to end it there. Maybe when I wake up, I'll go back and check out the dinner... Zzz Zzz Zzz

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
