Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Water mell ohn!

aNwCZMLhChRXE42eXv30vw.text: This place was horrible. The price wasn't that bad. $27.05 was a pretty great price for a buffet, but I should've figured because it was cheap the food would've been bad. The meat was super over cooked very tough and very dry. They had a great assortment of deserts (looked super pretty) but all the deserts were super dry. Cupcakes, cake, bread puddings all dry. Cookies crumbled and tasted nasty, which really sucks because I'm a big desert person. The only good thing they had were the shrimp cocktail,the mongolian bbq and the ice cream bar and soft serve. Everything else was terrible. The staff also just walks around and lets all the plates pile up. I had to ask someone twice to remove the empty plates that were on our table, and the lady had a slight attitude as if she didn't want to do her job. I will not be coming back to this place the next time I visit Vegas.

aDi7OXPqCvW4368Cadn9Ow.text: Went for a late lunch on a Friday by myself and paid the extra $10 for bottomless mimosas. It started out fine, until after the third mimosa, the server just ignored me. I caught his attention to ask for another and he looked annoyed, saying he would give me another but he was leaving soon and had to go. It looked like the table next to me stiffed him, so I understood his bad mood. He brought me another and I made sure to tip him then since he was leaving and I planned on staying to finish out the two hours of mimosas I paid for.   After he walked away, I asked what looked like a manager where the restrooms were. She kindly told me they were outside of the buffet. I asked if it would be ok to go and come back in and she said that it was fine. For safe measure, I let the hostesses know I was just going to the restroom and would be returning.   I went to the restroom and came back (maybe 4-5 minutes) and my table was cleared and reset for two. I stood at it with a confused look trying to catch someone's attention, but no one seemed to notice or care so I left. Not just the buffet, but the whole casino. I had planned on having my mimosas and spending my afternoon at some slots, but the service from AYCE buffet left too bad of a taste in my mouth to remain in the building.

VvqIKjbi8PX8v0Rnr3Bvow.text: The food is very good and worth the price but unfortunately there's always line and they are super slow to sit ppl in the room even when half of the tables are not taken... Average wait time to sit is 45min. It would be 5 stars if they were faster.

2T-BshzDTrq60YjXJrG-KA.text: Don't listen to the hype. People don't know what a good all you can eat buffet is. Especially for Vegas, It's subpar at best. I was quite disappointed at the selection of food and there isn't much vegetarian food either.

ivf1NArJiUrbAFoOx_TuBQ.text: This buffet is great, it is owned by the company who has station casinos which means it is reasonably priced (20ish per person).   Other buffets are so expensive and food quality is so low but here it was not the case. They had salmon, make your own pasta station, the dessert section was incredible! They even had a vegan/ vegetarian section I did not eat it but did see it.   The portions here are small so you can eat a little bit of everything. I like the small portions because there is less food waste and more space to try foods.   I really enjoyed their desserts- macaroons, cheesecake, ice cream, cookies so many things and most made in house.   I will be back :)

Uj_7i2e_4tTxC3_qtz6n2w.text: I was so surprised of how nice this buffet is! The food stations are spread out pretty well and they do have a great selection. It was our first time here and we were highly impressed with how the decorations and just the overall vibe was great. Since this became a stations casino, we wanted to try out their buffet and compare it to all the others we've been too. I can say, with the quality of food and service, we liked it as much as Red Rock! Maybe even more?! Haha or maybe I was just really hungry! We came here for lunch, closer to dinner time and I think I was obsessively eating their chicken pot pie and Brussels sprouts. Anything I can throw some tabasco sauce on, I probably ate extra of it. Their sushi was decent. The Asian Section has this salt and pepper chicken wings which were pretty good when it came out hot. I also enjoyed their Italian section. Can't go wrong with someone cooking it fresh in the back for you! :) I'll update my review the next time I go here again. Good service! Good food for the price and spacious setting. Happy eating my fellow Yelpers :)

5VHGxa3Nrv57KyI1troiGQ.text: My server was super friendly and the place is very fresh and clean.   Thy have LOTS and LOTS of food.  Larki was super friendly and fast on the drink the refills .  Sevda is super nice at the hostess stand .  They have a huge variety of stuff to choose from so the question is why two star review  Because I'm driving by  and the big marquee out front says lunch 1199 with boarding pass.  I have a boarding pass and was charged $13.99.  Everyone that doesn't get one pays $15.99  I've spent 15 minutes trying to get my $2 back after I showed the picture of the sign and no one will listen to me  They have lost me as a customer forever  and  they just opened up 2 weeks ago

6ouzEN43LgZBo22blr64iA.text: Heard that the Palms hotel redid their buffet so I had to try it out.   We went during brunch and it wasn't too busy. The interior is modern and they definitely focused on details.   The food though was just okay. What you would expect from your typical buffet. Not sure if I would return.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Upgrade!

MsdtAsn7lTAwcqVd4tDaWA.text: My boyfriend and I decided to check out this buffet, and it was amazing! One of the best buffets I been to for the price. They offer vegan food, and I noticed a lot of healthier choices, which I liked the most. The food offered had presentation, was well prepared, and fresh. All in all, I'd definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Cheeto Elotes!

i7dS1_anRico923vMJja0g.text: Great service and delicious food! Array of different options and a quality grade. Derek you the bro and excited to see the company grow.

hn7V-DylJRRJl6krVq-rrA.text: I stayed at the Palms place me and my wife went to the brunch buffet we waited for 50 minutes to finally get seated it costed us $17.99 each and when we finally got to the buffet I picked little of everything sat down began eating I could not believe what the whole wait was about it was absolutely disgusting I know you get what u pay for but nothing had seasoning at all I would never go back 2 small plates and I was ready to go.

UFiIa9RyEX7_FRWLs-A7fQ.text: My brother wanted to try this buffet at the Palms and I wasn't disappointed. It wasn't great but certainly not the worst. All the food was fresh and well spaced out. I had some smoked brisket, sweet potato mash and assortment of combinations of food. Our server for drinks was very observant and made sure our drinks were filled and we left a good tip. Good desserts!  The bad: My mom says the Asian food was very salty. my brother says the beef wasn't tender and I tried a smoked turkey leg that tasted like wood.  Overall it wasn't a bad place to try. I paid around $16.00 for dinner after getting a players card

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macaroon and dipped strawberry for dessert
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs, brisket sweet potato mash ab a dry turkey leg

G4WU1bOXPBBAp0zm7_rJSQ.text: I am fan of this buffet (I have tried a lot of buffets) in Vegas, the staff is always friendly and welcomes you with a smile. Since the Palms has redid their casino (still working on the remodel) the Buffet has a lot food choices and it all always looks fresh, their staff/cooks keep the place looking neat and the food areas are clean and not covered with food spills. One this I like it that is you need something prepared they are willing to make it for you. The waitresses and waiters are also very attentive to your drinks and plates clearing the tables. I don't have try and find someone to get refills. I would come back here again also I would recommend this place to anyone wanting to try a newer updated buffet. The wait in the lines are not really long, it might seem like it because they way they look but it moves rather quickly.

Dop2kgwnfk4gez0sXToPnQ.text: A.Y.C.E, short for "all you can eat" opened up a little over a week ago on the ground floor of the Palms hotel.  After eating here last night, here's my top 5 things to know about Las Vegas' newest buffet:  1. Corn on the cob three ways! They brushed grilled corn with mayo and rolled it in crushed Doritos, Flaming Hot Cheetoes, and Cojita Cheese. It is soooo good I ate 4!!! 2. New to the buffet scene, they serve Thai Penang pork and Korean Kalbi beef ribs.   3. They catered to both ends of the spectrum. As a vegetarian I was happy to find healthy light vegetarian dishes like tofu lettuce wraps as well as mushroom quesadillas and my husband who loves his meat found loads of southern BBQ beef.  4. With a Station Casinos player's card you get a discount at the door.  Also, Station mails out 2-for-1 buffet coupons about every month when you sign up for a player's card. They apply here. 5.  Look for the Cinnamon-sugar coated taco shells at the dessert station! Yummy!!  We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and at less than $20/person including tip (without a 2-for-1 coupon) it can't be beat.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn rolled in crushed Flaming Hot Cheetos! Whaaaaaaat??

s7QD0sZtVBfp2w9ZNAOTEQ.text: If you can give .5 stars on reviews this would be a 3.5/5....  Price is super cheap compared to the buffets on the main strip and a few dollars more than what you would find at your local stations casino.  I feel for the price of it you do get a lot for your money and that is why I reflected it as 4 instead of 3 stars but at the same time you do get the quality of food that you pay for so don't expect everything to be perfect or fresh tasting.  I went for dinner but overall especially for breakfast you can't beat this value

-VNGIOoElpkfaEyKn2z_yg.text: This buffet was gold when it opened. It has consistently become average. Food selections have become far less interesting, being replaced by cheaper alternatives. Too many foods are sitting out and getting cold. The few places that require someone to cut something for you or serve are always understaffed--have to wait around to get helped. Big headache is president chairman line consistently allows anyone to stand in the line. 3 times in a row I was behind low tier card holders that cashier didn't care were in wrong line. I complained each time and was met with blank stare of indifference. They need better signage for that line.

TQzuREy2Q0PviC6wgviDFQ.text: The worst buffet I ever had in Vegas! Sushi was dried up! Mongolian station was horrible.. noodles were too salty and mushy. Pasta station was disgusting . How do you mess up pasta? Food looks like they sat there for a long time. Seriously.. I've eaten every buffet in Vegas and this AYCE is a no go!  Never coming back. Not worth the wait!

D19PYkmho8_-Sahi9Zgg0g.text: This is the newest addition to the Las Vegas buffet scene, and it did not disappoint.  It may be out of the way for types that like to stick to the strip, but the Palms is a fun excursion and the buffet is an added bonus. I really don't remember anything about the previous buffet, and I'm something of a Vegas buffet connoisseur, so that's definitely a sign it needed an upgrade.  I came for lunch and the wait in line wasn't terrible, about average for that time of day. The thing that attracted me was the price, its an amazing value for what you get and especially compared to some others around.   The inside is beautiful, open, and bright.  Its easy to navigate, and not overwhelming.  Our waitress was attentive and it seems to be fully staffed.  One thing I love about this buffet that set it apart are all the little dishes. Instead of just scooping out heaps of food on a spoon, they make up these little bowls and plates, almost tapas style. Not only does it help control how much food you get, it just seems a lot less messy and more quaint.   That said, everything was good! The sliders were amazing, and they have an entire section for vegetarian/alternative options that wasn't just a salad bar (I think this is the first time I've seen this at a Vegas buffet?)   I'm very interested to come back for dinner, considering how good lunch was. I certainly think its worth the hike off the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All You Can Eat
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Light bites for lunch

7FCLFpgl5Lmq1vOKxkWA_Q.text: Recommended by someone for good local dinner buffet. Nah~~~ most likely I won't be back for good. Terrible selections, zero seafood, no sushi, roast beef was just grossed me out. Sad I ruined my weekend night.

9GwFGiFu35wQpoxJQi_4qw.text: AMAZING!  They had good food. Reasonable price for brunch. Amazing service from Christopher! He's so nice and is very attentive. Looking forward to coming soon!

JDBbEWyuDrdlGybS67FaRg.text: Very disappointed! First of all on line it says  Unlimited beer and wine, but this is not True , False advertising! The silverware was dirty and the food was cold , not to mention not so tasty . My husband and I will not be going back , although he said the broccoli soup was good!

VRJyDPGyJcFwNulQdpIukQ.text: Second time eating here.  First time was the first week they opened around lunchtime. Food was mediocre and everything was tepid temperature.  A few months later let's try Sunday brunch. Price for what it wasn't was a waste of money. Very underwhelmed by choices. Again the temperature of the food was not even warm.  That is a huge no, no in the food industry and a turn off for me when eating any food that should be at least moderately hot. So let's skip brunch food and get dessert for breakfast.  Ice cream sandwich looked good but the cookie holding the ice cream was so damn hard by the time you could jackhammer It with your teeth the ice cream would slip out of the cookies. The fruit was good. I gave it a fair shot A.Y.C.E. buffet.

SvIrt2qe9RtCjQq9wRY85A.text: Not that many choices. But it was ok.  A lot of the food was dry but the prime rib was the only thing that was worth it.

wK124em79FvL7DAuWOmYKQ.text: Brand new remodel. very good looking resturaunt.  Customer service was very good.  Had to wait 20 min in line. but it was busy day and full.   Food was served well spred out so no waiting to get your plate filled.  food choices where average.  not overloaded with choices, quality was above most.    $20 adult and $14 for child , well worth the price .

-JSo0Qnj4wCZijMJ5PjOuQ.text: The food was good here. The price was cheap. Highly recommend it!

Bqdrb8LcFuhXNBNc2vDSZw.text: Much improved buffet for the Palms. Love the Honey Shrimp. Ambiance is definitely a step up from the former buffet at the Palms.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Honey Shrimp at the Palms AYCE Buffet

OyzAp88KDk9YnDk6RNrIpg.text: Man me and my boyfriend are always trying new places and today we tried this place. You want good food that is strip quality but off the strip prices this is your place. We will be making this our new spot

6PKSRDy8hu88bPYUa-9AyA.text: Came to eat dinner here last night and I brought my daughter with me . They didn't have the Thai curry mussels but it was ok this buffet is so good best I've been to off the strip. I recommend to try it at least once. The turkey wings with bbq sauce mmmm. Im big fan of their macaroni station anything u like to put in it and they cook right there . Must try!!! My daughter love the dessert station of course !!

gJwDX_i2N4FfixRDHecr-A.text: The food was pretty good...  The staff was little "hover-y"...  They would be better served overall to not have such deep serving areas because it was difficult to get to items in the back.

Oyw2giWnb-8txxcdi-u6fA.text: Got in early Sunday morning around 9 am and immediately got seated. Our waiter was very attentive and made sure our needs were met. The place was very clean, airy, well lit and decor was modern and contemporary. Tables were set with adequate room between them so you don't bump into other people as you go back and forth from the buffet line. As far as the food, they were all served fresh at the right temperature, presentation was great and all were delicious. At this time, this is my favorite buffet in Vegas and would definitely visit the next time I'm there. Great value for the money!

utSOpQ6plVvZ3rneGvR4vQ.text: A limited selection compared to other Station Casino buffets. The casino is still being improved upon, so hopefully the buffet will also improve with a larger selection and taste.

7jxy-cq4t1rnTq3edkRNFg.text: I would call this the budget version of Wicked Spoon at the Cosmopolitan. Very similar in concept and decor. Pretty good for the price! Lots of variety, some interesting small plates (like brisket and eggs at breakfast). The food was fresh and frequently replenished. One of the best omelet bar omelets we've had anywhere. Our server was very nice, and came by frequently to remove plates and check our coffee. We'll be back.

QvBjr8z0v5CNiTadxLfyxA.text: Pleasantly surprised by this buffet. New modern interiors with a relaxed atmosphere. Every plate I had was delicious and perfectly cooked and seasoned-all for a reasonable price (2 buffets for $28)

Ly0QCMh3PWI1LzXrAay5RQ.text: We are locals, we have high expectations. We compare the price and quality from the local casinos. We do not eat on the strip casinos which are for the tourists.  My wife and I used to eat at Palms very frequently before they were remodeled. We ate lunch there recently, so we do not know the quality of the dinner. Most of the foods are not hot and tasteless, especially those with small container or bowels.  First, for value and quality, former Palms Bistro Buffet was much better than the new A.Y.C.E buffet. The old Bistro Buffet had quality salad bar and Italian station.  Second, compare with the other Station Casinos, We like the Place Station which is cheaper and offers quality foods. Yes, they do not have fancy environment. But for value and quality, we would like to eat there. Besides, Santa Fe station is also a good choice. Both Palace Station and Santa Fe Station offer better foods than Palms and Red Rock. Red Rock have not changed a dish for many years, unbelievable!  We think the only thing the new A.Y.C.E is better than the old Bistro Buffet is the desserts.

cmVGL3uMQ0uLCMywnfvJ2w.text: Perfect. The Palms really got this one right. The design and feel of the place is upscale and rivals that of the Aria buffet, with a price that's about half of what you'd pay there.  All of the food was hot (this was at 3 p.m. on a Wednesday) which is a huge win as most Vegas buffets are hit or miss in this department, especially during non-peak times.   The selection was great and a bit more unique than the standard Vegas buffet selection, which kept things interesting. Everything tasted great and the staff was extremely welcoming and friendly.   This will easily be my go-to buffet in Vegas.

jIqzthJvpup_c5lYeV-VUA.text: My Favorite buffet in Vegas. I don't typically like buffets because I always feel the food quality is poor, however, that was NOT the case here. The dishes looked beautiful and tasted even better. The fresh pressed juice shots were delicious and so refreshing. The wide variety of vegetable plates was impressive. The food looked like it was actually prepared by a human. This buffet actually DOES have something for everyone in your family; meat lovers, vegans, sweet tooth, the adventurer, etc. The staff was so friendly and welcoming. Truly an awesome place to eat. Wish it was closer to my house and work because I would be there everyday! And you can't beat the price.

kHckQ3Ff--o4-pXsoOFvBA.text: I absolutely love this buffet! Definitely one of the best buffers I've been to in the Las Vegas area. Like many others who have commented to staff there, it is better buy than Wicked Spoon and I actually prefer the food assortment. With a players card, it's $15 for Preferred (lowest status) card holders for lunch. It is a station casino so they honor the rewards cards. It's also very clean and service is awesome. Nice selection of elevated street foods. My friend and I enjoyed it so much we've decided to make it a monthly outing. Hopefully they maintain this establishment and nothing strays from the current standards they hold themselves to.

HvgS0a7SHjB7txxjG4DM0A.text: Gosh, I really wanted to love this place but, I didn't. I decided to try this place based on the good reviews but, wasn't impressed at all. The service was bad, and the food really isn't good. Our waitress never showed up with our drinks after letting her know that our lemonades were weak and asked for juice instead. We came here for lunch on a weekday and yes, the cost was fair but, that's about it. Its not a lot of variety of food dishes to choose from. The only beef option was a slider and the top of the bread was rock hard. Nothing was seasoned at all. The only chicken dish They had was salt and pepper wings that had neither seasonings. Not broccoli, string beans or any basic buffet foods. They had blackened catfish that looked more like a Mexican fish dish. I had mashed potatoes that still had huge chunks of raw potato in it that choked me. The pork loin and turkey I had was dry. Fried rice was hard as its been sitting out all day. Lunch started at 11, we arrived at noon. I have no idea why or how this place is 4 stars. $65 wasted. No, I won't be returning.

HkcIxRnx2XQauESaMpLvKA.text: This place is great and a real bargain. I am a local and here's the reasons why I like going to Palms and the A.Y.C.E. Buffet. First, there is no fee for parking. That is a HUUGE advantage the Palms has over the other casinos. Second, the casino is about top-notch as any casino on the strip. Third, the best reason to come here is the buffet. I have eaten here a couple of times since it opened. I ate here again today and I loved the service and the good quality of the food. The staff was very nice and the food was very fresh and tasty. I am always satisfied and anyone considering trying this place should look no further. Give it a try. Compared to other casinos on the Strip, with A.Y.C.E., the price is right and food is really great. I will definitely come back here, especially when family and friends visit Las Vegas, I will take them here.

AWHUKLLZvK8sf0Ftu6Kegg.text: Clean, food was very good, long line but worth the wait! The price was affordable for Las Vegas! Bottomless mimosas made for a fun brunch.

gXZ1t7yu0yYzQ23_88EovA.text: This is actually a very good buffet located at the Palms casino.   Off strip casino buffets are often inferior to their strip cousins, but this one is an exception.   The interior is modern and updated and, dare I say, maybe even a bit trendy?  Food stations are mostly along the back wall and are clearly labeled, clean, and well stocked. There is a carving station with turkey breast, beef, and sausage. There's a decent Asian food selection, plenty of American favorites, and interesting sounding international fare (Moroccan lamb anyone?). Many of the dishes are presented in small, single serve portions on small plates ala Wicked Spoon at Cosmo. They don't have crab legs which is fine with me but might annoy some. The dessert section is ample including ice cream and gelato, hot desserts like bread pudding, and some truly excellent macarons. These macarons really were far above the quality one would expect from a buffet especially considering how devilishly tricky they are to make (I know from experience)  Drinks are delivered by your server, and service was excellent throughout.   Topping it all off the price is excellent - around $20 for dinner. Very hard to beat and much less than the $40-$50 for strip buffets like Wicked Spoon.   AYCE is well worth the visit!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Modern decor

SbpwVcKfJ9IvVUtUAoY0cg.text: I'm not big on Buffet's but this place was good! Food was very tasty with a wide array if selection. What made the experience a good one was our attentive Server - Ele! If you come here hope you get this gentleman's great service! Good service goes a long way! Will definitely come back to A.Y.C.E.!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosas
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb stew, Turkey hash, New England Clam Boil
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts

Fmk9E9ygnXTDd9OfL6F4vQ.text: I was shopping around for a Buffet that had good ratings.  This one kept popping up...A bit off the strip..TOTALLY worth it!  No plastic food here! Everything was great! It's not your typical Buffet because the food is prepared in smaller batches so it's fresh. From the meats to the Asian,Mexican,Indian,American and more, it was really good! I went for lunch under $20 REALLY.  I had to wait in line about 20 minutes, but I would do it again.  I've put this on my list of return places to visit! Casino was well laid out too and very clean. Make this a place to stop, good parking as well and no charge! Enjoy!

htF9-vHIZB7_eiXnfxocmA.text: This buffet is awesome!! Best I've had in a while, and I've been living in Vegas for 16 years. Lots of dishes to choose from. They had red curry mussles (amazing!!) chicken wings are bomb! Chicken pot pie was top notch (hint of rosemary) they had baked cauliflower to be sliced. Lots of different veggie dishes to choose from. Even ratatouille! Bread pudding was great as well, I even had a second portion. Our server was awesome as well. Her name is Kazi! So sweet. She was a delight! We spoke to the manager before we left about the awesome changes since it's reopened. Fantastic job!! We will return!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benny, broccoli and cheddar quiche, hash browns, sausage, bacon
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg white fritatta, quinoa and cauliflower grits Cheese blintz, hash browns, sausage, bacon and my fav, Rainbow chard and sweet potato hash.

JMKGsOiqxkUKCMMBj6T-ZA.text: It should be 5 stars but it's a buffet 4.5* but I could go with 5! I'm a regular having been there for breakfast, lunch, weekends, & even holiday dates!  - No sizeable line to speak of, worst case was 20 people ; smallest line was no one else & got right in - pricing is inexpensive & 1/2 the cost compared to other buffets of similar quality & uniqueness like Bacchanal, Wicked Spoon, Bellagio - Healthy foods at a buffet like buffalo cauliflower, hummus, quinoa....  - gluten free like rice congee, macarons...  - more vegetarian stuff than anywhere else like beet hummus, rainbow chard, farrow, rainbow artisan cauliflower in purple & orange, baba ganoush, cous cous salad  - Something for everyone like chilaquiles, corned beef hash with nicely poached egg, ham, turkey, pizza, shrimp cocktail in a pail....  - unusual stuff not seen at other buffets like lamb, farro, white elotes, hot CheetosTM elotes regular CheetosTMelotes, ceviche, salt & pepper wings/drumsticks  - try something you've not had before without feeling like you wasted any money like fresh lemonade with chia seeds (maybe chia's more mainstream than I know?) or shaksouka  - the menu changes so it's different stuff even if I've gone there over 20 times it's definitely still exciting (well, I lead a very calm life)  - chocolate dipped strawberries, gelato, mini m & m's, key lime parfait  - really great service on clearing stuff & refreshing your coffee, tea, or milk, soda  -hey, I even answered a bunch of questions about this AYCE buffet to help people out like not closing in between breakfast to lunch to dinner  PS see you there, I'm going to do a yelp event here!!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Revival 1st section in ayce
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 elotes, sushi, hummus, 2 salt &amp; pepper mini drummies
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. choc croissant, muffin crumble, long croissant, bacon, peanut butter little dessert with chic coin, quiche with cheese in scalloped dish

lZsXcwSAPeXhwl9eOdOu_w.text: All the reviews are True. This buffet is simple, delicious, and AFFORDABLE.   I have been pretty disappointed with the way the buffets in Vegas have increased their prices so much over the last 4 years to the point where a family of 4 will cost around $200 for a meal. When you think of Vegas, you think oh...yes...will eat a buffet. Now it's kind of..which one is decent enough to shell out 40-50 bucks at.   Well here at AYCE, the service is excellent, the food great, and the entire facility is clean! There isn't a huge line you'd need to wait for and parking is free.  With a free players card, you'd look to pay $19.99 for dinner instead of $21.99 and if you are gold status you're getting your meal for $17.99.   Definitely worth it. I will say however, this buffet might not make everyone happy as the item selection is a bit smaller, and they do not have a massive amount of seafood. The meals are simple and straightforward but it will be a good meal.

otIjufNr4Je0SHEVIkmAsg.text: The service was so good here! Benjie was so attentive, he made sure our tables were cleared and drinks were filled. Food was amazing. I found so many  keto friendly options and they even offered sugar free desserts.   If you'd like to see how I stay keto friendly options while dining out, check me out @yourketobestfriend on Instagram

uO8lAJC1-dYhItpCbFv5Cg.text: Wow with high ratings and reviews AYCE buffet at the Palms casino looks promising but a big let down. I came in on a Saturday morning for lunch and the line was moving smoothly the wait time was under 25 mins. For almost spending $20 it was a big disappointment on their selections of foods. The only thing that was standing out was their fried rice.   3/5 average & ok  Fried rice Hot links Turkey Service  Pizzas  Ice tea Their pop mix contemporary music   1/5 super meh   Sushi was like gas station quality  Egg drop soup tasted more like sesames oil soup super meh Spending almost $20 for lunch  Their selections for each station was a big disappointment   This would be my first and last time dining at the AYCE Palms Buffet and also the Buffet at the SunCoast was no different but here you can taste some quality but the selections of foods was a big let down. So far cheap buffets at the Orleans is good enough for this mid high roller. Also their team of  valet is a complete joke it took them so long that I might need a pillow to fall asleep. No wonder I visited other casinos not here at the Palms.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ok pizza, crappy sushi&#39;s at least the fried rice was decent.
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their cod to me was off on flavoring trying to make Brazilian or Cuban food

RmeOk-MRz9AFwMoTkf_6iQ.text: One gripe. They do not post prices straight up. They have like 4 different prices, depending on whether you have a club card, and what type of card.  Hard to pick that up as price is posted for 5 seconds only on outside boards. So I ended up paying $5 more than I was expecting per person.  That said, very good buffet for the price.   Very good meats, some salmon, good veggies.  Deserts good, salads okay.  Worth returning to, as seems the norm for Vegas buffet

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kkyQoCpoa2oRGX2EaRSEEQ.text: Great food and a really great value for an AYCE buffet in Vegas!  The restaurant is super clean and very inviting.  It doesn't have as big of a selection as some other places, but there's still plenty of choices and enough variety to suit most palates.  Overall, the quality of the food was great.  I thought the brisket was a bit dry and there were a few other things that I didn't care for, but I found things that I really enjoyed and filled up a lot.  The dessert bar was a bit lackluster, but again, there were so many other things that were great.  For its price, I don't think you can beat it.  It may not be the fanciest buffet in Vegas, but it's still a great restaurant and has a very appealing atmosphere.  We came as a group of 7 on a Sunday night during St. Patrick's Day so we waited about 30 minutes to get a table, so it definitely does get busy, but it wasn't terrible.  Our server was very friendly and came around often to refill our water glasses.  Overall, I think it's the best buffet for its value in Vegas!

8QQKr3mCRmWIQV2q92mXpQ.text: I've been to this buffet every time I visit Vegas but this time has been the most disappointing lunch of them all. Just to list some of the problems, the fried calamari was all soggy the sushi rice was still raw and hard in the middle, the chicken wings were really salty, the fried catfish was covered in too much wet and soggy batter. When I spoke to the manager she was not helpful and said we paid cash so there was no receipt and they had no records of us dining there. Probably the last time I'll eat here to be honest. There are plenty of other good buffets for the same price.

vawqBjnev_SgWK6HDwnwZQ.text: This is an amazing buffet. Maybe not the widest selection in town, but the quality is unbeatable. I recommend getting there at about 3:15pm. This way you pay for lunch and at 4pm they switch to dinner. Beware though, there will be a bit of a line. We also found the best server in town here. Her name is Nazi. She's a sweetheart. Very courteous and on our second trip there, she remembered everything the way we liked it, even though it had been a while. Now we always ask for her.  Also, if you need anything special like I do, just ask to speak to the Sous Chef, Michael. He is very accommodating. Also, accolades to Facia, the Front of the House Manager. She is amazing as well. Extremely pleasant to deal with. We now make visiting A.Y.C.E. a weekly ritual. See you there!!

3dwVFbCvQJGFKsIhkPpp5Q.text: Love this buffet! It's great for locals as well. You can get a discount with your players card and if you gamble you can get dinning coupons. I really enjoy the lunch time buffet. They have a lasagna that is pretty delicious. Today I went and they had fried calamari which they usually don't have and that was pretty good. The spicy deep fried wings are my all time favorite. They also have a vegan option which is great for a lot of people who live meat free. Their zucchini noodles in tomato sauce is great and they also have grilled tofu with mushrooms. The dessert station lacks a bit but I'm pretty picky when it comes to desserts. I'm a repeat visitor and enjoy AYCE every time I'm there and the staff is very friendly which is a plus.   Updating my review to a five star because of their breakfast buffet. Went to the breakfast buffet the other morning and it was freaking delicious!!! Churro waffle, egg white frittata, pancakes, bacon I mean the choices were endless! Then they had a tapioca pudding which was my favorite. I seriously can not wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yogurt parfait, watermelon salad, egg white frittata, fresh squeezed juice and tapioca pudding.

Xo7tB77m5T8qG7Ylf8oGRA.text: Quality food for a good price and great service to boot. It's one of the smaller buffets but still has a good selection. Chef Mike and manager Mary are attentive, friendly, and went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of.  Give this buffet a try and you'll be satisfied for the money.

qnnA03z2NnWl8s_P84U7rQ.text: This place is so good! First time at this renovated Buffet. I came here for EDC weekend and it was so good that my group came here twice! Once for dinner and a second time during lunch hours. Interior is very modern, and I love the layout and design of the food categories. I enjoyed a variety of dishes, especially the brisket cuts of steak and salads. I'm glad they had more asian flavors here as well. One thing that I didn't like unfortunately was the wait time for my group, even at those hours. It took us a while to be seated even though there were plenty of seats obviously available. But nonetheless, really great buffet.

HefJSZpwlgie4LAkNqrlrQ.text: This is the only buffet I will go to, with the exception of wicked spoon - if friends happen to be in town, the only type of AYCE I frequently go to is sushi, but this place has a wide enough variety and has mini tuna poke with like three options of rolls, veggie options as well.   I highly recommend trying the hot Cheeto Mac and Cheese, tastes like the sauce is even Tabasco spicy without the sprinkled hot Cheeto crumbs, they also have hot Cheeto corn! The sliders are bomb too w crispy French onion, they have an excellent dessert variety of ice cream pastries I tried the caramel ice cream, rich but not overly sweet. Gravy and turkey mashed potatoes are flavorful, they have the plates already portioned into a neater presentation than the self serve buffets that can get gross looking. I have yet to try everything, but I hear the time between lunch and dinner is best for both menu options. Will be back, with the remodeling and rebrand I'm loving the palms, now if only the bunnie servers would return..

3LVv_zGaAmGXklO3o_rYOQ.text: This place was pretty good for the price.  My family and I were looking for something cheaper than Bacchanal Buffet but still had good food, and so I stumbled upon A.Y.C.E while browsing through Yelp. I'm glad I found it! For the most part, the food was good. The selection is pretty good and a couple of dishes gave off a gourmet vibe. However, there were a few dishes that didn't quite hit the mark in my opinion. The Hot Cheetos-covered elote (wow!) was something I was really excited to try, but the corn was chewy rather than sweet and fresh and the Cheetos dust seemed a tiny bit soggy instead of crunchy and light. They also have an original flavored one and nacho cheese-covered option. The chicken parmesan as well as the French onion burger that I tried were also a bit dry. Other than a couple of dishes, everything else was pretty tasty! They even had mini portions of "poke on rice" which was surprisingly good.  If you're looking to save some money and still get a pretty good selection of buffet-style food, A.Y.C.E. is worth trying.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uJl21RxNbnJUXlRtt-s7Bw.text: Save yourself!! Don't bother coming here. I wouldn't even come back for free, that's how gross! For such a big buffet, their selections sucks. They have all these food stations but hardly any items in each. Their white rice was burnt and hard. Two of the soup containers were completely empty, their rolls were like rocks. The items with tongs for a utensil were blazing hot! They need to change that. Many things I didn't even bother trying because my hand was burning to try.   Oh, can't leave this out. I got a nice piece of turkey and put a big spoonful of cranberry on top. Get to my table and take a bite and yuck!!! It wasn't cranberry, it was grape jelly! They changed it out but that killed my appetite. I still attempted to have a piece of pizza, how bad can cheese pizza be right? Gross! Even their deserts were disgusting.

FNCY-A06l4VbDNWVb8PcpA.text: We came here on a Monday night, which also happens to be Christmas Eve. At 6:45pm the line was about 40-50 people deep, and it took about 45 minutes to get seated. The food is mostly American with a carving station, salad bar (not too big, no real variety, even less fruit options), Mexican (make your own tacos, cerviche, etc.) and Asian (California rolls, BBQ pork, sauteed snow peas, egg drop soup, etc.). There also a small dessert bar with bite sized cakes and gelato.  The good: the New England clam bake was pretty flavorful, especially the soup which was a bit spicy but full of flavor. The brisket from the carving station was good, although my wife got two other pieces that were not. The gelato was good, although my pistachio was just a bit too sweet.  The bad: Pretty much all the food besides what I pointed out above was bland, nothing provided a really tasty bite.   The decor was nice and modern and provided a nice atmosphere to enjoy dining. The service from our server was exceptional, which is why it's three stars instead of two. I was pretty hungry and came with not high expectations, but was still disappointed in the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini wedge salad, cerviche, shrimp cocktail
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert station

gvMw4pMNml9nNugfZ9-RYA.text: Located inside the casino between the two tall Palms hotel towers is a buffet that more people should pay a visit to.  On the other hand, maybe not as I'd hate to stand in line for a long time to get a seat!  Don't let the older venue and low buffet price deter you from coming here.    Craving a good buffet but unwilling to stand in line for hours at one of the popular buffets on the Strip, I thought I'd give this one shot since it was not too far away. It was a good decision.  While the cost of the buffet is about one-half (sometimes even more) of the typical popular buffet prices found, what they lacked in quantity A.Y.C.E. made up in quality.  This is not to say that they didn't have a lot of food.  They still have a very good selection of food to choose from.  Like many buffets, the food is arranged by themes such as meats, Asian, Mexican, salads, etc. What they didn't have compared to the pricier venues were the typical crab legs and big shrimp.  No loss as what they did have and the low cost more than made up for it.    I'd rate the quality of the food items from 3 to 4 stars, service 4 stars, and value 5.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zRHmf9bwRulVKbvr4iheGg.text: Best deal in vegas    It's the only buffet I have eaten at since I lived here 2 years.  Been here about 10 times to eat and it's always great

7g5LQFqTfFWGB-3wCXGQOA.text: Was one of the best dinner go to with all you can eat crab legs, but not anymore after Station Casinos bought Palms. Thinking still okay even without the crabs legs, Nope Its just another regular/standard buffet and nothing exciting. Price is the same with out crabs too. Family and I won't be back.

Wai-OelNj-KWL_GuZ4xJEQ.text: Can't say enough of our awesome visit to the AYCE. Food was good, service was excellent and we'll definitely come back again soon

ZQ-9dza8Yv5WIHOw8C-lkQ.text: What's the hype to this? They may have had something going for them four months ago but I wasn't impressed when I went here mid April for a weekday dinner ($17.99).  I did not see any of the individual juice bottles that have been posted here. Plus I thought there were going to be a bigger selection. The buffet was smaller than I thought and the food wasn't too fresh and it took awhile for items to be replenished.  As a local, I would much rather go to the M Buffet instead. A weekday dinner is actually around the same price as this buffet.  Hopefully they will revamp and add more selections as time goes on. But I came, I saw, I tried and unfortunately won't be coming back anytime soon.

icEEhqrX2x_KhIP_wxF3MQ.text: Wait was 40 minutes for Sunday dinner. Quality, price, selection & appearance is excellent. Numerous meats were all flavorful, moist & tender. Salt & pepper wings were lightly seasoned. Enjoyed all the different elote & cheesy macs. No crab legs. Shrimp cocktail, ceviche, mussels, fish, & New England boil. There is a vegan section, tried the grilled tofu steak which was surprisingly good.  French onion soup was ok. Service was attentive & friendly. My new favorite off-strip buffet.

OZfWI9FwpN90wPaxCB0L5g.text: Came here for dinner with my dad one day as we had received a BOGO coupon offer in the mail. Since Palm's was recently acquired by Station Casinos, their players card is now the "Boarding Pass" system. (great ! cuz i never had palm's lol). At $23.80 w/ coupon for 2 people, eh why not try it out, right?   The A.Y.C.E. buffet is a newly renovated buffet that Palm's had done in the recent few months. My friend had came here for Brunch soon after our vacay in December and said the food was really good. Since then, been mildly wanting to try this place.   Like most buffets, there are separate sections.   Sweet & Light (Dessert) - pistachio and cappuccino gelato. both were nice. cappuccino had a decent amount of coffee flavor. there was this cafe latte pudding thing there too. Surprisingly, flavor-wise, it was like a cafe latte, without sugar (like how i'd order from a coffee shop). strong coffee flavor. borderline bitter for a dessert. LOL maybe they forgot the sugar. xD   Smoke & Fire (BBQ) - Tried pork ribs and brisket. Pork ribs were super dry and hard to eat. Brisket was nicely flavored with a good bite, and a nice amount of smokiness. Not overly fatty but at this point, was full already. Lol i saw they had turkey legs but looked really dry.   The Hearth (Italian) - Pizzas... made to order pasta station...? Pizzas/calzones/etc looked horrible so i didn't touch any of this. And the made-to-order pasta station was unmanned for half the meal. When there was someone, they were behind on orders.   Somewhere in between here had a small "bucket" that has a crawfish overhanging the side with clams, mussels, shrimp in a light broth. Everything in this was overcooked. Full of broken shells and empty shells. I didn't find a single piece of clam despite having like 4 empty clams Lol... Shrimp was small, similar to the one offered in shrimp cocktail  The Roastery (Carving Station) - Surprisingly, the roast beef/prime rib was really well cooked and tender. They have a roasted cauliflower here too. Totally forgot to get it after being surprised at the thick cut of prime rib the carver gave me. Lol Add some sour cream w/ some horseradish, and some au jus to the prime rib and you're golden. The have elote (mexican street corn on a cob) in 3 different ways. Hot cheeto? dorito?, normal, and something else. Small portions poked with a skewer. The corn surprisingly is cooked well and not super soft, like most buffets.   World Pan (Asian) - Of all things, surprisingly the honey walnut shrimp was good. Lol. The shrimp was nicely cooked and had a nice firm bite. Sauce was nice and creamy.   I think there was one more section but i forgot to look at it Lol   Oh the soup and salad station in the middle, right in front of the entrance had a few soups, fruits, and salad. As well as ceviche and shrimp cocktail, peeled and in individual serving containers.   During or rather near end of my meal, i had realized what this buffet had reminded me of. Red Rock Casinos buffet. Then again, it is now the same company so not that surprising. Also, with a mild hint of Cosmopolitan with their individual plating, cute but mildly annoying at the same time Lol.. They had a lot of "mislabeled" stuff. I dont remember exactly example of things but it wasn't what was labeled.   For the price i paid, and a full meal, without any "after meal complications", it wasn't bad. But even at the price i paid, i'm not that sure if i'd return again. Not much seafood options. With the options they had, really small and overcooked. "Best" thing they had was probably the roast beef/prime rib. I mean, then again, $12/person w/ bogo offer for prime rib dinner, i guess that works..   where was the raclette station some reviews had mentioned? gelato ice cream sandwich? whaaaa ?   Service was pretty good. Our waitress had our drinks really fast, and new ones even before the previous ones were empty. Plates were cleared before you returned to your table.

Vu6ZsGvEbzPS4yapbJHDSg.text: Our server Jose R. brought our food orders fast and was polite. He was fast in serving other tables as well

Sq2wsF7huOC4AD_L9s60Xw.text: Yo! I love this buffet! This is the 'poor mans wicked spoon (cosmo buffet)'. It's reasonably priced with or without a station's card. Vegan options available. Many items are pre-plated which I find to be more sanitary. Sugar-free dessert options available. Staff is quick to clear tables and refill drinks. I've been a number of times for lunch, and hope to try breakfast soon.

_0ERZztyrNI8AeWgaSgOYg.text: Best buffet in vegas. The smoked brisket is amazing and the big dude Jose with glasses was super helpful and went and got me extra sauce. Definitely will be back

E0W-PcHabvXzC5xU_WJm4Q.text: MARIA MARIA MARIA = MIMOSA MIMOSA MIMOSA the wait staff (MARIA) is out of this world. She treated us like VIP's and nothing was out of reach. We never had to worry about lifting a fork because of her service. They're not even 'bottomless' mimosas because she never let them go that long--theyre 'half' mimosas because that's when she would refill them. Her table service was out of this world and just a cool person in general. Shout out to the whole staff tho--we tried to find the manager to compliment Maria but was mistaken. So huge brownie points for carrying yourselves with that much ownership and confidence!!!!!! We got talking with Facia and instantly fell more in love (and that's not the mimosas talking). Amazing place with amazing people--just reach out and talk to them!!  #LoxBegalsForLife

Sqo7hXH-z4k-V1xAyZsmOg.text: This place is absolutely horrid. We waited an hour to get in, to find out that they do not have most of what is advertised on their website. No poke. No ribs. No raclette. When we asked about this, they told us there is "no guaranteed menu". Beyond that, quality of the food is terrifying. We went to the Bacchanal at Caesars and the Wynn buffet before coming here; if you have tried that caliber of buffet, do NOT come here. The meat was tough, the biscuits were literally raw dough inside. Our server was very kind but the food is just absolutely horrid. Do not be drawn in by the price like we were, It's not worth it.

5ebGLysqJsFmNlovGH1u8g.text: Now in its third month of operation and still doing good volume, opening during the holidays a smart move that allowed early kinks to be resolved before convention season, Friday night found A.Y.C.E. Buffet at The Palms particularly busy with a broad mix of patrons including Body Builders, Locals and tourists in town to watch the Final Four.  Currently celebrating Passover with a variety of traditional Jewish dishes in addition to the 'usual' items described as a "celebration of All-You-Can-Eat," seven stations spread over a sizable footprint divided by cooking method and concept, it was just prior to 6:00pm that three guests arrived before the rush and found quick seating at a banquet near "World Pan," everyone taking a moment to peruse the choices and plate number one comprised of Walnut Prawns every bit as good as what one will find on Spring Mountain Road plus spicy Noodles and respectable General Tso's Chicken.  Again impressed by such a radical departure from Station Casinos' Feast brand of Buffet, everything from the decor to individual servings rivaling the standard set by Caesars' Bacchanal or Cosmo's Wicked Spoon, it was working with small portions that plates two and three took a look at several of the  Passover options plus a Dinner Roll and surprisingly light French Macarons, the Chopped Liver rich and creamy while Matzo Brei, Soup and Stuffing were all pleasant, though limited personal experience prevents comment as to whether others would think they were great.  Executed under the direction of Chef Joseph Kudrak, his time with Station Casinos at Red Rock earning him a role overseeing Palms Casino Resort as a whole, it was with plate four that the first misfire of the evening arrived in the form of watery Lasagna with overly sweet Sauce, the Stromboli and smoked Ratatouille a far better example of A.Y.C.E.'s Italian offerings while the French Onion Soup topped in gooey Cheese is also worth a taste.  Taking a look at the Roastery plus Smoke & Fire next, sliced-to-order Roast Beef faring better than chewy smoked Brisket while Ribs, Turkey and Morrocan Lamb Stew were all better than one might ever expect at a Buffet, those avoiding Meat will be happy to know that Herb Roasted Cauliflower, Mushroom Quesadillas and Cornbread are all very good while the layered pan of Jack Fruit Enchiladas may just be the best savory item on the whole Buffet.   Priced at just $21.99 for Dinner, Station's Boarding Pass saving each guest $4, Dessert offers a whole island of items that shifts from morning to evening, the aforementioned Macarons as good as what is offered at the end of a meal at Le Cirque while miniature Carrot Cake, Cheesecake Parfaits, Lemon Meringue Tarts and Vegan Coconut Cookies all stand out amongst a collection that even goes so far as to account for dietary restrictions such as Sugar or Gluten Free.  Wrapping up with made-to-order Cookie Sandwiches plus three large-format Desserts, the Apple Cobbler and Fudge Brownie both nice landing pads for Soft Serve plus a variety of toppings, it warrants repeating that no visit to A.Y.C.E. should end without a heaping scoop of Cinnamon Roll Bread Pudding plus or minus Ice Cream, Gelato or Caramel because save for *perhaps* what is offered at The Kitchen at Atomic there is none better in Sin City...and theirs is $8 a slice.  ****1/2:  Sure some will point out the lack of (thin, frozen) Crab Legs or U20+ Shrimp, but at less than 1/2 the price and 1/4 the wait for Bacchanal or Wynn it speaks volumes of Chef Kudrak and his team that only two of fifty items tasted from A.Y.C.E.'s Dinner Buffet were disappointing while several were good enough that they could be menu items elsewhere - including Restaurants charging double on The Strip.

aOUQiTvAtWz2c_yWVMXldg.text: Pretty good All You Can Eat Buffet! Plus comparing it with the prices throughout Vegas with all the buffets you can't beat the price.. Most Vegas buffets are anywhere between $50 to $60 dollars. But this one was pretty much half the price... They have a wide variety of food ranging from American, Asian, Mexican, etc. Plus their dessert bar was pretty good, with a lot of different types of ice cream and finger food desserts..   Definitely will be back once I'm here in Vegas.

EvhkWIriY-7QW8sgigz2-w.text: Good value, around $15 per person for lunch buffet! There were lots of varieties of foods, such as dumplings, sushi and mini desserts.  Though the wait was a bit long, at least half an hour. So recommend to avoid the peak hour when coming here.

nRc0aEnBbPkivN6CJf3rKQ.text: Stopped by for a quick meal and WOW! This buffet is so tasty. Try different types of food and it was fantastic. I have to bring my wife!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9lsWIjki-Vo6E-e_jVCVCw.text: First time here in nearly 6 years. They improved it immensely since then. Especially if you like sushi, of which neither my wife nor I do. Lots of little pre-dished items to pick from, as well.   We generally eat a bite of this and a bite of that, so that works out great for us.  Our 2-4-1 coupon really made this a keeper for us.

WpgV87_CceWHmewubNUMlQ.text: BEST BUFFET IN LAS VEGAS . Hands down .  First off , Palms is incredible . Even the casino feels and smells clean and inviting . Way better then the old icky smoke you normally smell walking into any casino in Vegas . Then, the buffet is almost a farmhouse , home cooked meal feel . It's also very clean and the staff is happy and approachable and their prices are sooo much cheaper then other buffets !  So stop searching and drop in here !

X26ERv0ueYSAdH4WPE3dCg.text: I researched on Yelp quite a bit before settling on this buffet.  I had heard it fashioned itself after Wicked Spoon in a lot of its presentation style but didn't kick you in the guts in terms of price.  As long as you register for a players card through the hotel, there is a nominal discount, but even without, the prices are decent at all times of the day.   For us, there was no line for dinner, and the cashier, hostesses, and server were all pleasant. We were sat in a central area which wasn't too loud or crowded and kept us close enough that the food wasn't a hike away from the table. So far so good.   The food was just good. It was definitely nothing to write home to grandma about. There were some highlights for me though. The wedge salad was a nice fresh starter. My only complaint was the light amount of dressing.  The fingerling potatoes were delicious. They had a hearty amount of vegetarian dishes which I thought was great.  I really enjoyed the Asian fare, as did my husband. We brought my stepson, who is 14 here and he thoroughly enjoyed it. I'm pretty sure he cleaned at least four plates full of food and he is a finicky eater.  All in all, for us, as a family of four that didn't want to break the bank but wanted to try a nice buffet, we were absolutely satisfied. I would come again.

sZYcO10zPFbUp_4C3Mgxcg.text: Best Buffet I ever been to the servers are good. The food is amazing. Yanet was an amazing server always checked on us. Made sure she took plates in timely manner. I love this place assistant manager Mary check on us and talked to us she's great. This place is great .

WJkzsk-lHCNfrthjGWiO5w.text: Great food. Great service. Christopher was very attentive. Came in for the weekend brunch and have no complaints. Wonderful selection of food. The dessert bar was the best I have seen in quite some time. Will definitely  be back.

xphtsBWECSD7-48Map1yTw.text: I was in town and wanted to try the newly renovated A.Y.C.E. buffet.  I read the 4 star reviews.  We came in at 10:30am for breakfast and was told that here were no more breakfast item and were to be charged lunch prices.  I was okay with that because I really wanted to check out the buffet.  Also, the price was very reasonable.  Our Host Tyreshia and Server Jonathon were outstanding.  The atmosphere was nice.  But the food was not fresh and appealing.  A lot of the items needed to be refilled or stirred.  Lots of spills on the counters, maybe from breakfast crowd. The omelette/pasta station was still open.  When it was my turn to order, the cook said no more omelettes, just fried eggs.  He said the same thing to the lady behind me.  The only thing different about the buffet was the kicked up a notch corn on the cob.  Mexican station was missing salsa or pico for my beef taco.  The tortillas were in two small steel bowls with cover.  But they were dry and hard.  Regardless, taco meat was good.  The desserts were not memorable.  The best things in the buffet were the little bread sticks and chicken pot pie.   The bread sticks were baked perfect.  It was still hot and were delicious!

W13DCwgF6jqwSaqWHzK4VA.text: the Chinese section n smoke section is amazing, rest is ok, dessert is very good, also got hand made ice cream cookie, made to order

kMU1IYv2skgcaDwKrVBYug.text: I am not one to eat at buffets, but A.Y.C.E is an exception to this rule. Before I even walked into the buffet, I was greeted by several staff members, welcoming me to the buffet. They were friendly, but not over the top. Once seated, my server immediately asked for my beverage order & continued to check in on me throughout my dining experience. The excellent Customer Service did not go unnoticed. The buffet area is HUGE. There was definitely a lunch crowd, but I was able to walk up to each station, without wait, and the food was always fresh and readily available. Being born and raised in the South, I consider myself a seafood snob, but the sushi station offered fresh tuna and salmon. I'll admit, I did get seconds. And I really like the creative spin on presentation. Single serve items like the mac&cheese & chicken pot pie were easy to grab and still left room on my plate to add more items. The dining area was clean, and I didn't really feel like I was seated in a buffet. I'll be returning to A.Y.C.E. sooner than later, for sure!

f710seJq9knz3K3fOqzfvw.text: Had a great experience this morning when we needed it the most. Lol. Vegas will do that to ya. Mary Girard the manager was very helpful in accommodating our needs as a group when a few of our friends showed up late. Mary made sure our friends didn't have to wait in the long line and got them right in so thank you very much. The food was great between the variety and how tasty the Salt and Pepper wings were, the Chili verde was amazing and the biscuits and gravy were delicious.  To top it off our server Ele was great our Mimosas were never empty he was very attentive, friendly and made us feel at home. To find out Ele was a veteran to the palms I was not surprised because he was very good at his job.  Thank you

0SmptnmOGZp3l_f6SRvhLQ.text: Vegan buffet area for my honey and he was so please. Great selection, awesome price. They had a small leak because of the storm but the staff was super polite. And the soup area was amazing, I'm a big soup person so this was big for me. Turkey was a bit dry and beef ribs didn't fall off the bone but the quality of the food was really good. Amazing vday menu but lunch and dinner is the same if your vegan, that was my reason for 4 not 5 stars but a great buffet none the less

D6NsA81byC_zXqx2EjJJRA.text: This was by far the best food we had while in Vegas. We did the brunch on the weekend and used a buy one get one from the American casino guide coupon book. LVA has one too. It was a steal! It's been a few weeks, and I'm still talking about. They had salmon, that was delicious, spicy Mac and cheese, smoked salmon, French toast, the best ice cream and the best mousse. I wish I could go back now!

Zj_UJy2KjA9PDj8Gbd4jMQ.text: First time here. Food was great quality. Waiter Dwight was nice and friendly. Would definitely recommend and return.

v2AyMvuLD8mUzr8Fd3pBpw.text: SO much variety (entrees from different cultures, a salad bar, dessert bar, and did I mention an ice cream machine!), great customer service... from the attentive server, to the friendly host and the cashier who kindly put in a refund after I signed up for a player's card (tip: half off, and free to sign up- but do it before you go to brunch!) I will be back here for brunch next time I visit las vegas!!   Thanks for your wonderful staff, AYCE. Welcoming atmosphere indeed.

hJAir2fAZ5EeaYlgEgPaaA.text: Well darn, Sunday Brunch on 4/27 was disappointing. Our server wasn't very attentive to our table of 3, and whenever we were able to get her attention for water refills she somehow complied to our requests without a word or looking at us. A simple "yes" or any comment would've been the very least. We tried to back off as much as possible to give her a chance to redeem herself, but ultimately that kind of service ended up souring our experience.  As for the food, way different than the last time I came here about a year ago when it was new and trying to prove itself (partly the reason why I came back). Now it truly tastes like a cheap $20 buffet worth. Carving meats were dry (resulting in tough texture) and oversalted, particularly the prime rib. No pressed juices, just overbaked and "meh" veggie/vegan dishes on the Rejuvinate counter. The battered shrimp in the honey shrimp walnuts were soggy. I'm sure the buffalo mac and cheese with hot Cheetoh topping must be appealing for some people, but there are countless other dishes to offer for brunch instead of that. Eggs were dry/stale and bacon was way too thin to have that crispy savory taste. Seafood boil was just okay. Mixed greens and some of the other veggie toppings at the salad bar were never restocked while my party was there. The best dish I ate was the smoked salmon, with a small bagel and whatever cream cheese was left for me to scrape off of the bowl.  My friend who was with me is lactose intolerant, and there was no alternative non-dairy milks for her coffee and no non-dairy ice cream/gelato options.   2-stars because if you're staying at the Palms and just want to eat at a buffet on the cheap, then here you go.  But I'm not coming back here again for a meal. For $20+, there are more than enough food options to go to in Vegas, especially off the strip.

7-d3o9_9CvaMFB3_KZqXDA.text: I went to this restaurant for the first time after the casino was renovated. If you have a player card, you will save $2 on top of the original price so it is a good idea to get one before heading down to the restaurant. The lunch price is around 15.99 and 17.99 for dinner. The restaurant is beautiful and has a variety of food from asian to American. Keep in mind the size of the restaurant is nothing compared to Wicked spoon or Wynn buffet. However, the price is unbeatable. It has a good variety of foods and desserts: asian fried rice, dumpling, roasted chicken, pizzas, ice cream , cookies and so on but unfortunately when I was there, there was no macaron. The foods are great but some of them were cold and little bit salty. Overall, I think it is worth the money specially u can't beat that price on the strip.

7dxdVc1xPfdxv16W5N48GA.text: Came here for Sunday brunch which featured bottomless mimosas all for $22 dollars total instead of the regular $13 week day breakfast price.   There are a lot of food options, not just an egg/bacon/sausage/bread breakfast spread which was nice, however, I was disappointed in the quality of food. I tried a little bit of almost everything they had and the meat was overcooked and tough as was the case with a lot of their other dishes. I was excited to see they had shrimp, but they tasted freshly defrosted....they had a wet, soggy half frozen taste to them which was not pleasant at all.  I did not enjoy 85% of the food I tried at this buffet and that is very sad to me. The dessert was very good though and the staff were very friendly.

Mt7S-HDuwo1vGhvf61ycVw.text: I gave it 4 stars because of the price. I signed up for a players card and got a $2.00 discount.  We got to the restaurant about 3:45 not knowing dinner started at 4:00 They gave us the lunch price $15.35 including tax.. what was left of the lunch was very cold. They might need better warming lights. The dinner food that came out was good. Average may be a better term but for $15 who's complaining.  The salt & pepper chicken wings were everyone's favorite.  I was excited to try the different corns but they were very cold and not very good.  The carving station had brisket and the two pieces I got were all fat..so I don't know how that was. The dessert bar was good. A little disappointed they didn't have the French Macarons like pictures on their website.. maybe I should lower my rating to 3 for that reason only.  I'll be back be because of the price!

dlMIARU9RWNEv_v1UrFlqA.text: The best buffet we've ever went to in Las Vegas. Everything is fresh and delicious. The price is very reasonable compared to all other buffets we went to. And above all the service is great. Thanks Josh. Definitely will go back there.

UEwV0faJ4dCk4yXWQBgurA.text: My wife and I went to the Palms casino buffet to try a new buffet (for us).  We really enjoyed the spicy cauliflower, which wasn't terribly spicy. I loved the pizza because it was really hot, like right out of the oven!! The pasta was very good, the sauce especially tasty. The sel mei was better than most that I have ever tasted (since I am Asian). The Carolina BBQ sauce had a delicious kick. The sausage was very tasty. The shepherd's pie was very rich, and the kalbi was quite tough. (See review of Treasure Island buffet for their kalbi!!) The highlight of the desserts for us were the cream puffs. Yummy!!   Better than many buffets, fairly reasonable cost, $22 for dinner.

PzXqoPF7UV_tUh-DZAByEA.text: Love this buffet! The food was fresh and i love the portion sizes it just keeps you begging for more without overindulging. I met Chef Adrian who runs the buffet he was very friendly and helpful. If it wasn't for him I would have had a bad allergic reaction I almost tried the walnut shrimp. Thanks Chef! I'll be coming back because of you.

qTUCNUsXp2ktl9fD0GTcRw.text: I guess you get what you pay for. $15 for dinner is what we paid at a discount with your players card. Not much of selection. The wait in that Disney land line that looped you around and around was horrible. Half the deserts were gone and they told us theyre not going to replace anymore because it was closing soon. Like 45 minutes left. I would've had more time if the line wasn't long. I think I would've been more satisfied at the McDonald's in their food court for half the cost!

_iJpvvwSOsORjx7PuhZ-ig.text: Second time coming here and we got the server by the name of Josh both times. He was very attentive and helpful for our large group. Food is always good with a variety of options. Definitely recommend this place if you like buffets!

exCPEwT_ozIcuLev6MZMKw.text: Most excellent buffet.  We went twice in two days.  Clean saw no one smoking. Great restrooms great service.   I ate sushi while family had breakfast    Well Maintained  place nothing broken or missing

Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mO7FNSLVY0watzKFvrNLig.text: I was very impressed by this buffet, especially for the price (~$15). The meats in carving station were much better then I expect at this price point. The brisket in particular was excellent. Most of the small plates and salad bar were quite fresh as well. The staffers were quite friendly.   The minor negatives: much smaller then other buffets in Vegas so you won't get the variety you may see elsewhere. The small fish entrees (tuna I believe) with pureed cauliflower was very dry like it had been sitting out for too long.  I'd highly recommend this place when looking for an off-strip buffet at a solid price without a long wait.

_nUkCddDkLBoqpUiBYBCBQ.text: Honestly, I probably wouldn't eat here for free. Wait was a bit long. The food selection is pretty limited compared to other buffets. The flavor of most things were blah. The biggest disappointment overall was the poor quality crawfish as most were very small and had black tails. And don't come here for vegan dining, it's subpar. The service was good but I'll never eat at this buffet again.

9PuEkK14pg421MRGveFK9A.text: Loved it, wish I could eat more!   Only one star less because the pasta was pretty undercooked when I went but I mixed the white and red sauce and it was freaking delicious!

gx7ypi-0ZEd1BthtQzGAWw.text: It has been a while since I posted a review. The food was fantastic the service is great and speaking about service I had the pleasure of having Dwight as our server. He was attentive & a catchy smile. Just made our day. Thank you Dwight!

g0OFX5o8JcWiP7mzbYwV4g.text: The food was good especially from the Hearth Station and the deserts. Fresh sushi selection was a pleasant surprise. I was also very happy with our server and busser Adrian who kept our table clean and our drinks topped off!

5SvI2J4VDiRL8YJ_ijrAxA.text: This is our new favorite among the many buffets in Las Vegas. Absolutely everything we tried was good to outstanding (except for overdone roast beef which my son found to be dry and tasteless even with au jus; I didn't try it because I like medium rare to rare). There were lots of items not found on other buffets.  The pizza was really good. I consider that nothing short of miraculous. The French onion soup was good; not much broth, but the cheese was plentiful and the croute, onions, and broth combined to taste like the best, moistest stuffing ever. The smoked brisket was tender, juicy, and delicious. The hot link was really good. (How can you screw up sausage, you may ask? But I've gotten carving-table sausage that wasn't worth eating.) The hummus and baba ganoush were terrific. The olive medley, pesto mozzarella balls, and Caprese salad were great. The grilled vegetables were fresh and good. The salt-and-pepper chicken wings (highly recommended by other reviewers) were delicious. The sushi was fresh and tasty. My sister told us there had been complaints about dry sushi rice in the past, but no problem this time; so the buffet seems to be responding to criticisms. The spring rolls were very tasty and not skimpy (very unusual even for a good buffet). The smoked pork chops with apple were delectable. The Mexican-style "elote off the cob" was great. The Korean short ribs were terrific; every other buffet has disappointed me with this dish. The individual shepherd's pie was yummy. My son is not a fish-eater but he took two types and liked them both. I tried his mahi mahi and had to agree it was lovely.   And the desserts. I was sad there were no macarons, and the creme brulee did not have enough crisp sugar topping and was just okay. But the cinnamon roll bread pudding with caramel sauce and the hot fudge brownie (warm, soft, gooey) more than made up for it. There were many equally delicious choices. Ooooh, and gelato. :-)  Everything was shiny clean and nicely presented. The waitress was efficient and pleasant. The price with coupon and member cards was a great deal.  Okay. As I said, new top choice, replacing the Aria buffet which we still love.

uRFpG27AN-cvT_p7n6ldXQ.text: "Finna "  the most genuine, hard working, and nice server at a.y.c.e located at the palms resort and casino. if you want quick, attentive, and consistent service, make sure to ask to sit at her table. shes a hard worker so please tip her well! she deserves it! thank you for a second amazing visit at a.y.c.e  honorable mention (not in photo):  "Camila '  the most amazing manager at a.y.c.e.!!!! camila is incredibly kind and attentive to customers and always greets them with a smile  thanks for a second great visit camila!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;FINNA &#34; THE MOST GENUINE, HARD WORKING, AND NICE SERVER AT A.Y.C.E located at the Palms Resort and Casino.

eK-gmVPf2A137mAs7AO7eg.text: Its one of the cheapest buffet especially on a weekend in Vegas! Clean! Food is delicious! Not a lot of choices but not a problem!  Been coming here 2 years in a row while in Vegas!

dtnF9akp7yiizASZfDthmA.text: Had dinner here on recommendation from our Uber driver, as the best buffet at an affordable price. She was right on both counts. Wide selection, from crawfish to sushi to crab boil to great brisket and on and on. Everything we tried was well prepared and plentiful, not always the case with buffets. The crowning touch was our server, Nazie. Though obviously very busy, she constantly checked in with us, making us feel she was there just for us. We noticed not just with us but all around her station, she constantly maintained such a positive welcoming vibe. When we were ready to leave she invited us back... if we return to Vegas we're going to take her up on it!

DPj55qFgQFZh0xjzZCnCoQ.text: We read about this buffet online thought the price was right too, around $17. The food was really good and the service was phenomenal too..thanks Maria! As we waited in line a hotel rep suggested we sign up for a player's card for a deeper discount... it ended up being $13.99 person!! Our favorites were the Asian food: sushi, dimsum, noodles and the salads and desserts. They also had a taco bar,  grilled meat station and pasta bar. Vegetarians had some good options as well.. but the bottomless mimosas for $10 were my fave!! And our server Maria...well she never let my glass go empty!! She was the bomb!! Thanks AYCE and the Palms for a great experience at an incredible price!!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The noodle station was set up like a salad bar..your choice of toppings and dressings.
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert heaven!
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lovely salad bar had tons of options..my fave... individual wedge salads with blue cheese and bacon

QiPc7_RkHbxORqmiCHrf4g.text: Well it's been two weeks and still the same review from another customer. When will AYCE get it together? I guess it's about dollars and and not customer service in this town anymore. Well that's not True, if you read this and want a good setting for family or one on one with with your significant other, come to Henderson. Believe it or not the Fiesta has great restaurants and customer service. Try it once and see what you think. I recommend Fuego Steak house and Leticia's Mexican restaurant.   Oh and yes I know they are all run by the same corporation, but management matters...

1U_oCiBSCRUxRpQuFODUcQ.text: 4 stars for the food. 5 stars for the value. I like rounding up.   For the price and quality of food, it's good! I don't feel like it should be compared to the big buffets on the strip like Bacchanal, Wicked Spoon, or Wynn Buffet. They're charging 3x as much, so of course they're gonna have much better food and much higher variety. Crab legs don't grow on trees.    With that said, it's my go to buffet for when I wanna stuff my face and not spend an arm and a leg. Pro tip: sign up for the players club to get a discount.   At buffets, I like to go for the high value items like the prime rib, seafood, etc. However, at this particular buffet, I find myself heading straight for the salt and pepper wings. They're so damn good! I didn't wanna fill my tummy on chicken wings only but it's honestly the best item there. Try it! Lol and surprisingly, their XLBs (xiao long bao) are pretty damn good. I am even comparing it to ding tai fung , Mama lus, etc from the 626 area. I keep looking out for their XLBs but they've only had it available once at A.Y.C.E.   Another thing I like at this buffet is their hot cheetos elote. Again, nothing TOOO spectacular because you can get it at outside restaurants but I just like that it's an option and it's tasty. Save room for their gelato. Their stracciatella (sp??) is my favorite.  The lines here are getting longer and longer as people are discovering this buffet secret. I would recommend getting more cashiers or moving faster because every time the line has been long, the insides have been empty. Gotta keep it more staffed. Otherwise, love this place and I will be back soon, Palms!

vVTUPmiwuJZxy6zaORRWLg.text: Dinner is 22 bucks! Love the service here- the price is really cheap for the quality. It's a meal portion buffet! *Don't come here If you want seafood only!  Our server is on fleak. My favorite dish so far is the wings in the World section. I got unlimited mimosas for $10... swear better than wicked spoon! Coming back. And bringing all my friends!!!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good! Spicy chicken wings
