Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tres leches

Dr2VAjViwdL6rUDM_Uua7Q.text: This buffet is "ok".  It's exactly what you would expect from a middle of the road Buffet. Nothing special that stands out.   The food was fine. The service was good and the price is not too expensive. Would I personally come back?? Maybe...if the people I'm with wanted to come here. Otherwise, no, probably not.   I find The Palms Casino depressing. I'm not sure what it is...so, I would never be hanging out in The Palms and then decide to go to the buffet. I would have to make a special trip over to go to the buffet...so, probably not going to happen.

HGXCveGrg9iQFsV5j-fL9Q.text: GREAT food! Even better service & experience!  I even made an account just to write this review... After a long drive the team and I decided on the A.Y.C.E buffet, affordable, good quality food. Think COSTCO but the buffet version. Starving and excited to eat. The team and I decided to take a photo, unaware of the attention it created. Noticing from afar, assistant manager Mary Gilrard (Buffet Angel ) caught up to us at our table & showed us how to ATTACK the buffet. Without hesitation I was off to the races! Soup & salad(arugula salad & chicken soup) first to create a base layer... woofed it down! again grabbing a small plate , sushi ,ginger & wasabi (real wasabi!) with a personally made salad . sMASHED!  Restroom break.. back to the party. While I planned my next attack, Mary graciously showed me around the buffet and introduced me to Chef Mike!Who after listening to my desire to indulge on fresh fish, he personally cooked me a dish! Can't say enough about these beautiful people... thank you!  Armed with the advice from  Mary & the excitement from meeting chef mike I went back to the buffet to Kill off all of the fish dishes before my main course arrived. Restroom break... hehe .. coming back to my table Chef Mike placed the freshly cooked fish in front me. As the team & I tried the fish Chef Mike gave us advice for on cooking techniques, it was dope! After  our brief conversation it was time for Dessert!! And let me tell you!!! It's was fan f#%ING-Tastic!!   Just look  at the pictures!!!!!!

hK0Md-76fRbwMQZMVIdfKg.text: Firstly, great new entrance to the casino. Congratulations to Palms management.  This also makes the third time that we went to A.Y.C.E. Buffet for lunch, as always great services and great food, place is spotless and nicely decorated.  Lots of new games too.

wIYONE1eFA34WbUrGVzxdA.text: I actually really did like this buffet for $25. We did a dinner on a Friday night and it wasn't too bad. My only complain was the line and how slow they were getting people in. Other than that the food wasn't bad. I really liked the rotisserie section. The food is also small enough to taste. The dessert bar wasn't too bad either. I really liked the cinnamon bread pudding out of all the desserts. I also like the fact that they carry Coke Zero here. I think next time we come back to Vegas I would want to try to stay at the Palms hotel too. It's a little off the strip but it's not as crazy to gamble around

RD6spI7OT-O7h08MiwDE-A.text: Excellent Breakfast buffet & great customer service. I've been there for breakfast, lunch, & dinner. I prefer their breakfast or brunch buffet the most.

cHqMHES_9-Kn3JqfK8T8eg.text: Surely a cheaper version of Buchanan ( Caesars palace buffet) it's delicious here they also have preset portions which is perfect. Vegan options available wow amazing. Clean place and excellent customer service and the best part here is the Price wow sooooo affordable! I truly recommend this place. Happy chow chow! :

POXHqTjHagBj939zA4zxGA.text: Compared to the other station casino buffets this place rocks, lots of unique types of servings. Only downside some of it just didn't seem fresh, sitting in the heat lamp too long

34d5ZuIkQcyqXKtlT_Duzw.text: Cheap when you get a free players card and the food is almost the same in bacchanal at  cesar palace

aVOFQWFAUi3RsTpo40fehA.text: So many dishes to chose from and I have to say Palms stepped it up with the new A.Y.C.E Buffet. Come check it out as it's open 7 days a week. Please be advised you have a 2 hour maximum dining LoL, it's more than enough time to stuff that belly of yours.  ** Don't forget the gelato Ice Cream :-)~

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining area!

s88w5rdqZmoODZ1nCsm6-Q.text: 4 Stars for the Buffet Foods!  2 Stars for the Deserts.(mediocre at best)  2 Stars for waitress.(only pick up plates, not personable; last ditch attempt to ask if we needed anything right before we were leaving...too late to butter us up for a tip).   Certain dishes like the Poke were even better than at the Aria Buffet on the Strip. Amazing!  Lots of variety of meat selections at the carving station were on point. Much better than the carving stations at the Aria.  2 Stars for the waitress. Not personable or friendly. She only came back at the end to ask if we needed anything else. She cleaned up the plates when she got around to them. Never asked me if I wanted a Refill on my soda. Not one time.  Seriously. I don't have time to be angry at a waitress that's just not all there.    My wife was very peeved about this, but we were too busy eating and making sure our baby was tended to.  Overall, will come back in the future despite the crappy waitresses that work at this buffet.

O-ggRmSjZtuuMGu7Pb1Y6Q.text: After having a bad experience at a similar buffet, after reading all the reviews, I decided to give the AYCE buffet a go. It surely beats the prices at the other buffets by half, with a decent quality in the food they offer.  If you sign up for the players card at the Palms, the buffet is only $19.99. Went around 8 PM on a Friday and the wait was about 5 minutes. They had a nice variety of stations from salad (who really goes there?), Asian, pizza and pasta, meat carving station, Mexican and a nice dessert section (cake, pastries and ice cream galore).  Majority of the food was really good, some such as the shumais (small dumpling), ribs, and pasta with marinara sauce were lacking a little flavor and weren't done right. Other than that you definitely get your money's worth, as no one really eats enough at the Wicked Spoon or Bacchanal buffet to get your full money's worth.  Left satisfied and would definitely be back again if I'm in the mood for a buffet.

BUZLNgQndmStkJU7ckE1IQ.text: The all new A.Y.C.E buffet offers a fresh take on buffets. The portions here are on the smaller side and the selection is limited. The offer different stations here will a variety of different dishes. Rather than serving yourself, each item is the prepared and plated in different types of little plates and pans.  Everything here was freshly made. I found that the selection was small. Everything though was fresh.  If you are looking for a traditional style buffet, I would hesitate to recommend this buffet simply because of the style of buffet.  The staff thought is really friendly and very attentive to your requests. The pricing for the lunch was really a good value at under 20.00.  I did like the atmosphere and the Palms remodel is excellent .

MWVEbK4gWY0MyaUmH1r-8g.text: The buffet was ok, the service was amazing and by far the best buffet service; even better than the Bacchanal buffet's service but sadly not food wise the Bacchanal is by far better. The Asian food isn't good nor the raw fish are fresh, which can be dangerous to eat; such as the salmon turning brown. The best thing they have are in the BBQ area, and most deserts.

cSnIf7YZk9TG14JX0YVMhg.text: Overall a great lunch dining experience.  The selection was excellent ans the price was reasonable for a Vegas buffet.

Mz38pWbKZBj86e_ubrFFDg.text: This is the remodeled buffet of Palms and didn't disappoint . Everything was on point --clean, airy and nicely decorated .Variety and quality of food selections were very good for the price. Friendly and very attentive servers too.

9HspWb-buefS9qmy6cs8WQ.text: The best buffet I've tried in Vegas so far and I've tried many because I come here every month! Save your money and go here it's nothing but delicious and the presentation is adorable !!!

wIyYKBStSx2-p6jILxiPjg.text: Currently ranked at four stars the experience and food was underwhelming. Three star buffet at most(in my option of course). I went on a Friday night and the place was not only much smaller then expected for a "Vegas strip" buffet but the food choices were not comparable to other four star buffets on the strip. Also the photos posted on various social media do not appear to match what was actually served.   For those who love seafood, like crab, they do not have anything other then shrimp. None the less, the server was fantastic and very kind. Other customer service personnel appeared to be pleasant.   I would recommend the buffet at Binions, Mainstreet Station. Similar price, more selection, same quality food, and they have crab legs on Fridays or weekends I believe.   For the seafood enthusiast and lovers go the the Studio B buffet at The M on weekends. Currently four stars and not comparable to anything else I've experienced yet.

Yg4z0Uc58C6ArDEujv5FLw.text: Really wanted to like this place but the food was average at best.  At there both for a dinner and then breakfast a few days later to give it a 2nd shot.  Service was excellent and very friendly - can't do better there.  Unfortunately most of the food i ate (pancakes, beef, pizza) was pretty bland. Not bad but not good.   Deserts were 4* i'd say...   Luckily I had no wait for breakfast and maybe 5 minutes for dinner...   Don't think i'd go back even if staying there again.

0CDYuFedFgW7Nuurtr345w.text: I'm went here because somebody suggested me to go here and mentioned it was a new place. I like the fact that it's new and clean. We went here with 3 people. Two adults and one 4 year old child. The price waa 17.99$ they even charge my daughter full price which I thought was not right my daughter does not eat as much as a grown up and for them to charge full price wasnt correct. The food was whatever it wasn't all that. Very bland. The m casino is better.

a5ms4z0ZFDsLe1cDmwfRrw.text: Visited here last Wednesday and had an amazing time. Food was excellent as well as the servuce. On this vacation, we also went M Resort and Bellagio buffet.  Both are very good but the quality was better at AYCE. Nothing to complain about i highly recommend this place. For less than $15 per person it's a awesome deal !!!!

nYtuE91679s-XMtAP8g7Qg.text: The food is not that great, good selection but all the meats taste sweet. The corn on the Cob taste like the frozen corn. The salad bar is very limited. I did like their BBQ meats. The environment is very good and clean.

BrGfvdkbqXRi2xWPyPZ_zg.text: I live in Las Vegas, and decided to try the A.Y.C.E. Buffet today for lunch at the Palms. It started out great by having a line for seniors and disabled people. I am both.  I loved that. The food, not so much! I found the food to be oversalted, under or overcooked, way to spicy or just bland. In the kitchen, they pay a lot of attention to quantity, but not so much for quality. I am a vegetarian, and they had a few ok choices, but I wonder how the head chef or sous chef can let the food go out without tasting or checking it. It ran me almost $17 for lunch. Bottom line, I can do much better at home. My kitchen and my food beats it hands down.

2xkE1-6mk4PQ6MN04W48lA.text: Just had our last meal for Vegas trip at A.Y.C.E. At Palms. Place is little bit walk or short at ride from main strip but one could not go wrong for price and excellent quality of Buffet food. Each entry is presented nicely with full of flavor. Our server Patricia Toped  it off with excellent service.

MvtXrLOwrj8EUxdOLUmaAQ.text: I came around 12pm Food tasted old like it's been sitting out for a while. I think it was the food from the night before. And there were not that many items available. I gave it a 3 because my waiter was super helpful.

HDz6lvJ0QSRtSf5za6tkSg.text: This place is awesome. Huge selection of food, including a ton of vegetarian items and a vegan station. Lots of items in ramekins or individual bowls, easy to grab and try different dishes. 8 different ice creams at dessert station along with cakes and French macarons. And it's a pretty affordable buffet at ~$22. Definitely worth it.

T2nkvqeao55m73QX_-zcHA.text: I came with about 12 of my coworkers. We were seated right away! Everyone was very friendly and helpful. I really enjoyed the variety of food stationed offered. From Asian, to BBQ, Italian, a great salad bar and dessert bar etc. The food was fresh, hot and very tasty. I will definitely be coming back in the near future! :)

79XZflRsHISdIdM8b0Z8Ow.text: Great buffet, love the individual portions. Had to subtract one star for the super loud club music, not relaxing at all and wrong for the demographic that is attending your buffet.

h-UNy2jPh2SBhzYx5OdB7A.text: Good variety for carnivores and vegetarians alike.  Walnut shrimp, salt and pepper chicken and gelato were highlights.  Good value for money.

JbqzNL7SZ76_ftE_Zu9WCw.text: Make sure to get a player's card to save a couple of bucks. Ate lunch here on the weekday. The price was reasonable considering the food choices you get and service was good too. They have an interesting selection including corn that was crusted with flaming hot cheetoos, which was delicious. Sushi was decent and the spicy pepper wings were quite tasty.

OvDTnRLsjWju_R6l5x7tUg.text: Had a great experience all around only issue I had was certain foods here and there on the line was running past it's time I had notified one employee who kinda shrugged it off but everyone else was great and helped get the message through. Good buffet for the price though.

--3w9G7TkFvtK9HH89EgfA.text: Really like this buffet! Service was friendly. Food is very tasty most of them. I personally love the curry mussels. Also love the sauteed veggies its crunchy fresh! Over all I really enjoy it. get the rewards card so you get 2 dollars off. I just hope they keep this quality running.

JDiKnR8fpZInhrmhwZ8f5Q.text: It's Lent.  It's Friday, 16 February 2018.  It's lunch.  What? No New England Clam Chowder.  It's blasphemy.  It's UN-American.  Even in China they have clam chowder on Fridays.  If you had zero stars, that is what I would rate today.  Treason!!!

tAc1qz8Y2p2L2NPNs0JBUg.text: Great off the strip buffet Great management Always resolving problems professionally The food is amazing and we enjoy it everyday. We would definitely recommend.

ZQX8XkGGVacdJeIhBBxLgw.text: 40 minutes on line to try this buffet ... really?  only one person on cashier to deal with all this people ... shame

gxu6MlAQMZ_ZJo6tgVj2rA.text: I enjoyed this place the food was great  I didn't want to leave I wanted to eat here for ever lol

LcT1FfJEcj_6UgGNWETM7w.text: There was only one cashier open.  She was on the VIP side.  We waited in line and then she said she couldn't help us because we were not the correct tier (Platinum or President Club, I'm not sure) She said we had to go wait in the other line.  We told her that there wasn't a register open when we got in line and her response was " Well there is someone now.  Go in that line. "  That May be the policy, but I am sure a corporation like Stations has a lot of training for Customer facing employees.  She didn't follow any best practices.  The first interaction was negative.    The food was not as good as before. The quality had just gone down.  The beef was dry, the selection had been reduced and the overall flavor was just bland.    I will not be recommending A.Y.C.E. to anyone.

Q-LsxNE5GUbwQiOxExL2Ew.text: Came here for a Sunday brunch at 11:30. It was a short line waiting but I think it got busier after that so I don't recommend going around noon to one. It's $21.99 a person without a players card but it's $17.99 each person up to 2 people only with a players card. Not bad at all! Most affordable brunch. It includes unlimited mimosa and drinks. Definitely a great deal. The buffet was organize into different stations with labels. I liked how it is set up. They have variety of choices of food. I definitely would come back here again.

AGDn0mCWuhZ9kaJUGYUnNw.text: Price: $23.99 for 2 people if you have the player card.  The food overall was pretty good, lots of variety.  Gluten free options, tofu scrambled, egg white fritatas, fruit, pasta, etc... Very cute place.  Recommend:  Yogurt parfait, pot stickers, ham,  and egg white fritatta.  Overall: everything was fresh and great.  We were very satisfied with what we ate for the price we paid.

Q3mHL2VXjAgmW51aMk-lRw.text: The reviews showed a 4.1  rating for A.Y.C.E Buffet at The Palm and so there we go for breakfast.  This was the absolute WORST buffet I've ever had, everything I picked was COLD and so I kept going back trying something else and still Cold that is until I finally got an omelette   My food rating - 1... The pancake was as hard as a hockey puck, the scrambled eggs, potato's, hash brown, bacon, ham, all cold and just not good. The bacon & ham SALTY.  The coffee was hot, yay and our server great but other than that, I immediately regretted coming there wasting my $$$, I should've gone to McDonalds around the corner!  Sorry I could not give a better review, have to be honest.

IGDRtnTp9i7Jxwy59S0D_w.text: I am an ESL Teacher at a school here in town and wanted to take my class of 25 students to the buffet for lunch. I called earlier in the week and spoke to Facia, the Assistant Room Manager, who informed my that they are unable to take reservations, but would do everything in their abilities to accommodate our large party.  Our group arrived shortly after 12pm on a Thursday and the line was minimal. Facia and her team did an excellent job of processing payments and seating our party in groups to expedite the process. We were all able to sit together at 3 large tables right in front of the dessert station.  Honestly, I'm not normally a fan of buffet food, but was impressed with the quality and selection of the food offered. My 3 favorite items (which were recommended by Facia) were the lemon pepper chicken wings as well as the pizza and stromboli, cooked in their hearth oven.  Our 2 waitresses, Wendy and Embet, did an excellent job keeping our drinks filled and clearing our plates. They were both very patient with my students, as they are from 9 different countries and have various English language skills.  Overall, I would definitely recommend A.Y.C.E. and will be returning again soon!

btLbCGHFZJx8xiy68acyKA.text: The price is definitely cheap but I guess you get what you pay for. Food quality is just average that nothing really stands out. The quality of the carving station was especially bad. The meats including beef, pork and turkey all tasted super dry and rubbery. Everything from the dessert station look like was bought from store. One of the only few thing I enjoyed was the make your own omelet during brunch time. Line was long and it moved slow despite having so many empty tables. Our server also pretty much disappeared after getting our first drinks.

ev80MhfPlGV68ImQ9n33LA.text: What a disappointment ! The line to pay wasn't that long, but waiting to be seated was unusually long, so as other service. It took us forever to get a  coffee etc. I think this place is seriously understaffed. Food wasn't good either. I don't think I will come back again.

3asjBjUD46aTd8y-XxBilg.text: We have been to AYCE buffet at the Palms twice this week and both times Glenda was our table server. Both times she did not disappoint us and took care of our needs. Kudos to Glenda, they all should work as hard!

x_myYHnGpwwrkZgBbkX26w.text: I had really high hopes for this place. I had seen great pictures and read good reviews. I'm not sure what went wrong. I thought maybe we went a little later in the evening but even then, it was about 7:30 pm on a Saturday. We were a large group. Options were "out" or no longer being served. Sections where employees were serving, lacked a lot of personality on their end. The dessert people were honestly, rude. It seemed like you were annoying them by asking them for something. I did like the elotes! The place is nice looking because it's new & renovated. I probably won't be back.

c5_5fyVLjoppGepBkB-0IQ.text: Pretty good. Lots of selections. Meats, fish, pasta station, soup n salad, deserts. Sugar free chocolate. No prime rib or crab legs but for $21 i wasnt expecting any. Shepards pie kicks ass though using the tongs to pick it up is a little cumbersome. Can definitely recommend and will come back.

2dRjNFAryumABP_-4r0a-w.text: Food was just ok. Didn't experience anything particularly unique or spectacular. The meat carving station was normal, the pasta station was regular and the salad bar was ok. The Asian food wasn't all that authentic, (as expected). The dessert corner was just ok. Glad they had gelato otherwise the desserts would've really sucked. The wait to get in was ridiculously long (1.5 hours). Aside from having precious time with family union, needless to say, this place wasn't worth the wait. Not sure what the hype was about.

uc4fx7RfibQU9H4AS0acgA.text: Wow! AYCE is a really really awesome buffet. Affordable price (dinner is $17.99 per person), great food, and friendly service. The highlights were the duck, brisket, cornbread. But great diversity of food and the taste is great for a buffet. The dessert was also amazing. The macaroons, gelato, and carrot cake were the best thing I had at desserts. Can't say enough good things about this buffet.

8huUx6ngDHxKcYCUmZsw1w.text: Food was great ! Many vegan options Rafael our server was very fast friendly ! Thank you amazing experience will be back soon

np4vmyOX_ckNJB_ZLd4juw.text: This buffet was pretty mediocre. There was absolutely no beef choices during their lunch and the elote was room temperature. I really didn't enjoy anything in the buffet other than a tuna sushi dish. And as for the dessert, there were no macaroons and the gelato needs to be kept at a colder temp as it starts to melt as soon as it's placed in a bowl.

0GMvmviL4E0Lc7fcE--lFA.text: Went with friends, with the mindset of "need to get there ASAP before quality goes down like Wicked Spoon."  Don't know if it was the mindset, but the service was not the best so that could have overshadowed everything.  Don't get me wrong, the buffet looks great. Design of the space looks amazing. Very open. Nice and bright.  From the moment we stood in line, the expectations were already lowering. The woman in charge of the line took us out of the line we were at and moved us to the next register, where if she kept us, our group of 7 would've gotten in sooner. Instead, the group after us in the original line got through first.  When our group of 7 was sat, we immediately went straight for the food.  Pros: corn bread (stayed moist), walnut shrimp (retained some crunch and not overly sweet), individual wedge salad (lettuce was not oxidized and fresh no brown or wilted), cooked to order pasta, smoked brisket (flavorful and tender), carved turkey breast (moist), prime rib, coque au vin, mini macarons (ordered out), lemon tart (nice tart flavor)  Cons: turkey legs (dry), shrimp cocktail (shrimp texture was off and cocktail sauce was not like other station property- had no bite or body, loose), collard greens (no ham/ham hock), individualized clam bake (overcooked crawfish and other shellfish), pan seared salmon (overcooked), catfish (soaked up the liquid it was sitting in to prevent it from drying out),  tuna poke bowl (tuna didn't look fresh and very oxidized, no red "fresh" color," every other individualized desserts (lack luster, didn't know I could ever eat a "watered" down espresso flavor, but I did while my friend ate the same thing and his had way stronger espresso flavor)  Service: server kept forgetting our drink order refills. As part of the Station Culture: "It's Everyone's Job," the busser was not very helpful. Our table asked him for help with refills and the response was typical "union" response: "I'll let your server know." I'm sorry,  dinner rush was finished,  plenty of tables were still clean and open and the time we asked he only had 2 4-tops to bus, so we didn't understand the brush off. ...  All in all, probably won't go back for dinner. But if you must try, at least get the Boarding Pass to get the discount. I normally go crazy at buffets, doing 4+ rounds, but this time I didn't go past 2.

c7VfSLJNzcj0Y88HXMkuCw.text: Updated to a well deserved 5 stars! My new favorite buffet and likely will be voted #1 best value in 2018. I'll take side bets.   I've now enjoyed breakfast, lunch, and dinner and think all are simply amazing. They overlap so no waiting for changeover, get both breakfast and lunch items if you come around 10am for example.   Great price but get your players card first to get the discounted (advertised price) you might expect.   So Much Value! Food quality is spectacular.  Unique and fun experience. A lot of premade dishes so you can try several different things.  Quick prompt service.  Cheap price but 5 star food.  Service is fantastic! The cashiers are nice. They have 2-3 people to seat you and always friendly with smiles, even had few of them ask if everything was good while seated. They say goodbye and thanks for coming. Servers are the best, come around very often with refills and work together if on breaks or busy.  Managers listened to my complaints, signs are changed and things are labeled correctly (for the most part). The salad condiments serving spoons are better but still hard to serve, they'll likely improve it though. The fruit is kept full, haven't seen it like I did the first day I went. I said before the fruit needed a bigger tray but that's not True, I just wanted it to be fresher cut and kept full, and they stay on top of it now.   Every food dish is made with care. Lots of flavor and unique items you won't find at other buffets. Some complained Stations didn't copy their other buffets but that's silly, they took a chance and now stand out from all buffets.   It is my new go to spot. It'll be hard for me to justify spending $10 or even $20 more for less quality food elsewhere. Other places have longer waits and colder food and worse service.  Love the chairs and tables. Chairs are flexible in the back, well padded, and have a handle to easily grab. Solid wood table tops that are always clean and sturdy.   They don't have a year long VIP pass yet but I'll be first to get one if they do.   Hurry up and go before I eat everything! :-)

BIcWJsZHRsJs6a3RWfIFRQ.text: Came to the Palms Buffet on 4-5-19 for breakfast and is always good and fresh. It is always a great time there to just eat and relax and take it all in. The prices are great especially being a rewards member. The price is $10.99. Hicela was managing the front where you pay and was doing a great job greeting everyone, being professional and with a smile on her face She did a great job handling everyone. Cannot wait to return.

Fum0q2JOsN_If1TIPAE92Q.text: We had a buffet there last September 27th. The food was good and our server did an awesome job. I love how Josue P helped us and give us an excellent service. I will give him a 10 star for a perfect customer service. He deserves a recognition. We are a big group and he managed to serve all of us. Thank you Josue P. We will definitely come back hope you will be our server again.   This elote is a must try and also the honey walnut shrimp, I also like the salt and pepper wings (a little bit salty but tastes good) also the carne asada soft taco. Delicious!! .   The only bad thing is the guy cooking pasta in the pasta station was rude. I wasn't able to get his name. I don't like how he treats his customers. It's a bad image for a very nice cozy buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jpAEKfv-DBGO9CTMR6iw7w.text: This is a True Vegas buffet! They had a great selection with everything from miso soup to chilaquiles. The price was great as well, way better than eating on the strip or a food court.  Our waiter Benji was awesome! He made sure we were taken care of, as well as the guests around us. That kind of service will ensure our return on our next Vegas trip! Thanks again benji!

7Zl47rd-B1Jv8oZLVfTQiA.text: This is one of our favourite buffet of the buffets offered by Station Casinos.  We came a couple of times for their dinner buffet.  It offers quite a variety of food selections: Mexican (quesadillas, fajitas, etc.), Asian (Korean BBQ ribs, salt and pepper wings, stir fried noodles station for order, sushi rolls, etc.), Italian (a variety of pizzas, pasta for order, etc.), BBQ station (beef brisket, pork ribs, sweet potatoes, etc.), carving station (roasted beef, etc.), soup, salad and fruit station, dessert station (soft served ice cream, ice cream sandwiches, mini desserts such as creme brulee, carrot cake, coffee mousse, etc.)  Overall, the food was very tasty with very good selection.  Some of the food are offered in smaller portions in cute containers like some buffets on the strip so it's easier to taste everything.  Our favourites were the salt and pepper wings, sesame balls, and shepherd's pie.  Kids' favourites were pizza, creamy corn, and mashed potatoes.  For the price, we think the quality and taste of food were above average.  Definitely worth a try if you are in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio ice cream drizzled with sprinkles, vanilla cup cake, coffee ice cream, coffee mousse, and creme brulee

2rATwS_ORvlN-HxZoFgFPQ.text: The place was really renovated pretty good compare to the old buffet they had. The food was good for a local casino which is part Of the station Casino; by far the best buffet among all the station casino. Server was really nice They will have a small spill introducing the buffet when it was open etc. food selection was really good and the dessert bar. Definitely would be back I hope they do maintain how clean and how the presentation of the food. Price is pretty decent for the food they have in there.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8bKpIAsG9aMdCGg18Ux--w.text: Breakfast buffet opens at 8am!  Relatively new to Las Vegas, this buffet began on December 22, 2017.  Besides breakfast, they also have lunch and dinner buffets!  Located in the Palms Casino, A.Y.C.E. seems to be a great deal at $8.99 for the Breakfast Buffet, but...the fine print alludes to this price with a Gold Players Card or higher.  Regular price is $12.99. If you have the basic card gets you in at $10.99 plus tax and tip.  On a positive note, the Parking is free; the environment is cheerful; and the service is pleasant!  It was better than other buffets because there was no line to get in, and it wasn't crowded!  There were so many different stations and choices, but I had to focus, knowing that my tummy space is limited.  I liked the fresh fruits, oatmeal, tapioca, and variety of breads the best!  The fresh Orange juice,  eggs Benedict, and quiche were also memorable!  Dear Daniel and I happily scouted out the terrain, took photos, and finally settled down to our feast!  We were happily full and enjoyed our food coma!  It was a fun and repeatable foodie adventure!

Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Price with Gold Player&#39;s Card

eytLGP3_Q2bklS-PsYATBw.text: One "word": Wow!. This is a new buffet, opened this January (at least that's what I found online, must be True)... The lunch cost per person was $17 (? $18). The place looks clean, and the service was really good. But of course the main thing was the food, I'm gonna be honest here, this is the best buffet I've ever tried.  The food was well done and good quality, the steak, pulled pork and elotes were amazing, not even joking. Believe me, if you're in Las Vegas, and want to eat 'till you can't move at some buffet, go here. You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9Fge3O4M4C3H8kVbMSzG0Q.text: 3 1/2 stars for this buffet. 5 stars for being affordable especially with their 2 for 1 deal when you are a preferred guest. But as for the food, not too much choices and the meats were dry and burnt. I liked the salad bar but not too much to chose from there. The best part was the sugar free desserts! That made it up for the not ao appetizing food. Probably will not be back again.

Pv8Mzp-tRet_K16ONJoFzg.text: Came in on a Sunday night and waited for over one hour and thirty minutes!!! I wish I could give it 5 stars because the food was great but not worth the long wait. That I saw, the problem was there were not enough bussers. There were lots of empty tables but I only saw one or two bussers clearing off tables. As for the food , it was really tasty and creative. I understand that maybe they are understaffed and going through the motions after the renovation but the wait is just too much. In my opinion the line for a buffet should not exceed 30 min.

nfySf-kPvthQiz7iRhrM_Q.text: I read all these amazing reviews and got so excited and came here to try.   Over all, food quality I'd say a 3 star. Nothing too tasty that stood out. For the price, it's ok. You get full. Ingredients are fresh. Just not too tasty. All meat dishes are over cooked.   Really good servers and staff.   I wouldn't return though just cuz food is so so.

-NEBjzXr22PUBDvS2qRApA.text: We went to Vegas to celebrate my hubby's birthday.  I really didn't want to eat at a buffet but the good reviews really intrigued me.  I had high hopes for this place that's why I decided to celebrate his birthday lunch here at AYCE buffet.  The line was quite long but very understandable for a good buffet.   We ended up waiting 1 1/2 hour to get in.  Unfortunately, my whole family was very disappointed.   There were 3 dishes that were better than mediocre (spam fried rice, pork green chili, and chile lime chicken) but the rest were either dry (roast beef, ham, mushroom pizza, mushroom quesadilla, pastries), too salty (mussel curry), or lacking flavor (fried/breaded catfish, hush puppies, honey shrimp). The desserts looked great but majority of them lacked flavor.    One saving grace for this experience was  the friendly service from the cashier to our server despite how busy they were.   If Palms will read my review, I hope that they will use customer's feedback to improve the quality and flavor of food served at AYCE buffet.

nOQ0SfY2gQD0TJUd-XkSwA.text: Wow!! This is by far the best buffettin Las Vegas and worth every penny.  What I love about this buffett and what makes it different are the pre-set portions, which you can always go back for more. This is such a huge advantage because it gives the cutest presentation and keeps everything fresh.  The assortment is very different than most lamb, civiche, premium shrimp cocktail, ribs and seafood boil soup. But the most impressive thing was the desert selection, all small petite offerings to allow you to try more flavors.   The whole buffett was very clean, very fresh and hand crafted. Way to step up the bar!!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Milk! How cute
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vtc_mZ3h9rYG50pAGPhs5w.text: Taking the trendsetting name A.Y.C.E from sushi bars, this remodeled buffet inside The Palms only took the name when it comes to trendsetting. I like to think of this place as upscale food that tastes nothing like upscale food. A wolf in sheep clothing when it comes to buffets.  This buffet boasts dishes that are similar to buffets like Bacchanal and The Wicked Spoon but tastes nothing like it. There were so many items that I thought "OOOHHHH" but when I took a bite it was like "Ewwwwww". I mean seriously, if you are going to put out Duck Confit make it taste like Duck Confit and not a Duck Con! It was like a food fake out the whole time. For the price of the buffet compared to most Vegas buffets, I should not have expected greatness. It really is an A.Y.C.E. (All you can eat) of trendy dishes that are constantly overcooked, dry or very bleh.   There really is nothing more to say about this buffet. Really. Nothing.

UTTvfO0yTZyn2CV_YjoGDg.text: Overall very good: both food and service. As buffets in Las Vegas get more and more expensive, this one is a good choice if you don't want to spend too much.

e450TMMNg2sFowcebG0Lkg.text: For $22 this buffet was awful! It wasn't that great at all! The drink glasses where small. The buffet was flavorless, Golden Corral has better food. This was my first casino/buffet and for the price I was hoping for at least as good as a local buffet but no. This will probably be my last Casino buffet.  Took a day trip from PHX to Vegas just to experience the Casino/buffet and it was highly disappointing.  (**)

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. At these prices you would think it would be at least as good as Golden Corral.

eYAWnGB7vBezWCRw-sHdug.text: The Palms updated their buffet and it was actually pretty good. My family and I kept hearing about it and seeing it on TV, so we tried it for Sunday Brunch. The Palms is now a Station Casino, and it's better than all the other Station Casinos I've been too.   They offer different dishes that you don't usually see in other Station Casinos. It looks like they are trying to match Wicked Spoon at the Cosmopolitan with their servings, but it was no match for Wicked Spoon. However, it was still good and I'll probably come back sometime.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watermelon Citrus Salad
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi Poke and Tapioca

srDU6yo4ai3yL9g3naK12A.text: We had the most incredible experience here at the Ayce Buffet at the Palms Casino Hotel Resort. The Head Chef was so kind to us he even offered to make something special .We watch the Manger Mary walk around making sure everyone receives the best dinning experience assisting in everyway possibly. Mary is so kind and professional. Elvira the hostess always makes us feel like family she always has a smile and so polite and respectful while dining she always stops by to see if anything needed. Our server Jennifer was Las Vegas Best always catering to All of our every need very polite professional and did everything outstanding to make us have a memorable experience. The Ayce Buffet at the Palms it's more than five star restaurant to us we cannot wait to return to eat again the food is amazing if I give them Five Star Plus way to go Ayce Buffet. My Favorite Place in Las Vegas!!!

f251R1AWIx_2y1RFaJJZVg.text: Good buffet for the price. The food is more creative than the typical buffet which I can appreciate. Although, they aren't always successful with their cooking. The brisket was pretty dry. It crossed my mind that maybe it's intentional so you don't go back for seconds. If that's the case then it worked. I didn't get it again. But I liked several of their other dishes like the street corn and poke salad. They occasionally have honey walnut shrimp but they only had that one time that I went and I have eaten here 3 times.   If you're looking for a good meal at a good price, this is a good place to go. It's not like eating at Bellagio or Bacchanal, but it also doesn't cost the same either. Btw, I went to Wicked Spoon and that place was pretty awful. This place is half the price and has much better food.   UPDATE:  I went today for dinner and the food has gone downhill. Food quality has decreased. They seem to be using cheaper ingredients.  This place used to make more creative dishes like braised beef poutine, honey walnut shrimp, duck confit, salmon with cream sauce, but now it's more typical items such as pizza, chicken cacciatore, chicken wings, pasta, sliders, egg rolls.  Nothing memorable, and it didn't even taste very good. Many of the items were similar to the food served at hometown buffet. They still have some of their usual dishes like smoked brisket and ribs, but they were dry.  Fried chicken was salty. I just can't stand behind this buffet anymore. I won't go back unless they improve their foods. It was like this the last 3 times I've gone. Too bad cuz I really did like this place before.

-QcgoCXqrlSZF2eQcow4iQ.text: With so many buffets to choose from in Las Vegas, you want to make sure to pick the right one.  Me sure to add A.Y.C.E to your list.  Don't worry that The Palms is not on the strip, that is actually a good thing.  The price is much lower than most other buffets, but the food and selections are amazing!  There really is something for everyone.  The food is hot and fresh, and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WKWRONLQu8jhmYzOvAxjDw.text: Food was mediocre at best. "Sushi" is inedible. Stood in line for an hour and it just plain wasn't worth the wait or the money.

YI-ZZyxtq62ZyaU1HE_t9g.text: Im a foodie. I thought food was good. Staff friendly. Was it great? Didnt think so. I went to breakfast, lunch and dinner. Breakfast had good options. Lunch was ok. Dinner was best of all three but still wasnt wowed. Ive always heard great things about vegas buffets i give this one 3 out 5

v4slKkYFSiFf_g7TUcifVw.text: Delicious buffet for the price! My family and I enjoyed our stay in Las Vegas and decided to go to This buffet more than once. I love that three is a good bar with vegan options and the omelette station is a must try! The dessert bar includes gelato and all kinds of desserts as well. Make sure you are show your players card for a discount too.

jPhr_qesf2ktXztcR9SHlg.text: The Palms buffet is absolutely amazing! It has improved so much since it's been remodeled. The staff is always amazing and provide awesome service!!! Kai makes every experience I have here perfection. She is theeee best!!!

0ED9BMFNPXrcTGU5u5k6Mg.text: Amazing food although I did not like the ribs and brisket but everything else was amazing.. Definitely worth the price!

-k4352uKXp2-p-JK_z1fyg.text: The highlight of our 6 day visit. Wish we found this place sooner during our stay...it was the last meal of the trip, but what a grand finale!! Walnut shrimp, blue cheese wedge salad, papaya salad, and jackfruit enchiladas were very memorable. And I loved dessert bar...amazing!! We will return next year...keep up the phenomenal food service!!

h80MeM0v7nMk5qtlCU2t5A.text: Great quality and good selection. Very reasonable compared to some of the other buffets in the area.  Only reason for not giving 5 stars is they do not have crab legs anymore.

t3zhqjCFv9rSny3ll933eg.text: Just went there yesterday. Honestly I was a little disappointed. This place would have potential, but therefore it needs some work. I tried almost everything. Some meats were good, others were not so good, way to dry. One station had Brussels Sprouts and they were litterly uncooked, just looked roasted from the outside, seamed to be held under fire to look like cooked, but totally raw inside. Who wants to eat that? The ones served at the Asian Station were cooked ok. The 2 dumpling kinda things at the Asian station had some weird tasting meat inside, couldn't eat it. Had some grilled octopus, Love that normally and it was ok. One side was fine, the other side of it was tasting dry and burned.  And the dessert station is a total fail besides the bread pudding and that sugar free tart. I'm Not sure what you can do wrong with desserts, even the worst buffets in this town have better desserts than AYCE. I'm sure if you take care of those issues, it would be a great place. But as of now I'm not really willing to go back and eat there again.  The server was awesome, he did a great job.

WMQNbtSdnYFlPrgZy_NIHQ.text: Came in for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. Their prices were much more affordable than other buffets on the strip but I figured how could a resort mess up a buffet anyways, right? WRONG. Food was mediocre at best and there wasn't a huge selection of American food which I thought was odd. I really only ate the pulled pork, beans and hot pocket-like pizza sandwiches. Best part overall was the desert which is were I probably got most of my monies worth. Custom icecream cookie sandwiches was the best and only part I truly enjoyed. I didn't catch the name of the staff in dessert (older Hispanic man) but he was super sweet! I'm curious to know what their breakfast buffet is like but I will most likely not return.

7_r8P7N-dn7DBpWst1MrYw.text: This buffet was by far one of the best we have had in a long time. The restaurant was clean and the atmosphere inviting. The price was fair for what was offered. There were a variety of food offered and everything we had tonight was amazing. The standout dishes were the walnut shrimp, pork panang, cold somen noodles, brussel sprout, asparagus, most definitely the pizza, and the greenery display was inviting.  In addition, the entire time my family and I dined, the Assistant Executive Sous Chef Bell was always on the line ensuring that the line was clean and the production was met. Rarely do you see the AESC on the line working. Our waitress was very attentive and did fabulous job of ensuring that our drinks were topped off and clearing our plates.  Thank you! We'll be back!

Zv77-CmgH1u6gMj4oa80Yg.text: The selection is limited. They have bit of everything but not in quantity. The flavors are good. Service was attentive and restaurant was clean.  The hotel still offers free parking which was a plus for me.

wJMjqozmlHXIZ8kj4UzGrQ.text: All of the food is less than decent.  Lower quality product. Pizza tastes like it was frozen.   1.6/5 stars. My brother says try the other buffets in vegas.

6OLr8LnMfcd6Ydb5vN-P5A.text: Great price great food bottomless mimsosas what else can you ask for in a Vegas buffet

tKLGdX3dNQ0myJ6s8b7sQA.text: Hour wait for buffet. Because the line took so long I couldn't get breakfast. Some how that was the customers falt

5aD2jrpeT0eBg-DKbzZfgw.text: Not bad the new Palms buffet is better then what it was still not the best but good has stuf on the menu for vegetarians now I thought that was good .

w2sghSyz4RLPFhEfkfGGPg.text: Man this place was horrible! Don't waste your time coming here. I wish I could get my money back. Everything was old and unappealing. The 1 Star was for my unsweetened iced tea, I add sweet and low too. Can't believe the Palms puts out this level of quality

gOHgPLoA9SNWCO69qk2WWA.text: The service was very good. The food was delightful. We found so many wonderful things that work if you are doing Weight Watchers. From the salad to the roasst turkey breast, all was wonderful quality and taste. Loved it!

dZuyElFjS4VLlH8eLK0wqg.text: Best buffet that I have eaten in Vegas. Super affordable, great options and high quality. Will definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas.

FO_fAMQ7gWoD5DUetn6fWg.text: Ever since the buffet was remodeled the food is amazing, the staff doesn't suck, and the selection is waaaay better. Brisket, macaroons, made to order pasta, and unique presentation.... will be back

4Pjg_oV5qr65D3iObLmcQQ.text: Love the  vegan options high quality for the price. Clean and fun ambience. I only tried the brunch buffet worth coming back for the price

ys5PeWuB0nIkPYMBo_Iilw.text: Probably the best price for the buffet and very delicious food and a great price, place and value

fZbfxSTxo4blfFK9m1d3qA.text: Nice buffet here for lunch and dinner (more foods). They're renovation this place now is good. And foods is great.

9OGVgUdHolKgsRz_XW7deA.text: It was a nice lunch we had there. Different variety of food from sushi, pot pie, roast pork,  chicken wings and fruits. I love the cream of brocolli. Deserts are delicious esp their gelato. Will come back next wk for sure.

BmviwtjRlhvDNM8ngBoLmQ.text: I loved this place. The selection was really good and the prices were awesome! I'll eat here every time I'm in town. Great job you guys!

14OjgwV5pvaUcc2bhmJzHQ.text: This buffet is amazing, great variety foods. I've been twice now and will definitely recommend to my friends and family.

31kT6hEW1Dr1wIncU8g9AA.text: The Brunch menu on Sundays is great! You have to arrive before 11am to beat the crowd or you'll definitely have to wait some time to be seated. The waiters are super nice and very catering. Highly recommend

qc791Z7yBOkG0d1WwF6fCA.text: Nice Service - Horrible Food - Monday Dec 2018  Dried Out Beef/Brisket, undercooked Chicken Wings (Skin was still jiggly), Almost everything Dramatically Over-Salted. Not nearly up to the Red Rocks or Green Valley Standard. If you do not have at a minimum a Half-Price coupon - Make a Run For it. As for me I will not consider the Palms Buffet again for another Year. This is very sad as The Pearl is a great place to see a show- just never eat here. Pay the extra and visit The Aria, Wynns and so many more instead.

dF962gax2LdYIOYiLnbyPQ.text: The food is edible, no taste  even the dessert and the ice cream is tasteless but the old Palms buffet were better   This is one of the worst buffet l try so far in Vegas  They can do better they should at copy the Red Rock Casino style for buffet since they belong to the same group now. Not worth it even at the 2 for 1 price

yzAHYPMLJhQ0vfdmCI3LKg.text: Been here several times now and every experience has been flawless. Food is innovative and different from what you'd see at other buffets. Elotes, French onion soup, smoked brisket and 3 different types of mac n cheese!! All to die for.  Love that they have a healthy vegetarian station called "Revival". Line is long because people love it... worth the wait for sure.  I'll be back again and again.
