1ZdHlOHhvJJZ2LDJFMGKkw.text: Come to Palms AYCE buffet. You will be sorry if you don't. This is the highlight of my Vegas trip. Tell everyone. 20.00 dinner plus taxes. Chicken pot pie. The pastry flakes on top. Walnut shrimp is an adventure. Salmon melts. Shrimp cocktail is so fresh. I could go on and on but I want another plate.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AYCE desserts Creme Broule

Pbbrrmrm8Z4bZhJiktbBRw.text: The savoury food quality was very good! Replenished and not too crazy with too many options. We did the $15 lunch buffet and $10 all you can drink mimosas . So great value and fun time. The dessert bar was disappointing as all those cute little dessert cups tasted like glue.  I saw many plates that just left 100% of their dessert behind... shame...

qY--KXmO-SP4o-2AfFQejQ.text: First then coming here since it has changed its name and remodeled. I did not care for the buffet at this hotel before the renovation much but I am glad to see they have done some good upgrades to their food variety. I like that they have some small portion options so you can try a little here and there. I was super excited to see elotes and they were good. The roast beef was cooked just right and I also enjoyed the pork shu mai. The dessert section was by far my favorite! They had a wide range of desserts from gelato to macaroons. You can even get a Cookie ice cream sandwich made with gelato. The macaroons were delicious and I think I ate over a dozen of them by myself with no regret. The creme brulee was perfect as it was not so sweet. The price for this buffet is reasonable and worth checking out if you are looking for a buffet to eat at. Will definitely be back myself!

WGL0zQ59XhSDcFTHuaI8wQ.text: Here's the problem.  The food is different and quite good, especially for a low cost buffet.  And I can't fault the service.  However, they play the f*cking music so loud that it's almost impossible to have a conversation.  I complained to the assistant manager who told me she could do nothing about it.  When I did get the manager on the phone I was told the level of music was decided by higher up.  I called the food and beverage director who failed to bother to call back.  The same with the hotel manager.  What I was told was they want to cater to a younger crowd.  You know - people who have no money.  It's a shame but they have lost a customer until such time as they realize adult enjoy a meal without music blaring in the background.

ztlHaG1MG9mzRCUEmzb3qg.text: We had the breakfast buffet this morning. With players cards, the total for 5 of us was $55. This is a wonderful buffet with SO MUCH variety from gelato to Chinese to sopas to omelette bar to vegan! Our server, Eduardo, was a pleasure! Definitely returning!

9s9iFE5AmfIFAqlXtAuzNg.text: The food is average but the price is very affordable for a big hotel like Palms. I like they have smaller plates so we can try many things. The ice cream gelato is very good with many flavors.

PVR9suknrPR6Tyfpt30rPw.text: Nice place to eat at, decently cheap when compared to other places. It also has a wide variety of food but not a lot of that makes sense. This place has good smoked meats and stuff in my opinion.

RnoDYHEF8XgM6D0Ey6tcvQ.text: We have Breakfast buffet, It is good and nice place, but (too much Carbohydrate  and food.) We do not like too many Carbohydrates. For us, It is not to many we can eat there !

YgApG1CcombAnrgia7m7Ag.text: Went for lunch hungry as all hell, came out fat, happy and satisfied. Had a lot of options and variety. You can tell the difference of the food compared to other buffets. It actually has flavor. My only complaint is that I couldn't ear more. Can't wait to come back.

FuzB_HyLt6mfKyTUW5R97A.text: The wait is just unbelievable. I het it that you have to wait at a vegas buffet, but waiting over an hour to get a table for two is just plain wrong. Never coming back.

bN0TLSB4RolGQgYxq88ahQ.text: My bf and I Decided to give this place a go on our recent vacation because we have never tried a Vegas buffet.  The good: cheap buffet, good variety of food, the asada and hot chetto corn was my fave, good dessert, the chocolate covered strawberries were bomb! You definitely leave full! The bad: the food was cold and that definitely made the food not taste the best. None of the food really blew me out of the park.We were suppose to get money off for getting a players card, but still paid full price. Off strip location.

Rw6zl4Qq_nD1qz3nkQ7Zjw.text: selection was horrible. the food was nothing like the pictures shown. the pictures shoed certain food items that were not present. we spent 55$ here and it was only worth 20.

z0OA-OJ0ohdDACuYRq86qw.text: Nice and fancy type of buffet! I loved the variety of food provided and the bottomless mimosas was a extra fee but it was worth it! I had a good breakfast.

kzWbAZQuTBTQt0PwBphGwQ.text: I tried all of their daily buffets and some special ones they offer for holidays.  Variety and quality are great. The only thing I miss here is some granola - yogurt - fruit based choices. They offer a couple of cereals, but options in this department are limited.

jmKOVAvypcz4SCCZn6KBig.text: Food was good but nothing special.  We went on a Friday expecting for seafood but when paying we noticed they were charging only $20 per person (much too low for a seafood buffet).

6a04r7chLP5BPbNBWoW9qA.text: We went for Sunday Brunch and it was great!! It cost a little more than we expected but with our players card we got $10 off, it was great . Our server was Salvator and he was so nice. The food was great , it had such a great choice of foods. I am a Southern girl and I love me some biscuits and gravy and their gravy was just like I am use to it was so good. Will be going back soon to try lunch

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband has been looking for some good Bread Pudding for awhile , he loved this

iML8z1ZcoVz-wzdhbZV66w.text: What can we say. Rosa, Chris, Kevin. Make this place one of the most amazing buffet experience. The way they interact and are on top of everything made us feel welcome, and very special. We have been in all the buffets here at Las Vegas and this place is one of the best. There is a variety of foods and all of them tasted really good. Thank you guys for all your great service.

XcbyCrFrL5vB6lsSMPq3MA.text: Came back again and food was fantastic, some entrees were a lil unseasoned but that's just to my taste. They service was spot on this time! Waiters promptly refill our drinks and the management was very personable and ensured our time there was well spent.

sKxaxzU7IA_dTZ5Qv_4t6w.text: My family and friends - goto place prior to this years renovations. Very convenient when staying at the Palms Place or one of luxurious suites. I have to admit they have much better quality food than Rio buffet and M/Imagine resort located at the far end of the strip. Worth the price and as always impeccable service.

FiGoBb2qHJNR-6WMURQKfw.text: Food was just ok. Didn't experience anything particularly unique or spectacular. The meat carving station was normal, the pasta station was regular and the salad bar was ok. The Asian food wasn't all that authentic, (as expected). The dessert corner was just ok. Glad they had gelato otherwise the desserts would've really sucked. The wait to get in was ridiculously long (1.5 hours). Aside from having precious time with family union, needless to say, this place wasn't worth the wait. Not sure what the hype was about.

t4cDCCiewcHJVOwN8zaO1A.text: Food was decent, our waitress was great, the main reason for the 3 stars instead of a solid 4 to 4.25 was the wait to get in and the way its ran/set up.   We waited in line for a solid 30 minutes even though there was only about 7 or 8 groups in front of us. This was also 30 minutes before they were going to close. So we finally get to the counter pay and have to wait while the hostess is "finding" us a table. Once she walks us past the wall where the tables are literally half of them are empty/no one using them. So the dining room is half full at best and we're waiting a half hour lol??? There was easily enough tables for everyone in line to be seated all at once. I sorta can understand if they are trying to make it look busy but this was right before they were closing and they're making us wait for nothing! Im not sure who the manager was or if there even was one but anyone can immediately see the line/seating set up is horrible, get it together Palms.

GogmkFe02h_j9HuiIvUeRA.text: Honestly. For the money, this place was better and had more selections than the Bellagio buffet. I know. Hard to believe, but if a couple bits of fish are worth paying $30 more for then go for the fancier buffet. If you want a damn decent meal and still have plenty of money left over give it a shot.

FiIM5bwSLlRXWRDZo40u6A.text: This buffet is amazing. I had visited back in March when I saw a billboard advertising it and was intrigued. I had a variety of specialty dishes, and I appreciated the updated food. Usually there's pizza at a buffet with the basic flavors, but I saw Stromboli's and unique pizza toppings. The asian food section had mini poke servings and the best pepper wings I've ever had in my life. The servings are small and individual, which is appreciated because I like to try a lot of different dishes, and it stops you from going too HAM on one item and basically wasting half of whatever you instinctively got. The service is good, and they keep the mimosas coming. It was amazing and I came back with my family the next morning. For me, it's always ritual to have brunch at the Wynn before heading back home. That's changed, and will be visiting AYCE for brunch from now on.

or93VQ8wRQkamF5Ew-949g.text: This place exceeded all of my buffet expectations! The price point for a Friday night was perfect!  Been too a couple of buffets at other station casinos and this one is 10 steps above the rest of them. Highly recommend to go here and I will be back!

m_F2oNDCUvAJeTeLn_Zdew.text: My new favorite buffet it Vegas. Can't wait to return. From the variety of foods, cleanliness and service/staff. We were completely satisfied! The kids had fun with all the desert selections, including ice cream sandwiches and gelato. Will be our first stop when we return to LV!

0Gme5m4WEpUjpcOJCKAfDA.text: $13.99+ with players card is really worth it. The place is clean, the selection of food is not a lot, but it's just right. They also have pasta station we're you can ask them to cook it for you, unlimited drinks too which is very awesome.

JaMRZ6k8mWOLyfJ5EhMVGA.text: This is probably one of my most favorite buffets in town! They have various yummy options that you can choose from. Personally I believe the price is very reasonable, especially based off of all the options they have. Don't miss out!!

lRErjA_TjVPqKSAzWq2tPA.text: 18 dollars for all you can eat! How can you Go wrong! Everything was so good with so man different things to choose from. BBQ, Asian, salads, deserts and more Great service, quick clean up of your old plate and to refill your drinks.  I wish I went there for dinner one night.  I was expecting a price of 30 plus

stMuBJ8j-f_vTZpHqFuKQg.text: Hands down one of the best buffet places in Vegas that I have been to. Not only is the quality of food really good but also the price is very reasonable. Our server is great as well. I will definitely consider going back there on my future trip.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

acgWOHUFwE7PeGvxW9LB0Q.text: New Years Eve dinner with friends - my first time here with the boyfriend. We had some awesome grub! I didn't expect it to be as diverse as it was. Lots of items to choose from - you definitely won't find Hometown Buffet food here. I liked the desserts and the Italian food the best. Serving some Asian fusion dishes too was a plus in my book. The seating was very comfortable, tastefully done and roomy. I didn't feel squished in or rushed by the servers. Chris was our main server and he was definitely on point with our mood. He rolled with our conversations and had some laughs with us. We appreciated his good nature and courteous attitude. It made our dinner even more pleasant. I hope that we sit in his area again when we return to Vegas. He is quite the host. Thank you Chris for being a wonderful server! Keep up the great work :-D  Lastly, Bring your casino rewards card so that you don't miss out on possible savings. Pricing is typical for a Vegas hotel buffet but this one is sure to please. You won't be disappointed.

_8k2Hb1YcLWS1cLKEsAABQ.text: I don't know much about all the buffets in Vegas but this one was awesome! A lot of options pretty fresh food. I removed one star just because the fried rice we got, the rice was pretty hard. So it had been sitting out. But besides that it was good and for the price you can't beat it! I will say we didn't get to try the hot Cheetos corn. But we tried the macaroni version and were not fans

2-w420aXg7-3fOPsr4USqA.text: Got to do this on opening day!  Hadn't done the old one, so I can't compare to before, but did like this one. Very interesting to have a Vegan station.  While I'm not vegan, I did try and like a few of their dishes.  It's not necessarily spectacular in their selections, but the price is very good. I'm sort of guessing it'll go up in time.  Many portions are served in their own container, not unlike Wicked Spoon (one of my fave buffets in Vegas), which is a nice touch.  Also like how the desserts are actually small, so you can sample them without wasting.

xqEMpXfSPAVTuPulZkxFuQ.text: Nasty food. Make my husband have stomachaches. We try to go to Rio seafood buffet but they closed. This buffet I heard it's new. But seriously their food nasty. Crawfish frozen, sushi old, fishes dried.... omg no word describe...

Me6dw6o-LmDc4ohptFpfKw.text: I'm not gonna lie, I was drawn to this buffet because I heard they had a vegan section. While I'm not a vegan (I'm a pescatarian) I LOVE trying awesome new vegan offerings... especially in Vegas.  While my favorite dish didn't end up coming from the vegan section (it was the salmon), I definitely enjoyed my dining at AYCE and would consider coming back in the future.

pAYAT9wR32di97gJvbVA5Q.text: Food was good! Pizza could have been better felt a little off. Loved the mahi nahi, it was very delicious. But wendy our server was better! She was very attentive and reliable!

6BtWZ_meA5UkepQsbRev6g.text: We decided to try a new buffet in Vegas.  This popped up and here we are.  It is located in the Palm's casino.  I actually have never been to the Palm's.    The price is reasonable (about $23 with their player's club card) but there are no crab legs or much of any seafood choices.  Some of the station choices are smoked meat, pizza, Asian, carving, and vegetarian.  There aren't a ton of choices at each station but almost everything I ate was surprisingly good.  The Chinese Char siu was really good probably the best thing I had there.  The Salt and Pepper Wings were also delicious.  The pizza had crispy crust and good flavor.   There weren't many dessert choices (no donuts or cotton candy) but if you want/need sugar free there are quite a few choices.  I had some spumoni gelato.  It was a nice choice.    They weren't super busy which is good but some of the dishes were sitting for a long time and needed to be changed out.  The baked beans had a nice pudding like film on top.   Anyways, a good choice if you don't like a lot of seafood and don't want to pay $50 for your buffet.    Our server was great.  She was on top of getting refills and removing dirty plates.  That is not always the case at some other high priced buffets.  Give it a try!

lM3g_zYcBTfBrZST-X1BYA.text: Wait wait wait is all you do in line ! They need to shut it down and make it larger ! Ridiculous you have to wait to eat sooooo long !!

Gb6JAXEiAPWZ-9Tu2tzGcw.text: We had to try A.Y.CE. with all the advertising blitz flooding our mailbox! Turns out we were not disappointed at the Lunch Buffet. Food was great, but not much  seafood selections to choose from. The staff was courteous and very helpful. We fed three adults for less than $50 alunch for three can cost way more at other Buffets around Las Vegas. From a food quality to cost ratio, this is a good deal. We may go back for the Dinner Buffet someday.  Update July 25, 2019 It's been a year since first coming to A.Y.C.E. With family in town and wanting to go to a buffet, this was an opportunity to return to A.Y.C.E. for that dinner mentioned above in my original 4Star review. Tonight's visit was "No Bueno". It took well over an hour to wind through the line and get seated. I started with the short ribs, and the meat was cold. Not even the heat lamps it was sitting under could help it. I discarded that plate and tried to look for Italian...yeah not happening. They had pizza that tasted like cardboard. Not much variety. You get a pasta plate cooked to order though. Maybe my expectations was too high based on the great experience last time. I don't know, but I do know I didn't like the food. The soup and salad bar looked okay and the sweet deserts were really good. But Pistachio Ice Cream is suppose to be cold. Cooked red meat, ehhhh....Not so much. Get the Palm Players Card because it dropped the cost down from $24.99 to $19.99. Way cheaper than any buffet on the Strip. I'm dropping my review from a 4 to 3 Stars.

oH8OBk3xDZhnplnSvvVIww.text: I love how they renovate it. The new management did a great job. Very good selection of foods, clean, neat and friendly servers. There are slow days and the short staff was noticeably but overall great! Been here a few times.

P6-pAY8tbEGfCVMLvwQYrQ.text: It was about 22$ per person. We went here after arriving at our hotel. We arrived at the buffet around 5:40pm and didn't end up actually in the buffet until 7:00pm. It was one heck of a wait. I figured it must've been amazing if so many people were waiting in line.   No, it wasn't amazing. The service was good. They were short staffed it seemed and I could see they were doing their best. The food was just...not good? Pasta was undercooked, sushi was mushy, prime rib was tough, pizza was gross, imitation crab was oddly chewy and even the breadsticks were off. The desserts were just ok. The icecream tasted like it had been left to melt for several hours rendering it to a foamy consistency.   Anyway, we won't be back.

BOcRLgHL9yyeQTU2-HsnUw.text: Yanet is AMAZING!!! Great times as always! Our favorite buffet in Vegas! Check out the art in the hotel afterward!

rCa-ahcGEiRiW3dfyEL9LQ.text: This was probably the best buffet in terms of food quality that I have been to. The food had great quality and selection. There was a killer chicken salad in the greenery area that I kept getting more of. The BBQ meat selection was perfect. I will return next time I'm in Vegas and looking for a quick bite.

PZL6_Ktfsc9olImg6Ojq6g.text: This Buffet is definitely a favorite because of their quality and good selection. Nothing is ever too salty which is a must. They have many different good to choose from like Southern Food, Mexican, Asian, American and a Salad and Soup station.

A_2mZAvqY4VP_0yyVfVYjg.text: After this review, their G.M., Freshta Soltero, contacted me.  She said she was disappointed that we had such a bad brunch.  She invited us to come again, and she would send me a coupon to do so.  The coupon never came, so I just figured I would contact her when we were ready to try them again.  A week ago I messaged Freshta again, telling her we would like to try it again, and for her to contact me with how we go about doing that.  I never heard any response from her.  I guess I should have expected that from them.      I certainly now do not recommend going to this Buffet.  The town is full of good Buffets.  This is not one of them!

1oGiABE8zL3Nkar0Tx3GHg.text: This was an outstanding buffet. We got a good deal with our players card. Dinner was about $17.99 per person with the card but if you get it before 4pm it's way cheaper. Loved the crawfish and mussels that came in the little buckets. The bbq tri tip was worth it in of itself. Had a nice Smokey taste to it. Also good place for Mongolian bbq. You really can't go wrong here. Quality wise this is the best buffet you could get for the low price. Definitely worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels and crawfish
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mongolian bbq
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb stew and fish

EG8IC3MKwy4OOsNUyY7B1g.text: Ate here for a late brunch in May 2019. Very very large selection of options.  I don't eat buffets very often but, I'd strongly consider stopping in to this one again. Good coffee and bottomless mimosa's

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qA-tSUyURITjgOVznMH1ew.text: Went to A.Y.C.E. For breakfast yesterday. It's kinda your run of the mill Vegas hotel buffet. They had you different style ethnic foods and standard breakfast items. The ham at the carving station was very good. And the omelette station. Those 2 things I feel are the saving grace.  The fruit selection was awful a serious let down.  I been  to a lot free hotel breakfasts that were better than this. Don't really have much more to say. Just a average 3 stars

NMXv47MKlbWQ4UK5uKyy3g.text: We came here very late last minute before closing and let me tell you, this is my favorite buffet in Vegas for dinner. Even though they were about to close, they were literally still serving fresh food till the minute they were closing. The closing time is 9pm but they serve till 9:30. The steak here was literally to die for. The steak was better than most steak houses I've been to and that's not a joke. They have a vegetarian section filled with tofu options, they have a sushi bar, and they have a really good bbq and meat selection. The salad bar they have was gigantic. This buffet was very classy on the inside and it was a place where I could truly enjoy my dinner. I plan on coming here decently often and will be recommending it as my favorite buffet.

me4zKdVPLp_-i6MsXA0QXA.text: Great variety of food at a reasonable price for Vegas. Only real problem was the 45 min wait, which I've been told it could be up to 2hrs. For that kind of wait it probably wouldn't be worth it. Our 45 min wait was probably the max I would wait.

bT8hL5ovdMu3BaNeCORF-w.text: I have eaten at countless buffets in Las Vegas but this one was an unexpected and welcome surprise.  The line at 3:15PM on a Friday post July 4th deterred my family at first, but my father asked an attentive manager named Mary G. if there was any way at all to get the empty VIP line to help.  Elviva began assisting and from there on it was a smooth and quick 15 minutes to the register.    The buffet itself was very affordable and the fact that the staff was so responsive and reactive made a good experience into an exceptional visit.  Jacqueline, the hostess, is a genuine ray of sunshine, and Marilyn, our server, took care of all of needs promptly with a smile on her face.  It is rare to actually have buffet staff who wants to engage with their patrons beyond the usual pleasantries; Marilyn was super sweet and kept us entertained!    The food was damn solid too!  Standouts include their garlic mashed potatoes, salt and pepper wings, pork ribs, and delectable French onion soup.  Mary also recommended we come back for the homemade chicken pot pie.  Dessert did not disappoint either.  The berry cobbler tasted like the most amazing blueberry muffin you have ever had!  The strawberries dipped in white chocolate and the little cheesecake cup were the bee's knees.    Overall service was 5 stars and the buffet quality, taste and selection earns 4.25 stars.  I will be back with my family next week!

rJ7vmPR4rwDXqA1Va9db0w.text: Great buffet, great service.  Isabell, our server ,was right on top of things!! The variety and quality is excellent. The atmosphere enjoyable and upbeat.Sure, the Caesars palace is better. It's also three times the price!  Also, at the hotel Re-design is amazing. Check out the art while you're there!

MqsIephvfx1Cby7v12rm1w.text: Very disappointing! At 3:15, there was over a half-hour wait for lunch. There was only 1 cashier in the regular line, and there should have been 2 cashiers because there were plenty of empty tables inside. And there was no handicapped line. Also, there were hardly any cooked vegetables. The only ones I saw were carrots and Brussels sprouts.

X9LQmpnifS03UA8FnbTCXg.text: Absolutely fantastic buffet.  The food is great, the managers that were on the night I went Mary and Magali were terrific, and the service staff is wonderful. The buffet is very crowded because of the 2 for 1 the Palms is offering and the lines are long but it is worth the wait.   I am handicapped and Mary got me a table close to the front which I thought was very nice of her.  The food was fabulous, new item honey chicken was delicious, and the apple pork chops as well.  Actually there wasn't anything I didn't like.  I wish they would add more dessert, otherwise I think this is one of the best buffets in town.  Magali the other manager went out of her way to get me my tea and cream because our server was taking care of a very large party that was just seated.  That is what makes this buffet great, the managers care and it reflects on the whole buffet, servers, food handlers etc.  They make you feel special and make sure you have a wonderful dining experience and the food is absolutely delicious..... to me one of the best in Vegas....

VssroqQpxYGBKmoC0GxmnQ.text: We had gone to the buffet because we had a two for one I just happen to of been on graduation day so we paid for the other buffet and sat down at our table and ordered our drinks so pretty soon getting up the food may look good but the taste is just not there there really wasn't one thing that was really good that they had displayed out there so I decided to get dessert and I saw that they had brisket it just looks fair it did look really tender but I decided to try it so I took it back to the table had to bite so I couldn't take it anymore so went back to the desserts was nothing to speak about so basically it wasn't worth it the next night went to palace station middle woman there who had gone there to the Palms the night before and she said the same thing the food at the lbs was not very good

47xbOubIFb1SyJ4Q543V2g.text: Let's start by saying I'm not a buffet person   I reluctantly came with family from out of town.   I started off by walking the buffet to plan my meal. The last area was the smoked brisket and that is pretty much where I stayed   The smoked brisket was amazing.  Thick smoky bark. You couldn't  go wrong.    They made food in relatively small batches so it was always fresh   They have a pasta station and the possibilities are endless there.

vrFHBGE8DvRw63yKeCAK9w.text: ~TOP CHOICE FOR BRUNCH~Love this place! Best Desserts in Town! Hot gooey fudge brownies to name one my favorites. Our waiter Dwight was amazing! He's customer service was on point! Swiftly brought more champagne and took dirty plates out of our way. Great thing with this champagne brunch is it's super reasonable with your players gold card discount it was $17.99 plus tax.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WPj6IG9XEFyRqITPuXV_TA.text: It's a small buffet but the food was ok. I guess I expected better tasting food. The service was excellent and very attentive to everyone. They all had smiles on their face. And this limit of 2hrs. threw me wayyyyyyyyy off!!! I've never heard of such a thing. I'm not a fast eater but I sure felt like now I have to eat fast. That wasn't a gOOd feeling!!! I may be back

w9YTatSpU733VZzoq4ZSxg.text: I went for dinner before with some friends and enjoyed the new ways of this buffet. I invited my family for breakfast and was blown away. Such great assortment for breakfast. It was almost like brunch quality. And most of the portions were plated individually and almost perfectly small I LOVED IT! Our server Embet was great. I mentioned it was my nephews bday and she put together a special dessert plate with candles and brought out some staff to sing. Truly unexpected. It will be my go-to when I have guests in town. They even started putting out the lunch items a little early so I was able to sneak some fresh salt and pepper wings

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Individual Spam fried rice!
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast danish display
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gelato!

g5xPzkZFBzpBAhYwzODsgA.text: What a difference! This used to be a very average buffet but now that Stations owns this place.... They've  been slowly upgrading everything and they put their magic touch on this buffet.   The food options are great! Service is great! Ambiance is great!  The brisket, ribs, sauteed broccoli and brussel sprouts were all on point.  They have a great dessert station too.    For those with special diets... They offer vegan desserts and vegan food options.  Gluten free options too.  Stations Players card gets a small discount too.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rzuX4r2VdJDfJrU1vcarag.text: This review is from March of 2018 from another site I do and realized I hadn't posted here .  I have gone back a few times and it has improved slightly .  I wish they would bring back that Moroccan Lamb !   I have been going to the Palms for over 10 years and have been to several of their Buffet changes . It has always been average or worse . They are trying with this new menu and decor . I do have to say the Moroccan Lamb was really good and so was the French Onion Soup . After that it kind of goes down hill . My son who loves fish and seafood said the Crawfish with the Clam cup was bad and the crawfish was black inside .   I love BBQ so I was looking forward to that . Well , not that big of a selection . The brisket was smokey and the bbq sauce on the side was okay and I even tried the Carolina sauce which was okay . I got 2 pork ribs and they were okay , but when I went back the 2nd time they were a little to pink so I didn't get again . Mashed potatoes with turkey gravy was good .   Generals chicken tasted bland and frozen dinner like and no fried rice only white . Pineapple at salad bar was fresh and made a small salad which was okay . They had small wedges and shrimp cocktails too . The desserts were ok and they have gelato . The staff have ugly white shirts and they didn't seem to happy at the entrance . I heard 2 hostesses having words . Our server was nice , but messed up our drink order the first time which she quickly corrected . Corn bread was good and moist not dry like most places .   All in all , thank goodness I used my points from players card and not payed for it . They also changed the Cafe . We ate there a couple of months ago and hated it . It was much better before . We used to eat there often and it was a little cheaper and the food quality was better . They still have great desserts though .

1hLs6U93qZvo31HSwEWFqQ.text: Too loud with Dj cranking the music so your dining experience  Ruined. No way to have a conversation

X1-xk1kE743lzBt4R5-B7A.text: We ended up here based on the Yelp reviews and the hopes that it would be a shorter wait compared to other places.  We waited about an hour.    The food and service were both mediocre, at best. The waitstaff seemed to be working hard, but she was either in the midst of helping someone else or no where to be seen.  The carving station chef seemed to play favorites, but freshly grilling some customers' meat, while telling others that he could not do that.  The food seemed to be plentiful throughout the buffet.  Given the price and the wait, I'm not sure this was worth it compared to other places.

s7ZCnh8tfDLoFqDq4RfrGA.text: When in Vegas, you must buffet (amongst other things)  I saw this place, photos, reviews. It's misleading. Most of the food here was not great. Most were salty, dry, underwhelming things. As someone with cheap family who will drive 9 miles to go to an unnamed Casino for a buffet, I wanted to keep them on the Vegas strip and have a well priced buffet. After going here, I'd rather drive the 9 miles off the strip... (or just pay more)  The pictures are misleading. Most of the meat selections are dry and salty. Some sides has no flavour or they tasted like they were made from frozen. The people are nice, friendly, the place is very clean and well kept, food is always being replaced and filled. The one thing that was very good here if I recall was the bread pudding - so delicious I had 3 servings (but you don't go to a buffet for this :D)

LuKcW7FHWvHVDMzT5qvpBg.text: After searching for the cheapest buffet in Vegas, I was not disappointed with the quality of the food.  They had lots of choices from meats to vegetables and desserts.  For only $19.99 for dinner with the players card it was definetly worth checking it out.  The manager and the server were very nice making our experience even more delightful.  Thank you for your hard work and services.

1zWZS1_GlW0_m_Rv-AzN2Q.text: Service is better, but food is not.  We have been Palms regulars for 17 years, and were very happy with AYCE when it first opened. When AYCE opened, the food was great, but their service was indifferent.  Today, things have changed. The servers are much more attentive, but for our last three visits, the food has really gone downhill:   Ribs have been very dry;    Brisket has been very dry;   All of the rolls on the salad bar were dry and stale;   Walnut shrimp (my wife's favorite) is no longer available;   Shrimp cocktail and wedge salad were warm;   Creme brulee had no crust on the top;   Mini desserts were warm;  Kitchen staff seem poorly trained:   Cook sliced the brisket with the grain, instead of against it;   Dessert cook does not know how to crust the top of creme brulee;   Pasta cook served separated alfredo sauce.

okOGuYXWBBswT9Ro8h-Vbg.text: By far one of the best buffets I've been too.  Don't usually do buffets due to bad experiences but this one is actually good!

QztMP-nu5_qqFi90-QtySw.text: A.Y.C.E. really focuses on the comfort food! If you're looking for a fresh seafood-heavy buffet, this obviously isn't the place, but if you're like me and you don't eat seafood anyway, this buffet is definitely a more justifiable price. On the other hand, if you're on a low-carb diet, this wouldn't be an ideal place for you if you have trouble resisting temptation...  When I say comfort food, I mean it: hush puppies, mac and cheese, Cheeto-crusted corn, pizza, bread, steamed dim sum, and a plethora of desserts. There's a DIY taco area, DIY noodles area, a salad bar, and a charcuterie, but as far as I remember, not a huge selection of fresh fruits nor a cheese table if that's what you're into. I'm a big fan of snack foods in general, so although this buffet is neither super-fancy nor super-healthy, I definitely get my snack fix.   Our waitress was very nice and attentive and always made sure our plates were cleared and beverages were filled. The interior is just beautiful to look at, and the ambiance is good for having a conversation without needing to yell over others.

qfUkvhDmwm_Ev5-jLPWRcw.text: Nothing stood out to me on this buffet.   The price is good but you get what you pay for.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast

gZIiv3TdZ6S__ItvPGTlzg.text: Great Mimosa brunch buffet. Bottom less Mimosas. My wife and I were treated like royalty by server Salvador thanks.

8r4IbEdQJE4c-D5MJqMyjw.text: I'm giving the one star to our waitress, who was sweet.  This buffet was AWFUL.  All the meat and fish dishes I sampled were dried out, chewy and/or tasteless.    They labelled one item "Crab Salad", but it was so obvious that they used KRAB, the fake stuff.  Maybe they need to focus less on offering 20 million options that ALL SUCK and concentrate on making atleast one or two options that are actually edible!  This was hands down our WORST MEAL IN VEGAS!

nAOYvG065pgacUb5T7BZtg.text: Beautiful place with wide open spaces, food choices not to my liking, tho! Only really neat thing for me personally was the desserts, Raspberry tea and the Chinese food was pretty good.  Their food in general seemed made from scratch! Their Gelato was not The best, I've  tasted.   The wait staff was excellent and that alone deserves 5 Stars!! I really commend the wait staff and I happen to meet the manager of the Buffet, Kai...she is an A+ person, graceful and courteous.  I would recommend this one just for the atmosphere, very pleasing to the eyes, food is made fresh with nice popular choices. Their different stations were clean/neat, gelato choice is an extra bonus. A lot of delicious fresh fruit and nuts in many many varieties as well as dinner rolls....All in all a good choice for brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini desserts to die for! And beef sliders were made fresh..

7lMJKHeUIauHkQocuBR9HQ.text: Sad to see.  After four visits during 2018, the great A.Y.C.E. is no longer great.  We went last night, 12/06/2018, and it was not good.  Things have changed.  Surly unfriendly table waitress, most food was so dry it was inedible.  Fish dishes dry, all of them.  Asia food way over cooked, no more Walnut shrimp, no General's Chicken.  Sushi was old and hard as a rock.  Tuna "poke", totally tasteless.  We were there for a little over an hour and sat facing the meat slicing station and smoked items.  I visited that station four times and could never get anyone to serve me the items I wanted.  Tried to get the guys on next station to help and they completely ignored me.  Never got smoked meats.  No duck dishes, no lamb dishes.  They eliminated the wonderful mashed creamy sweet potatoes.  They have also eliminated the macaroons at the desert area.  There were only two areas that were decent, the shrimp cocktails were nice with fairly large shrimp (3), and even though the macaroons were gone the desert area was still pretty tasty.    Bottom line, no more visits here!

LXVyquaxEjLz-LJDN6pIMw.text: Chef Michael Somer is an amazing chef! This is the best buffet I've been too. Everyone is so friendly and helpful. They have vegan options, seafood, Asian food plus more. I would recommend this to anyone that's visiting Vegas!

zLH_d0O4zhzp2EKwW0cRgQ.text: Have been here 3 times during this 5 day trip, and service was consistent. No line, nice selection and everything is fresh.

eY1M-pDZeW4RbPlFj3EojA.text: I normally don't like buffets but this place was awesome. Food at buffets usually doesn't taste very good to me but everything here was amazing!

ufHOb9IikYLzg3rMWH6vzw.text: Awesome place!!!!!!! Highly recommend, Food is delicious, great variety of meats, deserts, breakfast eggs and much more. Very friendly and helpful stuff. Price for Breakfast $12.99 for lunch $15.99. Free parking is also a bonus, will definitely come back .

BtwFnepUnwwkMBkgOZjmhQ.text: My new favorite. The service, food selection all good. I use my boarding pass which makes so much cheaper. Their chicken pot pie is a must. From the curving station, you have to try pork roast, delicious. Best of all, our server forgot his name but he is the best server I have ever met.

3GoCiLjZH9lCJaXEqJVNjA.text: During our stay at The Palms we had breakfast two days at AYCE, and my husband and I loved it. There were so many choices, and they even have vegetarian and vegan options! Our second morning we went to have breakfast we did get there a little later, they swap out to the lunch menu at 11am so we didn't get as much breakfast as the day before. But! The lunch menu was amazing as well! Again, there were also a lot of vegetarian and vegan options. All of the food was so good, and the servers that bring you your drinks are very kind as well.

mJWmMidtRWT0388Op1tGiA.text: We had such a great experience at this buffet. I brought my two small children along with seven total adults on a Tuesday at lunchtime. It wasn't crowded and we got in quick. The food was spectacular, especially for the price. They had some very cool offerings - like elote and zucchini noodles! I didn't taste anything that I didn't like, seriously. The chicken pot pie was so good also! Desserts were great, my favorite was the vanilla bean gelato and the brownie with caramel sauce on top. Service was even better. The name of our server was Ale and he was so polite and prompt with our drinks. I had to breast-feed my four-month-old here and used a nursing cover. I didn't get any dirty looks (not that I would've cared). Luckily, it wasn't too crowded and there's lots of space between tables. My 20 month old had to sit in a highchair, and the high chair was clean. I'm coming back for dinner for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pot pie, mussels, mashed potatoes, elote, and the sliders were so good!
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts! My fave was the vanilla bean gelato!

exvnb32wZnnSlSKb9C8wkA.text: Fantastic near the strip buffet  without their high prices.  Great quality food and amazing selections unlike most Stations casinos which Palms is a property  of.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cashier area

ieSKqcxMof4gOm78HVzWpg.text: Good breakfast !!! Service was amazing indeed !! My waiter was so amazing !! Omg fresh ! They had small plates so you could try different things and they have had blended juice shots with ginger!  They gave me some new tricks' haha!!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4T8XpDKoEYjSrOt4nemppQ.text: This is the BEST VALUE BUFFET in Las Vegas. There are some reviews that complain about the lack of seafood, for example. This is not the buffet for prodigious amounts of crab legs and shrimp cocktail. Come here for 1) the flavors and 2) the quality. For 17.99 with players card, we enjoyed top quality dishes, most very delicately prepared. The cuts of meat they use are excellent. You have to understand that when you choose the mini-ramekin of Moroccan Lamb, you are getting fork-tender lamb chunks and not hockey pucks. The spices and preparation are spot-on. The Korean short ribs melt in your mouth like cotton candy.   There is a honey-walnut shrimp to die for. The Mongolian beef is not only flavorful, but again uses a cut-above of meat that other buffets in this price range just would not use. Nothing tough or stringy. Also, the dessert presentation (cinnamon roll bread pudding with hot caramel sauce, for Pete's sake!) is what you would experience at a 40.00 buffet.   Peruse the other photos to get a concept of the complete offerings. I'm here to tell you that the quality is the star here. (If you're a coffee drinker, don't fail to get a cuppa the house brand, ROYAL CUP.  Bold and delicious)

_HiS7x8-6Rn5DYWQMduMDQ.text: We were enlightened to find a vast array of food choices. The environment was pleasant, clean, and the staff very welcoming and helpful. Our "Party table" had USB connections to charge our cellphones.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food was tasty! They have an area with a variety of Vegan food choices.
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plenty of desserts. I ordered coffee to enjoy my blueberry cheesecake and pistachio macaroon, delicious!

eDT53tgroxyFyDxpA_dY1A.text: A shocking new surprise in Vegas.  This newly remodeled buffet inside of the palms is absolutely beautiful.  The prices are very reasonable for Las Vegas.  We got a bottomless mimosa package for $10 each, otherwise dinner was $30. Get a $2 discount with your players card.  This buffet has a nice selection of fresh salads including a pre made Cesar wedge that was perfectly crunchy and just the right amount of dressing and blue cheese.   The pesto pasta is delicious and not over oiled.   They have lamb, duck confit, carved turkey and roast beef.  All of it delicious and fresh.  Great sushi, again very fresh and absolutely to die for bbq ribs.   The desserts were all amazing, fresh and perfectly sweetened.  Best of all our service was 5 stars the mimosas never went empty!   We will definitely be back.

x7Dkj3nPrjlrwVLv77DsQg.text: Pretty average buffet. We paid $18 per person for lunch, not $12 like some of the photos on here show. The chicken pot pie, corn, mini poke,  and several of the desserts were great. Several other things though were not the correct temperature. Good variety of stuff. If you are nearby and want a good deal, maybe. Otherwise, spend more and go somewhere else.

A_cALtkG8gmA2a5FsTbKfQ.text: A.Y.C.E Buffet is one of those buffets where you get the most bang for your buck.  $20.99 for an all-you-can-eat dinner is a deal.  Get $3 off if you use your Station Card.  An even better deal is their breakfast under $15.  As for the food, quality is just okay.  A.Y.C.E is perfect if you're trying to get calories in.  I'm not a huge buffet guy in the first place.  I'm also not a big eater unless I have to be.  I stayed away from the salad bar, desserts, and breads in order to keep my belly empty enough for the protein feast that I was going to partake in.  I had roughly 2,000 calories to spend and made sure I spent all of it.  I had 3 plates of protein and it included about 3 oz. carne asada, 3 oz. of walnut shrimp, 7 oz. of roasted turkey breast, 4 oz. of roast beef, a chicken thigh, chicken leg, 1 oz. of tilapia, 4 servings of salmon, 5 oz. of brisket, a cup of shredded cheese and one Brussels sprout.  I was craving crab legs and boiled eggs, but they didn't have it.  The roasted turkey breast and salmon were my two favorites.  I thought that the brisket and carne asada was on the dry side.  Overall, I recommend A.Y.C.E for the price.  You can say that I got my money's worth.  I arrived hungry and left full enough to skip my last meal of the day.

TJpxUB8_85asUpN-RFJ_qA.text: I loved this buffet. I'm not usually a big buffet person because I don't feel I eat my moneys worth. AYCE was very affordable, $108 for a family of 5. Four adults and one child(12&under). Loved the variety and how they had it set up. Only disappointment was the few things we went there for were not available. The kids really wanted the hot Cheeto elote (corn) and I really wanted the grilled veggies with melted cheese. This was our fault because we went at brunch and they were lunch/dinner items. We will definitely be back and take out of town visitors.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We had to get one of everything!
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail and chicken soup were good. Brisket was delicious.
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mashed potatoes were the star of the show! Boston book was spicy. Gumbo and roast beef were ok.

2ptsBXNpQiC77QrK8wVAHw.text: Tons of options and the food was great! They have different cuts of meat and also had crab legs!

a8if3xUCuDqcdvr3_5g4tw.text: This is one of my favorite buffets in Vegas! The quality of food is good for the price. I love how they don't have too many choices to where it's overwhelming, or the quality of food goes down. This is my new go to buffet. My favorite section is the Asian And seafood. I recommend this buffet, you won't be disappointed.

RhA3YX3g0ARJ124W8B9V8Q.text: This is probably THE best Stations buffet in town now. If you're looking for a buffet with actual HEALTHY options, this is the one! Champagne is even included in the price.  and Rewards members get $4.00 off with their card. Larry, one of the greeters, thanked us for our patience waiting to be seated. He told us they were short on servers (it was a Sunday at about 1140am). We didn't notice: our server Yanet was on top of everything, and we never waited for our beverages, refills or anything at all. The orange juice was very fresh, with a little pulp. Coke products served here. The champagne was light and tasty, not super cheap cheesy stuff other places serve. Great layout. The food was outstanding. On the salad bar there was an assortment of different greens including spinach and kale, ceviche, lox and bagels, fresh fruits, fruit salads, four different soups, an even shrimp cocktail, which was excellent, as was the kale apple walnut salad. I also enjoyed the watermelon citrus salad very much. There was a poke tuna on white rice which was cold and served in a dish on a frozen serving area, and was very tasty. I also loved the different take they served of eggs Benedict. My favorite item by far was the cauliflower quinoa grits--a dash of brown sugar made them excellent! My hubs had beef brisket, and roast beef. The former looked kind of grey and he said tasted a bit rubbery, and the carved roast beef was underdone, so he was a bit disappointed in those choices. He did enjoy the French roast, roast ham, pizza, and made to order omelette. We both liked the pineapple, watermelon, and cantaloupe. Pistachio gelato was great, and the dessert area was huge! Excellent coffee. Food prep areas were spotless and staff could be seen wiping food serving areas constantly, as they were spotless and free if spills, etc. All around just outstanding from start to finish! Even though it's far from our house, we will return to the AYCE Buffet, AND The Palms now, too-- as we're excited to see all the changes Stations Casinos is making here.

98Lv27lZFcPwqPui0iVxTw.text: Usually buffets are outrageously expensive, and no one has time for that when you're a poor student. But this one was not so bad when it comes to pulling out your wallet, especially if you get a player's card which will get you a discount. However, I was not so crazy about the food. My favorite items on the menu were definitely the mashed potatoes and the macarons. If I wasn't so full at the end I would've gotten an ice cream sandwich which they make personalized with cookies and their house ice cream. If I had relatives in town I would take them here to eat because frankly everyone loves going to buffets when they come to Vegas. However, I don't think I would come here on my own. The staff was very kind and the atmosphere was relaxed, but the food was not at the top of my list.

pQaqxQYPKeWz1qHE2QsFMg.text: Lots of food choices.  I am picky eater and had no problem finding something I liked.

wFFuC-AwW8MTBNLcMIolEg.text: Probably my favorite off-strip buffet. The restaurant is newly renovated,brightly lit space with plaid & leather interiors.it was done well. I went on their Saturday brunch, the variety of food is fair, but I can say that each food item is excellent(taste and presentation). I would definitely go back. Value for money is. 5stars.

HWT-w9AeozWY5lN_I4dJRw.text: The food was good for the price point but where are the elotes I thought this buffet was known for??!! When I went, there were only plain corns and I was super sad...  My favorite was the roast beef from carving station and french onion soup. Try little bit of everything and just stick with the things that tasted fresh and good. And remember that this isn't a $50 buffet!

Cl98_hm1_FZ9oJInk6KacQ.text: Amazing food selection including vegan options (like real vegan options like almond mild chia seed pudding, roasted veggies, chia seed lemonade, plenty of fruits and salads)

3837qyAAC01aBe3UDcs7jA.text: For being one of the lower priced quality buffets in town, versus $45 at the Wynn or Caesar's, it is really good. Great selection and quality. Service was excellent. The only reason it does not get five stars is because none of the food was really hot only lukewarm.  All seven stations were very good.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Pork rib, shrimp cocktail and tuna poke.

0QvgokT4QFfbaqcqkWEuQg.text: Went here for an early dinner tonight. I gave it 2 stars for the nice decor on the wall, very clean establishment, and the service. The food was a different story--I was let down by the choices they had to offer(no sushi area or seafood area) and the appearance of some of the items didn't seem appealing. Most of the hot food items weren't hot in terms of temperature. Their only saving grace for me was their Honey Walnut Shrimp and Ahi Poke bowl and the Desserts weren't too bad.  Honestly I've been to better buffets for a cheaper price. I left the buffet disappointed.

YEC8WVyPXLfQdqR-tT6xoA.text: Food was pretty good. Staff are friendly and the place is clean. However, not many options for vegetarians. We stayed in the hotel and happened to eat there for bunch and dinner (Sunday), I noticed how they didn't change the vegetarian options for the day at all. Just keep reheated the food. It wasn't that many options. So unless you like eating sushi with your mashed potatoes, then don't be surprised here. It's a buffet and they try to have something for everyone. For example the night I was there, they had jackfruit enchiladas. Also the options even for people who eat meat wasn't that diverse (at least the night I went there--basics but no one complained). It wasn't bad but I would recommend to a vegetarian who isn't picky or looking for anything special. Deserts were great. Good price for the overall experience.

s9VKZv9g_49G6nZme_scXA.text: This buffet if LEGIT!! So delicious, friendly staff, free parking. Great value! Going back for sure!!

4fnl45Lk1f7su_xP7N2QdA.text: Great food. All was very fresh and proper temps. Palms is looking great with all the renovations. Keep up the great work!

lMG1VDjw0sdpGFXVJD8oSQ.text: Our server Christopher was amazing and on top with our drinks and taking away our dirty plates (something that is rare with my experience in Vegas and I am a local). He even asked if we would like another drink to ensure we had our fill. The food was also way better than last year.

sf2Nqbdb4W2FdK5_vfJJoQ.text: It was recommended to us by an Uber driver because it was cheaper, but it's a great example of you get what you pay for. Not much selection.

PFOzaUnoPcNhLnpUfwbsjQ.text: I have eaten at one time or another at all of the Station buffets except GVR. I must say AYCE is by far a better and fresher product. All stations were clean and well presented, and the things I tried were all fresh and tasty. The service was also better that the other Stations. Keep in mind, this is a buffet with fairly quick turnover, it is not a celebrity chef restaurant. With that said, you should not be disappointed unless you are looking for something to complain about.

g7um6b7qb4V4KT885xTZGw.text: There was once a time when Mirage and other quality buffets can be had for $20. There was also a time when quality prime rib was served at most buffets... ah the good old days.  With the players card discount, the dinner buffet was a hair over $20.  The lowlights first: - beef jerky thought the roast beef was dry. And that was a medium cut.  - if you told me the shrimp in the shrimp cocktail was artificially manufactured, I would totally agree. Rubbery dry cocktail shrimp removed of any taste profile, mmmm! Goes with anything.  - very liberal use of liquid smoke on the ribs and brisket.  Granted the ribs and brisket weren't dry or indigestible (questionable) but please, there are many other ways I would like to receive my annual dose of bbq smoke goodness.  The highlights: - that watermelon was sweeeet! - the poke wasn't bad at all. A little sweet for my taste but hits all the marks on freshness.  - decent selection of various types of food though it's a sliver of each genre.  - no extremely long lines! If you're into that kind of thing.   May your experience be better than mine! Or try another place instead.

U1VNt1ECneFPB9gdJtPTRA.text: We had a fantastic experience at AYCE and it's all because of our awesome server, Josue P! Food quality was good but I must admit it was because of Josue P that made our dinner memorable. We were there on a Saturday for a birthday celebration, 21 people in our group. I think we gave him the ultimate test of patience with all of our demands and requests. He passed the test with flying colors because for the entire time we were there, Josue P remained calm, pleasant and always has smile on his face. He has a very positive personality that radiates in him. He would ask us how we're doing from time to time. He went above and beyond for our group and I wouldn't be surprised if one day he will be promoted. He truly deserves it. He works hard and is a good example to his colleagues. We will come back and we'll definitely ask for Josue P. He's a sweetheart!

rbzcfriwbxheExN42c8xlw.text: New buffet at the Palms, nice upgrade from the previous buffet here. 7 stations: Smoke and Fire, The Hearth, The Roaster, World Pan, a vegetarian station, salad station and dessert.

SqqzROfz8qquGTJg8MfqGA.text: One word: Scruptious.  We went to Sunday all you can eat/drink brunch and was flawed by the gourmet menu.  From sushi to omelettes and all in between a $20 dollar bill goes wild for selection

9ZZ1GjKpdUVlhwDT91qs_Q.text: The buffet is a great price and is decorated beautifully and don't get me wrong the food I did eat was tasty but I was disappointed I intended on going for breakfast and at 10 they were already transitioning from breakfast to lunch.

En-I0sa8BKSmAnwQuFw99A.text: Best buffet in Las Vegas with a reasonable price! There were a variety of food selections from sushi to barbecue to soup to salads and desserts. The food tasted good! Upscale looking decorations and the ambiance was good. The servers were always attentive and smiling. The only item that I did not like was their sushis because the rice was dry and I was able to tell it has been sitting there for a long time, but other than that I am satisfied with my overall experience! I am definitely going back.

0vlGSse2HijpxdkJ0pDcvA.text: NOT WORTH IT. I was with a group of 4 and we all agree, don't waste your money. Vegas buffets aren't what they once were as it is, but this one is no different than the rest. The sushi was clearly not too fresh and tasted like the ones you buy at the grocery store, 100% prepackaged. The bread was completely stale. The lasagna was absolutely atrocious. They didn't have ham, steak, Mac and cheese or pasta! What the!??? Definitely disappointed in the food choices. The service was mediocre at best, she was more concerned with the salt and pepper shakers than drink refills. We were surprised to see that there weren't common buffet items, very disappointing! It may have cost $6 million to build but save your money and go eat elsewhere.

g6QL5-twQ2f8mgQWs6etOQ.text: Came here to have breakfast but was late since they switch from breakfast to lunch 20 to 30 minutes before the time changes. So  definitely get there early cause there was a big line! We were already at the cashier during breakfast time so we got to pay that price instead of lunch!!!! We waited about 20 mins to be seated and the waiter who helped us, a young man was super nice. It was clean and had a modern look to it. I think most of the food was pretty darn good. Im not in to buffet cause its hit or miss on certain food items. But i enjoyed most of them from what i remember i liked the  cheedar mac and cheese ,  Fried rice, Pot stickers ,  Corn bread ,soup and pizza. I never been to a buffet that had a ice cream bar i was amazed and excited LOL!!!!

-yFJTTyVbr-9RE34FuY4fg.text: Was disappointed in main courses, after seeing such high reviews. Korean ribs were very tough, chewy, and full of gristle. Brisket was tender, but had an odd, artificial smoke flavor. Ribs, however, were very good, and all of the desserts I tried (and I tried alot!) were excellent. The creme brulee was especially good.

28OCvGEJJWVyMjiublE53A.text: Premium food at a reasonable price. Food was fresh and the service attentive. Great selection. An upgrade over The Feast Buffet.

9jNX2d4iIrUTjxr5IF69nA.text: This buffet is a wonderful jewel in the heart of Vegas! You cannot beat the price! $21.00  Mary, the manager, kept this place a well oiled machine even though the line seemed to have no end. Keeping all of us happy was her main priority.   The variety of food was perfect but the quality of the food was like no other buffet I have been to. It is gourmet at each station.   This is a must do!

lo1fw8jG64LX7xfZv11kOQ.text: Great food for a very reasonable price. Service is excellent. No line. Just walk in. Very happy dining experience

CYNfrvSOufSDeT463wsUmQ.text: Lunch was good because it had a variety of foods but the desserts weren't the best. They could use some improvement. Definitely will go back though.

5Q6IHbUZVFV1-3l8CuTWSg.text: The line on Saturday night took me around 30mins... fave food the spicy mussels! Cant find them anywhere but here!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great price + great food + fantastic service

q2BYbdtKRXvfvhFydg8wMA.text: The Palms recently remodeled and the buffet reopened as AYCE.  It is not quite a carbon copy of the common Las Vegas buffet. More than half of the dishes are gourmet type food or foreign food.  There are several unique flavors, most of which are tasty.  In spite of the large assortment and eclectic variety, my favorite was the old-fashioned mashed potatoes  Worth a try if you have a coupon or discount.

-ADPg4fQ1lI57h9RWSXDDg.text: Wow! Not good... not good at all. Hub and I went because a 2 for 1 came in the mail.  Also, helpers were praising this place. Our waitress was extremely overwhelmed, so service just sucked. Went up and the food and it looked really good, so I started loading up. Mac and cheese... all versions..BLAND!  The Elote with hot Cheetos was a great concept...but was cold...  Ramen was cold... no broth for Ramen. Pulled pork...tasted ok..but was Luke warm.... seeing a trend here? The only highlight was the Lime Chicken.. that was good. The Salad bar was sparse..barely any toppings...but the ranch was tasty. Ice cream was pretty good. I will not return...not with Silverton and Orleans around the corner...this really REALLY fell short!

Mrj2GrmuAIyf-ovd4geIbg.text: Went Christmas Eve. I guess the menu is just for a regular day. Not a lot of Asian food variety, no noodles, just 2 stir fry dishes that looks like it's been on the warmer too long. Carving stations are ok, Korean short ribs are great, pizzas are nice. And there's a pasta station. Desserts are are ok, I guess the posts for macarons are old.

_t30jNTGKcnB8Ix49wwISg.text: A step up from the normal Station Casino Feast buffet.  Modern, bright and clean.  Flavors were good on most items I tried.  Vegetarian options available if needed.  Mushroom Quesadilla was great!  Walnut shimp, balsamic brussel sprouts, brisket, carne asada, elotes, shrimp cocktail and ceiveche are among other notable srand outs.  Really enjoyed the freshness of the "greenery" station. Wedge salad was nice and pesto mozzarella was super fresh.   Cons: Poke bowls rice was dry. Korean short ribs were tough.   Try the macaroons!  I will be back...hoping for some coupons!!

XKjG6R0Mqk3SLz2dKzSieA.text: The buffet was real good. The price was reasonable compared to the buffets around that we're about $33 dollars and up. This buffet set me back $21.99 for a Saturday night. The buffet line had a  good selection of food from BBQ, Sushi, Chinese, Italian, and Mexican.  Anytime they have elotes on a stick in the buffet line that earns an extra star. Good selection of desserts with an ice cream bar were you can make your own ice cream sandwich. The quality of the food was exceptional. The gourmet food was made by professionals. I highly recommend this buffet for dinner and I will return to  the the palms buffet on my next visit.

6k-BO3hfes_Dhf4V6JcHwQ.text: This place use to be very good since they were remodeled.6-8 months ago. I usually seen chefs standing in front of the buffet line to observe the food quality and presentation. But now is all gone down hill food selection were scale back most food/meat were over cooked or dry up under the hot lamp, line servers were not friendly and no one checking the quality and presentation. Will not come back

EaO_fyK0uUDowkFdpj0oJA.text: Great food but they changed the menu for Easter and that was a bummer but they do have ice cream and chocolate strawberry's but I think the chocolate strawberry's are occasionally there.

P_Bb1jia51VeZvKFZnMFPQ.text: I'll say out of the 3 of us in my party, I believe I enjoyed dinner here the most. I believe the big let down was the roast beef. While prime rib is as much of a thing of the past at most reasonably priced Vegas buffets as their $9.99 prices, the beef option shouldn't be most comparable to chewing gum.  That disappointment aside the majority of the selections were wonderful. The walnut shrimp was incredible. I've never had a shrimp plate that was so much shrimp and so little coating. They did an excellent job with the poultry. The ceviche was delicious. Little things like mashed sweet potatoes were great highlights for me personally.  I didn't try the desserts, but they did look very good.  Opinions differed at the table, but the short line and the overall excellent food makes this a pretty solid option for right off the strip.

fiJ-CjEDDXW92415EFVMQA.text: Decent Buffet. Went on a Sunday for Brunch. $47 for two. Free Champagne or Mimosa.  Most of the food I tried was good. The deserts  were decent enough.  The selection of food was diverse enough. I might go again

pCb19eIE5nc4MzJujNKe6Q.text: This was the best buffet I've ever had! If you ever come here ask for Ele! He was on top of everything. This was the best service I've had in Las Vegas and he topped everyone. Not only that, the food was way better than I expected. 5 Stars most definitely. Thank you so much A.Y.C.E.!

WGmQIAOinXfI7bspTQ5G5Q.text: The food here was very mediocre. All the food was under seasoned. There weren't many options. The servers were ok. They didn't keep bothering you as you are eating so that was nice. All of the desserts were gross, especially the cookies (hard as rocks!). The line to get in was ridiculous. We spent 30 min in line because they only had one person on the register. They had another guy, but he was very iffy. He would take one and skip 3. I guess you get what you paid for. We paid $13.99 for the lunch buffet and I can see why. I won't be returning.  They have potential, but they need a lot of work.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

446GxDa9Z0k64SDOW4E8mg.text: Decor and ambiance is very nice. Interesting selections like ceviche and Mediterranean style apps.   Had the ribs, brisket, roast beef, mash potatoes, general chicken, honey walnut shrimp. All of which were...ok. Just ok.

Ke8ibiFgw9CPZRl29_NuGA.text: At list it was eatable. Did not see anything in this buffet what you see on the pictures. Simple food, nothing fancy but not overpriced and not over salted.

7wCFIGekD1VY38A5DL2F4A.text: I had a very terrible experience with the accommodations a restaurant should have when someone is bringing over 20 people. We came in after a long day of jiu jitsu competitions and wanted to celebrate with everyone. We told the front desk how many people were coming and she said we would have to tell the people who seat us. We all weren't able to show up at the same time. Even after telling the person who sat us, they sat us in an area with absolve seats and tables around but started to give the tables away to others coming. When my friend decided to sit at a long table to save it for people who were already in line given we were in the same party. This lady then asked him to leave and they said they couldn't do anything about the fact we have a lot of people coming. Then he apologized and sat back at our 4 person table. Then they decided to randomly take the table apart and make it all 2 people tables even though the entire other side was available for seating I felt they just did that so we couldn't have our group sit with us. Then we had one of the parents go up front to say something and they told us we never told them we had a big amount of people even though we pretty much told everyone we saw. I'm giving a one star for the food. The food was decent.

Sw2aVVjoG2y1b-LCIrBvAQ.text: I am a customer for several years of the buffet this time I desepciono the lunch apart from expensive compared to others the food is ugly without taste very nice decoration ugly taste and quality of food is not in the lunch shrimp or red meat I recommend better the Silverton Casino better price and more variety do not spend your money

whuPBpvsPFM8oBFrOK7d5A.text: Excellent buffet for dinner.  We went twice and the breakfast buffet was not very good, but the dinner buffet was better than the Aria's buffet. (We went there twice also. ). Everything at the AYCE dinner buffet was cooked right and with a lot of flavor. Will definitely go back for the dinner buffet, but not for the breakfast buffet.  Too many older dishes and not much I or my husband liked.

Zm95F5G9D3-oaJm2QMlT7g.text: After reading about the New Palms buffet and have been to the old one. I made sure I went to it on my yearly trip to Las Vegas last week. I went for lunch on Saturday 11/3. Two ways I rate buffets and restaurants, Overall quality where price does not matter or quality value where both price and quality matter making it a good deal. This was neither. I was so disappointed with the lack of selection and quality of the food I ate. Yes $15 for lunch with players card is a very good price BUT I didn't feel like I got my moneys worth at all. Either the people leaving these great reviews don't know any better or are getting paid to do so but I would not recommend this at all.

wBPjV85ILIKTPlW6P34-iw.text: Good price for Vegas, good variety and attentive service. We were in Vegas and did wanted to try the buffet at least once as part of the Vegas experience. This place is a bit out of the way- away from the strip but worth the drive. Very good selection and dishes did appear fresh. The pasta station was a nice touch but did it like the dish, pasta was a bit too salty but other than that all the dishes were great. Liked the small desserts, that way we can try different desserts without being full on one or wasting a few.

9oxhrT1hOmvr7_gFz6n4yw.text: Absolutely one of the best affordable buffets I have been to in Las Vegas! The selection is diverse and delicious! The multiple times I have been, I have never had a negative experience. My favorites include salt & pepper chicken wings, walnut shrimp, any of the bbq meats, elotes & the dessert bar!

ycYWWaacJafua8JV5h9hNA.text: If your looking for Good food at a decent price this restaurant is place were you should swing by,there's a large variety of food to choose from and each station was clean. I found it pretty neat to see a bbq station with a nice indoor smoker/grill and rotisserie. I would recommend this place if your trying to fill your belly and you have a taste for several different flavors, but you don't want to break your pocket book. This place is completely remodeled and spacious with a contemporary atmosphere. The staff is friendly also, however the waiter who waited on us may have been busy but wasn't as attentive at times. I say this because he passed the table a few times without checking on us, and also when he brought the wine we ordered he failed to check the cup for stains and there was a lipstick print on the rim of the cup I get it things happen and not on purpose he did bring us another glass. Overall dining here was a nice experience and the food was good. I would definitely swing through again to see what they have cooking. btw the salt and pepper wings and shrimp cocktail were some of my favorites.

5Qh0-VgqNPDedPvHOKBtOA.text: Great Place!!! Been coming here now since the remodel when I am in town, the wait can be long but it is totally worth it for the price and quality of service and food.  This place looks beautiful and everything is new from the service wear to the place and chairs.  Expect to pay low prices but receive quality foods.  Would really recommend coming for brunch as the mimosas are included.

vISBXadrQ0LOCeVLpDl2UQ.text: First time here for lunch. Felt too many breakfast leftovers so probably didn't get a chance to sample full lunch menu  what I did have was tasty and hot temp wise which is difficult to find at other buffets. Service a little slow for drink order but refills were timely. Desserts and salad bar definately worth price.

mSO1tFIL8ah5j01gh_bIvA.text: Horrible experience would not come again. The hosts were rude and the food was not worth the $63 for two people. They didn't even bother to make sure all of the people in my party were seated near each other. In fact, we had to drag several chairs from nearby tables just to squish together. Half of the food was cold. Extremely mediocre, just save your money for a more high end buffet that will actually be attentive to their customers.

-UlAPFSKJDRutZ6GB9rXWQ.text: My family and I are visiting Las Vegas from Chicago, and chose to try A.Y.C.E. to have an indulgent, full-Vegas buffet experience. While we enjoyed most of the food we tried (especially the tacos, mashed potatoes, and Brussels sprouts!), the customer service was very much lacking. We were mis-charged for an extra person, and rather than apologize and eradicate the issue, we were engaged in a 20-minute long, back-and-forth discussion with the manager. Being on vacation, we are very wary of unusual activity with our bank, and between the 3 separate charges and 2 different card transactions at A.Y.C.E., we were disappointed that a simpler solution was not offered and that the attitude we were met with was not more apologetic and gracious. However, we enjoyed our meal, and the bussing staff was very attentive and kind. We would likely look elsewhere for a buffet next time, but recommend this if you have a smaller party and want a relaxed, low-pressure, fairly tasty meal.

3GrkmRSHYFF1OZxlof5E7w.text: Tried this buffet last Thursday night, based on the Yelp reviews. The last couple of buffets we went to were Aria and Bellagio, so our bar is pretty high as far as buffets go, but this place definitely impressed us. And factor in that it was ~$22/person (without the player's card) and you got yourself a darn good deal of a buffet.   The food was very good. Actually, their honey walnut shrimp was awesome! Our favorite version is the one at Panda Inn in Pasadena, and these were pretty gosh darn close to it! The shrimp were... shrimpier and less walnuts, but for the price, I'll take it! Husband tried the brisket and it was tough, assuming because it probably sat around a bit, but he got another one when a new batch came out and he said that was much better.   The French onion soup was salty.. which I find it to be the case more often than not with that soup, but not bad.  Service was great.. she kept the refills flowing, and kept our table clear of dirty plates. Great ambiance and clean too. Definitely a great option if you're in a buffet state of mind.

pnbL8PkmvluQP28QYbF2IQ.text: Living in Las Vegas, I don't go to many buffets on or near the strip, but since the Palms has been remodeled I wanted to check it out. It didn't disappoint! It was great food great options(in my opinion) and great service. Food tasted good, drinks stayed full, and it was an awesome experience.

aywIyjVKMBzpT3zwoNkQcA.text: Besides the long wait, I liked the quality of the food and service. The staff was really friendly. There was enough variety in food selection.

caX4tV1LDAReHfluHfvjtA.text: I am a local & come here often. It's the best bang for your buck buffet I have found, for Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner. There is hardly ever a huge line like most other buffets and free casino parking which is nice. The staff has always been extra friendly & assisting. Locals choice

Pla-SVa9l2UrYhPdJP--7Q.text: Had ribs....tough & not tender. Food appeared to have been out for awhile. Choices & selections disappointing. Josh was cool, however...pleasanat fellow.

dlYYcVamoXxIGdtRrR_snA.text: Had the breakfast... very good quality for a buffet!! The breakfast pizza was amazing. The waiter was very attentive. Many different options. And the place was super cheap!!! Make sure you go get a free players card in the rewards center and you'll get the buffet even cheaper

WlzshsIC9WO1NreAv0rILQ.text: Had dinner at the newly remodeled Palms buffet A.Y.C.E on 5/19/2018 for dinner with my fiance. The price of $17.99 isn't that bad as long as you have a Station Rewards Card. At first glance the remodeled buffet area looked nice, better than some of the other station casino buffets that I have been to in the past. With trying some of the food, the salad bar area had three types of lettuce, decent amount of toppings and dressing. Also In the salad bar area there's a hummus bar with five different types of hummus to try. I tried the regular and roasted garlic and both tasted great. The salmon sushi was very delicious, even though it's not made there, it was cold and the rice was soft. The Cashew shrimp wasn't bad, had a couple of warm and cold pieces. At the pasta station the cook was very nice, there's only two types of pasta to choose from and a couple of toppings and the serving was plentiful, so much pasta that I couldn't eat it all. I love lasagna, however the lasagna was terrible, the sauce tasted water down and the meat was tasteless.  Tried a couple pieces of the beef bourguignan and it was cold, went up to the chef at the buffet and said something about how cold the meat was. The Chef tried a piece and agreed that the meat was cold and removed and replaced with a fresh hot batch. On the dessert area, the fudge brownies were heated and tastes warm and outstanding and I had to get seconds. The cheese cake was also outstanding. However there was covered strawberries that had a pink coating on them and they were way too sweet.  Overall: the buffet was ok especially for the price. Would we go again, I don't know.
