RA6V8Apr9IpIy0_imIx5wQ.text: So unfortunately I was quite disappointed with this revamped Palms Buffet! Don't get me wrong it does look better but the selection was quite lackluster. Each section only had a few items in it. It seems like they are trying to be more like wicked spoon with individual servings vs scoop out however much you want.  I went for Sunday Brunch. My favorite items were the French onion soup and apple juice! How sad is that? Not sure I'll be coming here again....

11BX6h0a4Dal1tyOzxnwkA.text: BOMB.COM Went while CES was happening so it was slow and I got to try all of the delicious food immediately. The chefs said there's usually a 2-4 hour wait to be seated. Wow I felt lucky and blessed. Will definitely be back, maybe they'll have some crab legs next

0cAn9Hgsb93YigvVwvQfkw.text: I tried the A.Y.C.E. Buffet at the Palms Casino for lunch based on the over 200 positive reviews on Yelp. The establishment is clean and spacious with tables placed far apart. There are seven different stations serving everything from healthy and vegetarian dishes to Asian to Roasted Meats to Barbecue to Desserts.  For the price it I absolutely a great value. There were a lot of choices but not as many as you might find at some other buffets but the quality of every single item that I tasted was stellar!  I tried some potstickers and spring rolls. Salt and pepper chicken wings which were fantastic. A bowl of clam chowder. Poke salad which was as good as I have found anywhere. Since I read that the pizza at the buffet was fantastic I tried a small slice and once again it was great pizza with a great crust and great cheese and toppings.  There were many other items but I didn't want to overeat and I will be back for dinner soon to try additional items. There is very little seafood (I saw some Thai Curried Mussels, but there are many other choices. I was disappointed in the Barbecue station because there was not one beef item.  The salad choices are extensive and the fruit was fantastic. The watermelon, cantaloupe and honeydew melon that I tried were great. The only thing I tried at the dessert station which was truly extensive was some pistachio gelato and that was as good as it gets as well.  The service was fast and the dishes were cleared quickly. Great value at a great price.

HPs_wpYcNElYm4bB5oOrBA.text: It was my girlfriend and I 's first time here at the Buffet and our server Jennifer was so sweet and helped us to enjoy our dining experience even better. The food was not only great but the exceptional outstanding service provided for us by Ms. Jennifer was something to remember! Our experience was really something that will make us come back again to the buffet.

cRJfbxKEbI9sjoXvaDiAIA.text: First off I want to emphasize how great our servers were. Attentive and very friendly. We had no problem with that part of our lunch. Our issue was their hostess and supervisor on the floor. We arrived there 12 noon for lunch . Our party consists of my parents (senior citizens) , my 6 month pregnant sister with her 5 year old daughter and 2 year old son, me and my wife along with our four kids. Ages 5 month old , 2 year old , 3 year old and 9 year old. After paying for our party, they told us To go  back out towards the casino floor since our table was not ready yet. It took roughly 15 minutes until they called us back in which I have no problem with it. But when we got to our table , they inexplicably placed us in two separate tables. So we asked the hostess and supervisor why can't they put the two tables together. We attempted to explain that my parents and sister are visiting from out of town and it would be nice to sit together in the same table and also it is easier to feed and watch one infant, 3 toddlers and 2 kids in the same table. The supervisor answer was because we didn't tell the hostess up front that we had kids with us. What!!!!!! It's a bullshit explanation because it totally says on the receipt which they took right after we paid to see how many in our party. And then she proceeds telling us that since we were by the kitchen they cannot put those two tables together. Then we asked if they can move us to different spot, they refused because the supervisor says there aren't any other tables open. clearly when we looked around there are plenty of open tables. Another excused she came up with was that they cannot put more than  6 people per table due to safety issues and then when we looked around again there were atleast 2 parties with 8 people and the other 10 people. All adults. I wish AYCE buffet would be more considerate to accommodate families especially those who have toddlers and kids .Then again our family is not exactly Caucasian so maybe that has something to do with. Who knows??

hzHvJnYXhUQ8oHOC92elqQ.text: It's a great experience for food, and alright experience on staff. This place is pretty brand new, they do lots of commercials on TVs and YouTubes, that's what makes me here.  Price: $22 with station casino player card on Sunday night.  Environment: it's a good place to hangout with your friends and family, pretty casual dining place.   Staff: the host lady was so nice, she was doing amazing job. During the time she lead me to my seat, she introduced me that they had seven food sections and her recommendations for the day would be French onion soup, which tasted pretty nice. The waitress was different story, I understand as an buffet restaurant staffs are always busy, but through out the entire time I sit there, she didn't refill my water and drink even once. And she even purposely avoid her customers when the table next to me was looking her. Big disappointment!  Food:  They had seven food sections. I recommend the orange chicken and Panang curry, they fried chicken pretty well, and the sauce and the seasoning was on point. The panang curry was flavorful, the beef inside were super tender.  I also recommend the BBQ items on smoke section, almost every meat items here were so tender and juicy, that really surprised me. Even the steak here is tender and juicy, it not chewy or rubbery.  Dessert: The do have variety of dessert choices. They even served macaroons, cream puffs, and cream brulees. However, the taste of those isn't surprised me as much as the BBQ items.  Overall, the food quality was not bad, but it doesn't worth $22 for sure. Waitresses need serious training. I wish yelp would let me put 3.5 stars, that's how I truly feel about this place.

58GQ-eTzkb9UEKP_6xl0YQ.text: Hanging out with Yo, Erik and Allison. It's my birthday!!!! Benjie our server was the bomb!!!

JUzsZhILj15VXX3CjohvjA.text: This was the long awaited, recently opened buffet at the Palms. If you've been to the old Palms buffet (Bistro Buffet) you already know any resemblance to the old space has been gutted, reinvented and given a face lift - R.I.P. the all you can drink beer & wine that used to be included free with dinner..  Out with the old in with the new right?- Well after my visit i am convinced that the wait was well worth it. Station Casinos have this old habit of making all their buffets painfully similar, but not this time! Palms buffet is a gem of its own. I found the food to be presented very nicely, saw a selection of items not usually found at your typical Vegas buffet, and found the atmosphere to be quite inviting.   Usually i'd be listing off specific items i enjoyed the most to members of the Yelposphere, but since this is newly introduced venue I wanted to leave some of the excitement  and curiosity intact. Kind of like a newly released movie you don't want to reveal ALL the details to. Go check it out! I've given you the ever so important assurance that my experience was a thumbs up!

3ccZ2Pq-l0oaqXA3w5iEXg.text: The newest buffet to appear in the valley is A.Y.C.E. at the Palms.  As the Station Casino's flagship hotel/resort, you can expect the re-vision of your budget buffet to make a big splash and AYCE didn't disappoint!  We skipped the hour and a half wait and opted for a late dinner at 9:20PM.  No line.  No wait.    Their grill bar serves up prime rib and short ribs that are tender and tasty.  I liked their gumbo and pea soup, while my wife raved about the penang soup.  Desert bar is off the chain.  For Station Casino card members, dinner will run you a measly $17.99.    Ask for Patricia's section - this 12 year Las Vegan and NYC native is a delight to chat with.

-q3k_H2rX_miBCwDe5aS5w.text: Waited over an hour at grand opening day. To be honest Palms needed this buffet so badly because their food court sucks! Their food court loaded with fast food and food that doesn't have any carb in it.  We went for lunch and price was $13.79 per person which is not so bad.   Food  They offer a lot of snacks, meals, salad bar, ice cream and dessert bar, but fruits selection is not big only honeydew and pineapple (very poor choice of fruits ), also I didn't saw beef anywhere.   Drinks  They have drinks which waiters available to provide. For alcohol beverages one has to pre-pay.   Sweets I tried desserts and ice cream for me it's too sweet and not tasty seems to be artificial flavored.   Overall experience 4-/5 but it could be better. I tried to come at dinner but wasn't ready to wait another hour in queue. They need to improve their coordination and assist in reducing the queue faster. We noticed that there were a lot of empty tables while people where waiting for hours to get their table.

UZsxOMSsniilbQ1O-S1aLQ.text: Went for the first time yesterday. I have bad food allergies  but I was lucky enough to find to speak with chef Adrian. He helped me find things I was able to eat worry free! Thanks to his help I will be back! Food was great but the service I received was even better!!!

fec8nSarC3cLw-hcxhr_8w.text: Too bad I can't put more stars!  Thank you Mary and Michael!!!!! My daughter has allergies and they explained the options. Michael walked us through the buffet with what items she can have. Fantastic! This is the first time she was able to eat with us at a buffet. I had fun at the blackjack tables too! We will be back every-time we're in town. Customers for life!

x7kivyOmdGLfJUmLi6djsQ.text: Surprising very good. The Palms has been working on a makeover for the casino  and changing out all of the restaurants and they did a great job on this one. Price was very good I think just  over $20 a person plus tip and the food was excellent. They had a good variety of options including smoked brisket. Definitely worth making the trip from the strip.

9396I7qBuaQJnd0K1Eo7hg.text: I read about the new renovations at Palms Casuno buffet. We came on a Saturday brunch at 3pm $15w/ reward card. The interior looks more country plaid and service people dress in denim w/ suspenders. The ayce is divided in sections. No seafood at all. They have Chinese food, al pastor was good, chicken wings were good too. Weak on greenery area. We stayed till 4pm for dinner to eat bbq ribs, brisket, boil seafood and honey walnut shrimp.  My sister said honey walnut and brisket was very good. Otherwise food is average. The staff are very good on refills on drinks and clearing the tables.

hswLwMSozhKa-XUzXy1i-Q.text: My go to breakfast buffet in Vegas. Today the bacon didn't look to appealing and Richard at the omelette station looked annoyed, what happened to service with a smile???? The good is delicious and I haven't tried this place for lunch or dinner but I'm sure its just as tasty. Anyway the hostess's were very welcoming and pleasant and our server Sal was pleasant as well. Im sure I'll be back, I just hope Mr. Richard has a better attitude next time.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette, fried steak and potatoes

EPZZXLkLdySUm6bYIikgag.text: Price: pretty affordable compared to other buffets on the strip that cost around $30-40.  The dinner here is around $20 (without their "boarding pass" card)  This buffet is better than similarly priced "cheap" buffets I've been to (like circus circus), because it's super new (opened in Dec 2017) and the food is better than I expected for $20.  The main thing difference from fancier buffets would probably just be less seafood (they have shrimp and cooked fish options, but no crab legs and not much sushi).  I like the small portioned plates - they make the food look more attractive and (hopefully) help reduce food waste.  Most notably, it was cool that they had "trendy" foods like poke (tasted meh), and ELOTE!!  I was extremely happy that they had elote, and not only that, they had THREE kinds of elote! (including cheeto-covered, which I didn't try but I thought was pretty trendy of them).  Cons: The "ice cream"/"gelato" (the one they scoop, not the one from the machine) was really bad. It tasted really weird with that medicine sweet taste.  Overall, quite a good value and nice place for $20.

l2uuetW0bFf2ymxBCMmJug.text: Decide to try out this buffet for dinner with my wife and OMG!! The food and desserts here are great!I recommend you to try this place for a night out!

tSFci7ZwAWiJrg73tumI7g.text: This is an amazing buffet.. I'm vegetarian and you can rarely get good options and chef Mike is awesome.. I repeat chef mike is awesome!!!!!! Mary is the assistant manager and she is so amazing I'm so happy -the price and service awesome awesome I'm coming back

_Y7aqfZfCEAmKi-UKM4aMQ.text: We really enjoy our experience here, food it's great, I love the small salads, the poke bowls. The dessert area it's great goes from small napoleons and cream brulee's to a great variety of ice cream flavors. the ice cream it's very creamy and doesn't leave a grease after taste in your mouth. The atmosphere it's nice a combination of modern and classic.

9uprXKyGIy3xbgFTaRNjJQ.text: AYCE is a nice place to eat with family. A clean place and I like all there foods. Stayed there for almost 2hrs

k4nvT3GHlyqKFakPGO5Tmg.text: Pleasantly surprised. Decided to try this buffet for brunch. Got there right on time so we got to have the breakfast and lunch.  It's bit smaller than the other casinos buffets but price was also cheaper. We loved everything we tried.  Everyone was friendly and we will definitely be back.

QEScz5eaoBxvWcCsaQVrVA.text: Went here with the family when visiting Vegas. First off, the prices can be deceiving. Most Vegas buffets advertise their regular price, and then point out discount with players cards.  AYCE advertises the price that very few people would receive because you need a GOLD players card to get that price. For example, lunch is regularly $15.99. With a regular players card, it is $13.99. With a gold players card, it's $11.99. $11.99 is what they have listed as the price on all their advertising. I never even see the $15.99 anywhere. That being said, we were fortunate someone in our group had a gold card which I think is good for 5 people.  The lunch buffet was very good with a wide selection of different foods. We normally hit Green Valley or Southpoint for a cheap lunch buffet, but AYCE is definitely a cut above both. They had sushi, poke, mussels, gelato. Things you normally don't find at a mid-level buffet. You're paying about 40% more than the other buffets I mentioned if you don't have a gold card. The players card is linked to all Station Casinos who also own Palms, Green Valley and Red Rock. Instead of paying the extra for the buffet with a regular card, start throwing some money in the slot machines to work your way up to gold! :)

EJeXSRHMyc42m6a_dhpAqg.text: I've been here at least 10 times I'd say since it's been open. I can say 100% I've been satisfied  every time.  Hands down I would say AYCE is the best buffet in Vegas. Usually they say you pay for what you get. I think you get way more that what you pay for. I mean 26( I believe now) for dinner is honestly a cheap price to pay especially when you're talking vegas buffets.  AYCE has everything you want when you want to have a good meal, great presentation, service,staff and most importantly food. First off the presentation is the best and  just makes everything look so much more appealing. Some of my favorites include the French onion soup, the pot pies, Shepard pies, elote, the meats..all the meats!  Oh gosh and I almost forgot the desserts, the variety and the sizing is perfect, so you can have one of each and not get too full off one thing.. I mean unless you want to. It's truly a foodies paradise. So many options!  Last but not least, the atmosphere and the staff; everyone is so friendly and courteous. One of the chefs(mike) is extra helpful and always making sure everything's going good.

vQj4ALxdINKsHTH_6KNO-Q.text: With a members card it's about to 19 dollars and this is without tip. Had a good experience. There were a a lot choices. The desert and ice cream bar was pretty good. There's also a pasta bar. For the price it's fair.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0MCl9w_3ngFknegRXVihLA.text: DON'T BELIEVE THE HYPE!!! Came on a Wednesday at 2pm. At least 20% of the stations were empty. Had to wait a minimum of 10 minutes to get them filled. The food is average but you get what you pay for. Nothing different or unique, just average comfort food. Paid full price, about $19 with tax, but should of splurged and paid a few dollars more to get a buffet with some substance. Very disappointing.

grtTUg5LMNqIow140TbLZA.text: Good buffet during the week, horrible during the weekend. And not because of the crowds, that's to be expected.  Recently, I went to Sunday brunch around noon. Arrived to a large line, which wasn't a surprise. The 45 minute to hour wait though, was a surprise.   From what I could tell, the broken link in this buffet is the turnover of tables. I watched one table from the line and noticed that it took close to 20 minutes for the table to be cleansed and ready for other guests.  Once inside (45 minutes later) and with a better view, I noticed that many tables were slow to be cleaned and prepared for more people. It looks like they use wait staff to get the table ready and a busser comes by eventually to finish and clean. The problem I could see if that they only have 1 busser per side of the buffet. And this is the reason for a slow down. One or two more people would greatly increase the speed of the lone on weekends.   As for the food and the wait staff, both are great. Waiter got our drinks quickly and the food was great, per usual. Though I was sad they ran out of French onion soup right as I got to the area.   This buffet is the best option at the best price in town, hands down. Will come back. Just not on the weekend until someone can fix this easy but debilitating problem.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All these tables need cleaning and need to be turned over quicker. For a buffet with an hour long line, this is just bad planning.
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting in line...

-A8u8FPWFYbls-LM7BKlCw.text: We had the lunch buffet at A.Y.C.E. today and loved it! Such great selection and quality for a very affordable price. They offer bottomless champagne and/or mimosas for $10 per person. We took advantage of that!  What really made the experience great, in addition to the food, was our server, Salvador. He was extremely friendly, attentive, and pleasant. Really made sure we enjoyed our dining experience.   My husband and I were surprised at how many seafood options A.Y.C.E. offered as well. Definitely a pleasant surprise.   Favorite items: -Black beans -Pulled pork -Poke  -Mac and cheese -Mussels -Mediterranean cod  -Wedge salad  -Bread pudding  -Elote w/ hot Cheeto crumbs -Gelato  There wasn't anything that was bad or not worth getting. The items above were just the highlights for me!   We will absolutely return the next time we're in Vegas. Feels like a higher end buffet at a lower price point.

kutULi7FvLfK_mMfcbvZIg.text: $19.99 for a buffet WITH INCLUDED bottomless mimosas, I'm sold. My bae and I came on a Sunday for their brunch around 11 am. The line was decently long at this point so we ended up waiting about 20-30 mins before being seated. As soon as we were seated our waiter came by to snag our drink orders. He kept the mimosas flowing the entire time, just how I like it.   The buffet had an array of items - salad/soup station, vegetarian options, breakfast items, meats, pizza, asian options and more. Some of my favorites were the bagels with smoked salmon, hummus, walnut shrimp, and the eggs benedict. Some of the popular items were quickly emptied, but the staff was good about refilling.  I wouldn't say it was the best buffet I've ever had, but it was a great deal for the price.

WU-tOPvK_SbtBjLmpJhEkw.text: My family LOVES a good buffet.  This buffet is good so I see myself ending up here quite a bit (well as long as the coupons keep coming).    I was actually quite impressed with the set up.  It looks and feels like a much more expensive buffet.  The price point is quite nice for the quality of food.    We were also here for Easter.  Nice set up and price point as well.  The one thing I will say is the desserts don't match the rest of the food.  I'm in the biz so I get it (labor and food cost are hard friends) but I was really disappointed at this aspect.  The quality of the desserts DID NOT match the food.  Yuck!  Service was good as well.

LombAg2SDM_0nuoPLhIS1w.text: Food might be good and the price is very good, but the speed and service is pathetic.

ZIyguCj6BrUK8X3RWfahog.text: The AYCE buffet is the best buffet in Las Vegas, in terms of price and value. The food is great, and more importantly, the service is even better. I'm a regular patron at the AYCE buffet, and considering that I'm a Vegas local, my words should rightfully carry weight.  I've been to every popular buffet that's located in the Las Vegas area, and inevitably I always prefer dining at AYCE over the buffets offered by both The Wynn and Bellagio -- AYCE simply crushes the competition in all aspects.  AYCE does it right every step of the way. I was initially greeted at the counter by a very friendly young lady by the name of Magda. She welcomed me into the establishment and set me up with a host as fast as possible, in order to be quickly seated.  Shortly after being seated at my table, a server by the name of Rafael greeted me and took my drink order. This gentleman was excellent at anticipating my needs, evident by the fact that he initially brought me two diet pepsi's, instead of just one.  The bottom line -- AYCE is the cream of the crop.

FSDzUVMCFv5ZTHalN-JG9A.text: So first of all I LOVE THEIR INTERIOR DECOR through out the first floor of Palms Resort where the buffet is located.    You're able to get a discount with your players card on every meal and sometimes there's a BOGO deal for meals, so be on the look out for that.  The interior decor of the buffet is still very modern and hipster. The line for the buffet can get pretty long for dinner so be there at 4PM when dinner starts, unless you don't mind the wait.   The quality of the food is not bad for the price, they have so many choices from Asian food such as a bao to American BBQ.  But all the good food does get taken very quickly, I personally loved their rib from the "smoke and fire" section but it was all gone on my second round T.T so sad. BUT on my third round, hot cheeto elote popped up from no where. I'VE NEVER SEEN AN ELOTE AT A BUFFET. This buffet is full of suprises.  There's been rumors that macaroons are served in this buffet as dessert but that's not True despite that, there's still an amazing dessert bar from gelato ice cream to mini cupcakes. Can't forget the chocolate covered strawberries!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HOT CHEETO ELOTE
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coffee comes with this cute milk glass!!!

QBikLLQ1qkZhMw6aCfbpDA.text: Very reasonably priced and fair selection of items.  I remember the old Palms buffet many years ago before it got renovated, and some of my favorite items are still there such as hummus and baba ganoush.  Holiday weekend buffet lunch price was about $17, and that was without any player card discount.  Very good price point for being Strip adjacent.  Negatives were there seemed to be a lot of chicken items and less variety of other meats. Not much seafood selection either.  The dessert items were a bit limited.  No cake slices. The positives were the ginormous whole turkey legs, tuna poke salad, custom pasta bar, and the salt and pepper chicken wings.   Service was excellent as they provided drink refills on the regular. One suggestion would be to change the name.  A.Y.C.E. is too generic and needs a better marketing name.

GIfxq57a84mf6R3QtZ9ACw.text: I love buffets. Whenever a new one opens up near me, im usually one of the firsts to check it out. So of course its only natural that when im in Vegas - I have to check some buffets out right?  We had wicked spoon for dinner on our first night - which is our usual spot to hit up when we're in Sin City. I love wicked spoon! but now its the next day we're talking about and i'm on yelp in search of another buffet. Came across this place - I thought it was a korean bbq at first because that's what its referred to in LA (well sushi too lol) but when I saw the reviews - and the PRICE, i knew i had to check it out.  We came on Tuesday at 10:45am. I didn't want breakfast items so we walked around the casino for a bit. Never been to the Palms and oh my its so nice! Around 11:10am we headed back over to the buffet and oh my word - the line was packed. We paid $16 (no players card) and it was still such a good deal.  This buffet is pretty interesting. Its not huge like the typical ones on the strip but still offered quite a lot of selections. I like the little names they have for each section. The stand outs are the salt & pepper wings, the elotes, the mac and cheese AND THE DESSERTS. I'd pick this dessert bar over Wicked Spoon any day.  Definitely coming back next time.

Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0HMZqsuJADczKR-A8KCzyQ.text: I'm updating the prices for Saturday and Sunday since have changed the prices on weekends from May 2019.   Breakfast is now brunch like lunch.  There are curving station with vary of meats like brisket and prime rib.  They changed the items many times and so always new items pop up.

4ukonoHuNhg5uQpRuMuYlw.text: The buffet inside the Palms Casino a little bit off the Strip. Went there because this place was recommended as a Las Vegas buffet that is not too expensive and has decent quality food. We went for Saturday lunch, and had to wait about 15 minutes to get in. There were plenty of tables, it's just that they didn't have enough hosts leading customers to the tables. The buffet is clean and modern.  The lunch was $16 + tax without any discounts. AYCE is set up like a food court with a number of food stalls on the wall, and the salad bar right at the entrance. There wasn't anything too fancy, but not surprising given the price and the fact it was lunch. A couple of the items that were really good were the cod pieces, the fried chicken wings, and also the catfish pieces in the little metal bowls. On the flip side, the mussels were served in a sauce that was too salty, while the pork loin at the carvery was a little dry. The dessert section was pretty decent, and you can ask the server at the station to make you an ice cream cookie sandwich. Overall, I think there were enough good items to make the trip worthwhile. I definitely stuffed myself.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lunch buffet sample

CqNDv4hw2ToddcBnw3xAKg.text: Very reasonable pricing. We joined Palms Preferred to receive a small discount. Great variety within: Salad bar, sushi, Chinese, Mexican, Roast board, soups, sides & dessert.... I can go on & on. The Kalbi beef and BBQ ribs were our favorite. The gelato was also light, fluffy and incredible. So delicious!  Some of the items like the cod and the French onion were a bit salty for our preference but every dish was made to the perfect temperature & consistency.   Will definitely be returning here with my friends and family!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Round 3
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

32205ezefsUhBbogHvF0Ow.text: We finally tried A.Y.C.E. Buffet and are so happy we did.  This might be our new favorite Buffet.  We had a BOGO coupon so pricing was great.  The line at the register was short and the cashiers and staff were so friendiy and helpful.  We thought the food was pretty tasty.  We went for dinner and we liked the mix of unique items as well as familiar fair.  For example they had individual Shepherd pies; individual French onion soups and individual wedge salads.  But they also had a salad bar with other soups.  And then there was more soup in the Asian section.  The carving station was nice and the pizza was pretty good.  Also they had great BBQ ribs - really good smoke flavor.   We admittedly couldn't eat as much as we wanted, but what we did try was delicious.  The desert selection was on the smaller side, but everything was good.  We are so happy we tried this and can't wait to go back.  Good food and great service - can't top that!

52i6XZVVfye5RcmEpys_EA.text: I asked the cashiers if I could do a walk through of this vast space to see if the Champagne Brunch, although very reasonably priced, was worth it for me for two reasons: 1) I dislike brunches because I generally do not eat large portions of anything and 2) I was diagnosed with Celiac disease (yes it is real and I almost died 20 years ago) so most buffets are very problematic for me and not worth it. I strolled around the numerous stations and since they even had 5 items in a GF section, I decided to plunge right in.   Unfortunately, as I went around to the various stations asking the carvers and people behind each station, no one could confirm that the food was GF. My table server didn't have a clue and after being told that some items that seemingly would be safe I was told were not. In frustration, I spoke to the Manager who told me that the people working there didn't really know and that she would have the head Chef Michael walk the entire line with me. Chef Michael came out, greeted me and took me around the entire buffet not only telling me all the food I could have, which was extensive, how it was prepared, but also what he could make for me as well. My gastronomic angel.  Champagne, mini clam bake, smoked tri tip, grits, yams, greens, and even GF pancakes. I think I sat there and almost ate from 10:00 am until the Super Bowl when a hydraulic fork lift would have to lift me up from my booth and deposit me in the Sports Book to watch the game at 3:30pm. How much food can a person eat in 5.5 hours? A lot. There was a great selection and with my small discount, I certainly had plenty of food that was of very good quality. Thanks again to Chef Michael for saving the day for this diner.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NrlG2teFsW6xj5Uw65AOpw.text: The Manager handled the problem like she should have. I was shocked that the table attendant was so bad but after talking to the manager, I received much better service. She understood my issue and jumped on it.

trzFktn_xh5UYbMMcRTK9w.text: I've been impressed by this buffet. I don't usually like buffets, because I don't eat a lot. The quality and the price of this place is making it a favorite. Chef Mora answered my questions regarding the food, all while he constantly checked on things to ensure quality. Yanet was a lovely server and was attentive. There is a wide variety of food and even gluten free options.   I'm quite happy to have given this place a try. Only one thing to improve on, eggs Benedict. The egg was a bit undercooked. Aside from that, great experience and we will return.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tapioca pudding and mimosas.....

tVv0IqcsH3EHzf5ztS7IUg.text: This is my second time coming to this brunch buffet and I absolutely love it! And you should know, I'm a brunch buffet expert! If you're like me and you love bottomless mimosas/champagne you'll love it here. The service is so good! Our server was Yanet and she kept the champagne flowing and was also super nice and funny! Love her!!When it comes to the food... YUM! There were so many options for someone like me who is on a pretty restricted diet. The food was fresh, delicious and I left full! As a local, I totally recommend this place. It also helps that it's off the strip and has free parking!

2Q7lwpSkvpQgnsOoVAeGOQ.text: Best buffet in Las Vegas!  Nothing here had that weird "buffet taste" that you so commonly get at buffets. Everything seemed fresh and well prepared, and the meats weren't sitting and marinating in oil.   We were able to get in for about $10 a person by getting a station casino card and going on Easter weekend.

Im6c5aj7PUjmOlfAWJzpcw.text: Let me finish off the year with one of my favorite eats.  When in Vegas, you have to hit up atleast one of the well known buffets.  We did our research, and A.Y.C.E. kept popping up as one of the best. It is located in the beautiful Palms hotel.  We anticipated a line like most popular buffets, and this was no exception.  I knock off one star for line inefficiency.  The place was packed, but people were leaving at a fast pace and tables were not being turned over fast enough.  The place is pretty big and there is plenty of room to walk around.  The price though steep for a buffet, it is still considerably cheaper than most of the higher end buffets.  In my opinion, the price was worth it for me.  The service and food both were outstanding.  I say this alot, but this place truly has something to please anyone.  They have an awesome salad bar. They have all sorts of international food.  They have a carving station.  They have smoked and grilled food.  They have an amazing assortment of desserts which are sized just right as not to waste.  They have it all.  My daughter who is the worst person to take to any buffet, ate three full plates.  Three!!  I won't say how many plates I ate, but I have no regrets!  A.Y.C.E. is off the strip, but well worth the trip to eat some good food.  I have ate at some of the other popular spots, but this place is my favorite so far.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Line for buffet

2Yl_ugy_dAnvUsp6pmubkg.text: I ate at the Palms Casino buffet today and really enjoyed the food. One of the options was spam fried rice. I asked an attendant behind the counter if there was any fried rice without meat. He told me that there wasn't but offered to make a special individual order of vegetable fried rice for me. He said it should be ready in about 5 mins.  I came back and he had it all ready for me. I ate the vegetable fried rice and it was excellent! I later found out the name of the person who offered to make the special order of fried rice for me was Benny.  After my meal I was so impressed with Benny's excellent service I asked to talk to the Chef to tell him about my experience. Chef Saul came out and was so nice and helpful. I also told him how great tasting the food was in addition to it being nice and fresh.  I am local and because of the great food and excellent service by Benny and Chef Saul I look forward to coming back soon and I highly recommend this buffet to anyone who is considering it.

8vAhvtD_P6k7KqKFKvvP6w.text: I love the new decor and vibe of the restaurant. Some of the tables even have charging stations, which is pretty cool for a buffet. AYCE is definitely worth checking out, but not one of the best buffets in town.  The good: Unique options for buffet food. The cheesy corn on the cob is yum!  Most dishes have pretty good flavor.  The not so good: All of the meats that we tried were pretty bland.

jUU83GMExH56WNHAnHFpMQ.text: For the price, this is a pretty good buffet in Vegas right now. I mean...I like the Wynn, Bellagio, and Cosmo buffets...but they are overpriced for someone who can't really eat large quantities of food. The new Palms buffet on the other hand is both economical and delicious. Maybe because it's still new, they are pumping out high quality, flavorful food. We plan on eating here weekly as long as they keep up the awesome cooking.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum . Just plain yummy.

uKsV-zD3N6tyn7CBQV96DQ.text: As a local, this is my favorite buffet in town. The customer service I receive from the servers and hosts is always outstanding. Even the managers will come by and check on me, if they're passing by. I also love their selection in food, there's always so much to chose from! Whenever my friends and guest from out of town ask me for a buffet recommendation, AYCE is always on the top of my list.

44YkaHBkJro2I031cJ4JGQ.text: So let me start by sayin this establishment has 7 buffet stations...however the only suitable one for VEGANS is the "Revival" station. Everything at this station is VEGAN for the most part so I highly recommend it. So why 3 stars you ask? Well it cost 17.00 bucks for Lunch and 21 bucks for Dinner...even for all the regular food at the other stations that kind of money simply does not justify the means for buying anything here. Eat, Drink, and be Merry, my Friends!!!!

l-eCA_RdNLLlykwEBihWuw.text: Very good atmosphere. ..newly remodeled and food is good...service ok...food is cold some time and not as fresh as it should be...your cinnamon rolls are outstanding ...I like the variety of selection

hwNPrU5USFD4rlyBAZgITg.text: I went for the lunch buffet on a Friday. The total cost per person was $12.  The Palms has a renovated, and beautiful buffet inside. (The Palms has been undergoing a lot of renovation, which in my opinion is a way better look then what the Palms was beginning to look creepy and dark). They have arranged the different serving areas into seven divisions.  The foods presented are in small serving vessels, something like the excellent,and I would.... recommend the Wicked Spoon ,at the Cosmopolitan.       The recipes found at each station are somewhat different then the 'standard' stations casinos buffet foods. The recipes are not bad nor are they excellent.      The saving grace in the whole A.Y.C.E. experience is the area called 'Smoke and Fire ',which serves smoked meats. I had the best smoked turkey wing. The salt and pepper chicken found on the World Pan side of the buffet was very good and tasty. My picture shows the chicken, with the delicious olive salad. The other items you see on the plate, in the photo, not so good.  All of their fish dishes and the calamari were rubbery, dry, and overcooked.    The desserts I think are a failure. In my opinion, the Station Casinos are below standard for what could be provided to the general public. (Eating at stations casinos desserts are often processed sugar put into the shape of something: be it pies, cakes or soft serve ice cream).  I had the pistachio gelato. The gelato  was heavy, lacking flavor, and loaded with sugar. It should not be called gelato in my opinion.      All the other dishes presented that day looked bland and unappetizing with a selection of some odd morsels for a lunch time buffet. There is no Deli area which would have been a great addition to the buffet.- To serve a deli section as part of a buffet experience, for example like a N.Y. style would be great!  Stations have not done that, and in my opinion probably could.      I was there at noon when they should have been on their game at the salad bar which was messy, food around edges, with spoons that had been used for other salads put in with other salads. I chose not to eat any of their salad options except for their olive salad which was pretty good. The staff were friendly and courteous. Their beverages average  Our waitress was good and for $12.... life couldn't be better.      I don't think I would take friends there from out of town , but would go directly to Green Valley Ranch or Red Rock, because they seem to just do it a little better with their tastes and some of their recipes.  I will go back again in the future.  I will come back to this review with an update. Because it's the new kid on the block, for the locals, I would recommend people to go to it and judge themselves because like all food service there are off days.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d2LYHePlIGt8uRy2q0Y7vw.text: The food was ok. Our service from Lakresha was what made three stars. She was sweet, attentive and the best.   Best thing on buffet was veggie egg rolls and Turkey wings  Would i return? No..

YIBCzkaB-JTH8D6IoicX3w.text: Love love this Buffet! There's a great variety and I totally love the barbecue section. We've never had to wait in a line to get in. It's pretty busy but not as busy as other buffets. This is one of the better Station Casino buffets. I recommend you try it.

f53xtPlfiebBsVab7NqZhQ.text: This was a waste of  My husband and I came in for lunch on a Saturday. I'm a pescatarian, very little seafood here. Food looks like it has been sitting. Dessert is frozen, dinner rolls are hard. This was a disappointment  .

sEdcxeB8XDJ-yV7gIsGzZA.text: Decent food & prices, but the service not so much. Apparently the cashier does not like her job. Did not greet or thank us after collecting payment. Note to Najelly: Rudeness will get U nowhere girly

OC7myFH16k9fWGh2pupWwQ.text: I love this buffet.  I went here years ago when it was just the regular buffet.  It is much better now with a great selection.    It's located inside the Palms casino.

nxE2vl91sXTCzb6k4zvtXQ.text: Pretty much everything taste really good and the chicken wings are really good they taste amazing but I just can't wrap my head around this shit while eating the chicken wing

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SrfmtJsWhRwlOxYr1_xrZA.text: After the disappointment that was the Wicked Spoon, we found a hidden gem (thanks Yelp)! The food at this buffet was fresh and delicious! The whole family enjoyed it. Not only that, the service here was absolutely wonderful! Very friendly and accommodating. With pricing that was literally HALF of that of Wicked Spoon, this buffet checked all the right boxes. Definitely coming back!

Evbw1jUEL1MG4kQ9bsx9fg.text: This is my first time at the AYCE buffet. Been in line an hour and only half way through. I hope the food is amazing, because otherwise, we won't be back and i will tell everyone i know to avoid.

RLZNrJdbCQBo7oo7q2IECg.text: Reopened on the 12/22/17,  after months of renovations. Food menus have been revamped, ambiance is good and service is impeccable. Our waiter had worked as food service for decades! Tip: get in early to avoid the crowds and long wait lines. But if you don't it's still worth the wait.kid friendly and good for large family and friend groups. Can't wait until next month's visit.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs with brisket &amp; banana waffle.

5-GMf3utitMVmMnPbQMaNg.text: Simply the very best affordable buffet in Las Vegas. High quality and elegant presentation. Highly recommended.

-q53-RrM3bN9cDooZC6J_g.text: This was a really nice place to eat. Bright and open, clean and friendly!!  Just would suggest hand sanitizer for those that like to clean their hands after using the serving utensils. Also, needs cookies for dessert.

VvdDcWG0RjgM2m4isUB_Vg.text: A remodeled Palm's buffet that everyone has been waiting for has opened.  Not  typical at all. More of a "tapas" buffet. Small servings in small plates.  Concept was  that the food will always remain hot when you eat it. But I also think this will   minimize food wastage. They also have a section called REViVAL that caters to vegetarians.  Salads are delicious! They can make a cookie ice cream to your taste.  I noticed on my second visit that all the servers and hostesses have a modern take on their uniforms. Even their shoes are the same. This place is  real affordable gourmet eat! Make sure you sign up with their card to reflect discount price.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SddBgChJuAoZiIzxX4Kt4w.text: I tried this buffet 3 times (breakfast, lunch and Sunday brunch) because I had some 2 for 1 vouchers.  For the money, I personally don't think it is worth it, especially the Sunday brunch. For $21.00 they have minimal offerings compared to the best buffet in town, The M Buffet/Studio Buffet at the M casino. For a couple dollars more you should go there as the place is huge and has much more to offer.  Tiny desert area with no pie offerings.  Wait and host staff is ok, not that personable.  Another thing to mention is that when I eat at a buffet, I do not eat for the rest of the day. On all 3 occasions at this place, I didn't feel too good afterwards....tummy aches and a bit of nausea. Third times a charm and I won't be returning as I gave enough opportunity.

ZYJMNUZB_R4U3BkClydFtw.text: The breakfast and dinner options were delicious! Went there twice in one day because of a convention and didn't regret it. Their desserts are the best part of dinner!

LuVSptOKnpGxzz5n6YvLPA.text: Pros: cheap, in a clean casino, decent size, good variety. In a clean casino. Cons: there was no dish that was actually very yummy, they were all solidly in "OK" territory.   This place is off the strip, so you either need to take an uber, or you could walk across the street and take the gold coast shuttle to the strip, but it takes about 40 mins because it goes to the new orleans first. Don't forget to tip your driver. (extreme cheapskate hack) haha.

WUXx7lDrvG5-HesCRo1hPA.text: There were enough vegetarian options to make the A.Y.C.E. Buffet interesting. The jackfruit enchiladas were very good. I also enjoyed the hummus, baba ganoush, and eggplant salad.  Skip the dry pita bread. The buffalo mac and cheese was gross, but the traditional version was good. They offer three variations of a few of their dishes, including corn on the cob.  They have a "Raclette" station where cheese is melted on small griddles and then poured on top of dishes of sauteed veggies, potatoes, and pasta. I saw slices of orange cheese and white cheese being used, likely something other than raclette, but I'm not sure what kind. If you like watching cheese melt, check this out.  The cinnamon roll bread pudding was the stand-out dessert item. The assorted macarons including pistachio, coffee, chocolate, lemon, and raspberry, tasted fresh, unlike the dry macarons at other high-end buffets.  For the price, under $20, it's definitely five stars. They don't appear to offer crab legs, which seems to keep the entrance line short, and that's also worth five stars. Parking is still free at the Palms. I don't like any other Stations Casino Feast Buffet, but this one is good because it's brand new.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon roll bread pudding with caramel sauce, Favorite buffet item
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor

PzzcZjaSOuyDuz5dyE-sGA.text: The Palms should rename it the A.Y.C.W. Buffet for "All You Can Wait" because that's what you'll be doing as you stand in line to get in,... waiting. The food may be good, but the wait time to get in is not acceptable. My wife & I got in line on a Wednesday morning at around 10:20am to catch what we thought would be an early lunch. The line was less than half of what it was on the 3 previous times we visited on weekends. We still waited over an hour and there were still about 8 people ahead of us in line, not to mention the people who had paid and were waiting to be seated! WTF! We bailed out of the line and our plans to enjoy a Vegas Buffet were ruined because we had appointments to get to and if we had waited, we would have not been on time for them. We live locally and frequent a number other local buffets. As I posted, the food here isn't bad, but the way management manages the line is awful by only having 1 cashier available during busy times. The food isn't worth the wait. If you are looking for a good Vegas Buffet experience, don't go here because you'll waste half your day, or night just waiting to pay to get in, and more time waiting to be seated after you pay. Don't waste your time waiting in line here.

VNT0V4B7A5KiMyZTrPaU9g.text: A solid 4. The buffet is good, it's not omg amazing, but it's good. Especially for a Vegas buffet and at the price point it is. Breakfast is $8.99 a person plus $2 a person for drinks. Kids are cheaper however I am unsure of the age range on that. I just know my 5 yr old was $6.99; for 4 plus drinks I paid $45.  Their French toast is decent, frittata actually really good; scrambled eggs are good (actually cooked in butter),  pancakes, bacon, sausage all good. Chiliqueles had very good flavor however I wish the tortilla had a bit more crunch to it, it was too mushy.  All in all a good buffet especially for the price. Steer clear of the banana fosters waffle not good.

6nqNgL7C8YRIG41ns7F7iw.text: My husband suggested the AYCE buffet after doing a little research online. We were staying at the Rio hotel and heard the buffet at Palms was more affordable and better. It was a great choice! We arrived around 3:30 pm and were able to take advantage of the brunch items and unlimited mimosas until 4pm. The items were switched out little by little starting around 4pm so we also had a sampling of the dinner selections. The Moroccan lamb was fantastic. The bbq was tasty and sushi and poke were very fresh.   We had 3 plates each and had to roll back to the Rio. It was our favorite meal on our 12 day road trip. I highly recommend it for anyone wanting the buffet experience in Vegas without spending too much. Also, here is a tip: get the players rewards card and you can save a few bucks on the price of the buffet.

Pe1EmsQ0nHqzkRanBUYt1Q.text: Long wait over 1 hour and we paid each $27.05 for Brunch which I thought was a bit much from what I saw on the internet for prices. The food was good (I've had better on the strip). Service was great though our waiter was so nice and attentive.

u9YsNWZKcCVv32Sx0kr6uA.text: The newest casino buffet! I believe it's only about 3 weeks old? My husband and I decided to venture off the strip to check it out. I mean.. $20 pp plus tax and tip for all you can eat just sounded too good to be True!   We arrived at 6 pm and waited about 40 mins to be seated - Enough time for my husband and I to take turn in signing up for palms reward card ($2 off buffet). Once seated, we hurried off to check out their selections.   There were some trendy options - Cheetos cob of corn, Buffalo Mac and cheese, raclette covered veggies, jackfruit enchiladas. They also offer the classics - prime ribs, bbq, stir frys, and pizzas. The trendy options were fun to try but I ate mainly their pork ribs and briskets (have to pick around for the perfect cut). Apparently they smoke their briskets for 10 hours? The fattier, the tastier!   Their variety of desserts didn't compare to wicked spoons of course butttt every item they offered was done well. The staff behind the gelato station was the sweetest. Genuinely eager to assist whoever is eyeing the sweet treats.   Overall - For 1/3 of the strip dinner buffet price - the quality was pretty much the same. The variety might be less (no crab legs, no sushi, no fancy meat cuts) - but $20 pp is a definite steal and well worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2stjcf6Ey21-_G_rNYSn8A.text: A lot of people were telling me to go try this buffet again-- it was really good. So I did and what a mistake. I went for the lunch buffet with 2 other people and we waited over an hour to get to the register.  When we got to the register there was a group of guys next to me that were literally standing so close to me they were touching me and leaning over the counter while I was paying. They were staring at my credit card. The cashier kept looking at them but never said a word. When I was almost done paying the guy totally smashes into me. Him and his group decided it would be a good idea to exchange some words with me. The cashier still never said a word. I found this totally inappropriate and would never return just for this reason.  But we went inside and were extremely disappointed. The buffet is very small, they only have a few stations. The salad bar might as well not even exist. What a joke! They had a "vegan" section that looked like it had not been refreshed in days. Every person that walked up to it, just turned and walked away.   The were not a lot of choices unless you like Asian food. That was the only station they were paying any attention too. Everything else looked old and was just not worth eating.   The dessert station also a total let down. They had 2 vegan choices (choc. pudding and a brownie) both disgusting. Very few choices for other items. There main focus on dessert is the gelato case and it wasn't that good.   I felt this entire experience was a complete waste of my money and time and I will never go back to the Palms. This was my first time back since they re did the place and it is worse now than before.

D2quILD8c175YGdWrDlLKw.text: Hard to believe a buffet could be 5 star but it was. We really enjoyed ourselves.  We ate at the newly redone A.Y.C.E. Buffet inside the Palms Casino and what a treat. Starting with our hostess Edwina she explained the changes and she seemed excited just to be telling us. She told us how much she loved her job! We then met Mary Giraud to pass our pleasant experience with Edwina. Mary was great also. The restaurant looked great. The food quality and presentation was excellent! You guys got it right!

nuqJWqYIcSCmIAZxSRNA-Q.text: We went here on a week night for dinner. There was no line & not crowded at all but it did take them a good 10-15 min to set up our table (4 adults & 2 highchairs). We had our players cards so dinner was $2 off normal price. At first glance the place looks amazing. Definitely a huge upgrade from the previous buffet. The hotel is really closed off because of the remodel but the cafe & buffet are completely redone. They did have the new smaller high chairs and everything was very clean.   When we were seated our server immediately greeted us, took our drink orders and gave us a run down of the food stations. The concept is great but I felt like they were trying to make the buffet more tapas style but the quality of the food was not that great. The food was sitting out too long under the heaters bc most of the food was dry and the meats were over cooked and tough.   The foods that were delicious and being eaten and replenished often were great (walnut shrimp, carved turkey, fresh fruit, and Mac and cheese) But everything just sat there.   This would be last choice for a station casino buffet. Maybe if they fine tune their menu and have fresher prepared food it could be a great buffet.   The staff was super friendly and very attentive. And they have "cleaners" coming around sweeping up the floors.

7jMMIfL6AxXVrM0ctpVLEA.text: Amazing buffet! Located in the Palms Casino, right off of the strip. They have free self-parking.  Tip=park on the top floor of the self-parking structure, and get some awesome views of Las Vegas at night!   As for the buffet, there is a variety of foods.  The good thing about here is that you recognize the foods, it's not so fancy or so unique that you'll be standing at the buffet line wondering what it is and if you should take it.  Although I got pretty full on eating the beef (with au jus),custom-created pasta, and shrimp, my stomach did what she does and acted empty so that I could overstuff myself without guilt on dessert.  GELATO!  There was even an option for Gelato stuffed cookie sandwiches! There were other desserts, of course, such as cheesecake and flan, and even sugar free type desserts (for those that need that option).   Planning on coming here every time we come to Las Vegas.  Thank you to my aunty (a Las vegas local) for bringing us here to eat :)

0zYSFD4w6w3NsauT8zXk6w.text: Wow! That was such a lovely experience. One of those moments that make you think of the difference between good and great service. My sister and I went to the buffet and were excited to get an omelette as some good ol' recovery food. Unfortunately when we got there we had barely missed the closing time of the omelette station. We were just chatting amongst ourselves about the bad luck. Adrian, a chef there, over heard us and went out of his way and started re-opening up the station for us. We didnt even know anyone could hear us! Anyway, he happily cooked for us and we got our muuuuch wanted eggs and not only was it extremely thoughtful but super delicious as well!! Will 100% be back. You do not find kind people like that everywhere. Thank you Adrian! You were GREAT

Qej_RjcN8qeI9-q6hi4cvw.text: We had dinner here on our little getaway and the food was great and the variety was excellent. Even indulged with some Spomoni. The server we had (Embet) was even better. Came by to make sure we didn't need anything several times and was wonderful having someone so attentive in a buffet environment. Looking forward to coming back again!

aPTca7KuEP3lKerx5PEw8g.text: Man oh man, for $20 this is so worth the price shrimp , steak , prime rib. Amazing desserts.  I can't wait to have family visiting to take them to this buffet.  I'm so happy station casinos took ownership, they're doing amazing things if this is the start.  If you ever been to wicked spoon this is just like it with the price not being $60 dollars. I should've taken pictures. But I was so hungry I just stuffed my face.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New stations

KLP0J5-QTYygy1xwjI2Psw.text: The AYCE Buffet is located at the Palms Casino which is just off the Strip.  Accordingly, it seems to be priced a bit less than buffets that are on the Strip.  Certainly, the casino and the buffet itself are beautiful and right up there with buffets on the Strip.  The food was decent, but there wasn't much in the way of boiled shrimp or crab legs.  The fried chicken was covered in salt.  I'd say the buffet here was as good as others I've been to in Vegas.    Service by our waitress was super.  The front desk told us to get casino member cards to get a small discount on the buffet.

GBWJpJ87ZHBs05t8ebd4bQ.text: I just came here to say elotes need to be on brunch!!   Please replace that gross macaroni and cheese (do not ever make Mac n cheese with the green enchilada sauce gross gross)!!  Otherwise I love this brunch, it's better than the Wynn's and I'm not so eloquent this review because my mom is threatening to leave me and I have two mimosas  Edit: They replaced the gross chili verde Mac N Cheese with a much better cheese option!   Elotes still aren't on brunch but they should be. Also, the elotes should be warmed up like they were when the buffet first opened.  The Korean short ribs are my favorite for dinner. I also dig the sausage and hush puppies.  I have yet to try the cold ramen but maybe I will try that next week.

JGmiAz_y97ptU2P4ak5q7g.text: I love the new renovation and style that they added not only to the palms and buffet that was great. I went to eat here for lunch on a Wednesday i paid 3 adults and it was only 2 adults 1 child and one under 2 and they didn't even set the table up for us our waiter took forever to come to our table i asked the manager why she didn't set up a table for four and they said because they thought I have not paid for one child so I was upset then our waiter taking too long I later found out they have no bussers to pick up their tables that's why he was taking so long so the whole time I was there the waiters were standing around chatting with other people they didn't even come pick up my plates I had a messed up plates on the table but I never got no good service I went to the line to look at the food and it was a limited amount so that was kind of upsetting also I would imagine it would be bigger than last time but the chef did a very good job on the flavor other than that this place is OK except for the customer service.

Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food flavor was good

ulvOthsBFRARZau_Chbcvg.text: For $20 bucks, I really can't ask for anything more. Came for dinner, it's $21 per person but with the basic players card you get a dollar off. You can sign up for one for free if you don't have one. If you have one, you can get discount for you and someone else with just one card. Higher levels get a better deal, as cheap as $18 for dinner. Basic soda and iced tea included. Alcohol available for purchase. See menu photo I posted.  We came close to 8pm and waited in line for about an hour. They close at 9pm but serves food until 9:30p.  Variety is a bit limited but the quality of the food is better than a lot of buffets I've been to. What I especially liked was the asian food. They had a curry, Mongolian beef and walnut shrimp that were all good. Prime rib was good too. The soft serve was not watery as I expected and was actually really creamy and good.  They also had a bbq station with chicken, ribs and brisket. The smoke on the meat was good but all lacked seasoning.   Overall it was a pretty good buffet especially for the price.

IM9aPrtL2mbSQS_9DxL68w.text: Completely disappointed... from the start this was a horrible experience. The line be took more than 45 minutes and we were only five groups back . The Hostess was rude and seemed to be more annoyed than helpful .   The tables were a mess and yes it's a Buffet but there were many that were covered in dishes and set empty. Our waiter was sweaty and hands had food on them . He took our drink order and after returning to our table with our food asked for our drink order again .   The food was less than average with no taste , seasoning and dry or soggy .   I try not set my expectations to high for any buffet but this was one of the Worst! We did not even eat a qtr of one plate and asked for a refund and were told it was like that all day !!   Sorry to say that we will not be back !

1T_eu1HVNbECOSy9AxyWzA.text: Not the greatest, but not the worst.   Pro: salt and pepper chicken wings, gelato, brisket, garlic sticks, roasted vegetables   Cons: salad selections, barely any fruit, needs fresher/ better selections of seafood and sushi, the potatoes were liquid

pj5NJiy7pdfSCk5GX0Qq7g.text: Overall good food quality. The choices are hit or miss, usually more hits. Perhaps  One super highlight was server Josefina. Cheerful, on the ball, knowledgeable. She stood out so much that I decided to write a review.

W8C3EBDJav7JwNPdb8gJtg.text: there is a wait during the week! the marketing promotions are in effect! I like that they do not close between sessions, too often the inconvenience of the hour closing between breakfast lunch dinners etc! they stay open! if your like me and like mixing and variety without having too wait for their foods staging, this is great!  speaking of variety the live stations are a nice way to get custom made to order requests! the carving station, and the alcohol stations! bottomless mimosas for two hours, for an additional cost with your entry fee! yes booze!  I like it! I like it alot!

R6_CoLLnkREywlOQgvd8Ig.text: A.Y.C.E.= All You Can't Eat  Well that was the first and last for me. I was really expecting something much better from this casino. I love taking my family to buffets because there are plenty of options out there even for the pickiest eaters. But that wasn't the case here. For a buffet that showcased several different ethnic stations they only had very few selections available. The shortribs at one station looked really juicy but I found them to be quite the opposite and felt like I was chewing part of a rubber boot. I'm not exaggerating when I say that. The meat was really tough. I ended up spitting it out in my napkin. Moving onto the sushi..They had a few different types of cut rolls available but no nigiri. They all tasted very dry and flavorless. I couldn't help but assume that they were left out uncovered overnight. In that case, maybe its a good thing they didn't have any nigiri. They also had these little individual bucket looking thingies with some kind of seafood boil available and that little dish tasted like bland water with a hint of sea salt and a chewy mussel in it.. Not good. Wish the broth had more flavor. Another soup I saw that looked interesting had some apple in it. I can't remember what it was called. Apple something soup. Anyway, skip this. Gerber apple baby food in the jar tastes waaayy better. Like any other casino buffet they have a salad bar and a meat carving station. As for their desserts they had different ice creams and cupcakes that looked sooo good.. But that was just it. They only looked good. The only thing possibly saving this place are the BOGO deals that they mail out to locals. I left here disappointed and  hungry. I wouldn't even eat here for free even if I was comped. If I had to eat at another station casino buffet I'd probably just go to Red Rock, Green Valley, or Sunset buffet where the foods actually have some type of flavor in them. Plus they serve crab legs on fridays at the GVR location.

Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8Lrl_RjCX4oph_rlyyIqEQ.text: Did you hear that the Palm's just spent $690 million for renovations on the entire hotel this year?  When I got wind of this, I just couldn't resist but to check out their new buffet.  If you've been inside the Palms prior to their complete makeover, you'll no doubt notice the night and day change for the better.  It's modern, it's hip, it's fun.  We even made a few bucks in the casino.  I just wish the food inside the buffet was as good as everything else.   The interior of this restaurant is definitely 5-stars.  It's nicely updated, modern and spacious.  It's a nice place to linger over a lengthy buffet meal.  The millions spent on renovating the entire hotel clearly shows, and the buffet is just one of the areas that reflect its tasteful design.  Unfortunately, that's where things peaked.  Normally at buffets, my eyes are bigger than my tummy, but not here.  Overall, most of the 3-star quality food was just mediocre.  I certainly didn't leave hungry, but I actually left feeling like I "needed" to eat more than I actually did.  Now, that's unheard of for me at a buffet!   Much of the food is extremely salty!  I think they must've accidentally dropped an entire box of salt into the sausage mixture by accident and proceeded anyway.  Not kidding.  I realize sausages are typically salty, but I'm not exaggerating about the box of salt.    The highlight was the salt and pepper fried chicken wings which were fresh and just like the ones served at one of my favorite places in San Francisco's Chinatown.  The fried shrimp and walnuts were a close second.  Coming in third for me were the crawdads in curry sauce.  The curry sauce would've definitely benefitted from being much thicker, as opposed to being watery thin, but it had a nice spicy kick, and nicely complemented the crawdads.  Other than these items, nothing else stood out, except the uber-fresh sugar cones used at the soft-serve ice cream station.    Desserts were nicely presented and looked very appealing, but like the food, they were overall of 2-3 star quality.  Lots of small bites, but completely absent were any slices of cakes and fruit pies that you'd normally see at buffets.    Service was mixed.  Our server was pleasant, though not necessarily attentive.  However, I observed a customer asking for a made-to-order omelet towards the end of the brunch.  He was told, somewhat flippantly, that there was absolutely no way they could accommodate him because it was towards the end of the Sunday brunch.  The customer accurately pointed out that there were 15 minutes left until the end of the Brunch, but the employee was not budging and insisted that they needed the extra time to start to bring out the dinner food.  What? Why?  The Sunday Brunch actually cost more than dinner, and there was still 15 minutes left of Brunch time.  Not cool.  Not right.    Note that there's a 2-hour table time limit.   Oddly, there was also heavy-metal music playing in the background at an annoying decibel.  I realize the Palm's is demographically targeting a younger clientele, but heavy metal over brunch/dinner?!?  I was really excited about trying this buffet.  However, based on my first visit, unless I happen to find myself at the Palm's again and super hungry, my dining here was probably a one and done for me.

BivtPagLBy8TIiYwHHaE5Q.text: Went here for dinner with my coworker and boss. The place seemed nice. There was bit of a wait to get seated. The food was overall pretty good, there was some items that were over cooked (chicken teriyaki and shrimp boil), but most of the food was good. The variety was decent. It seemed a little on the pricey side at $25, but I hear that is normal for the VEGAS Strip. I did enjoy the variety of food options and especially the dessert. My favorite entree was the sushi and the smoked sausage, favorite dessert was the cappuccino ice cream and the coffee custard. If I am back in Vegas I may come back. It was decent for a buffet. I would have liked to have more signage for the items (a lot were missing) and the dirty plates piled up pretty high at our table.

ZhQdE_SIXAGCFO3DKRjaLQ.text: I remember back when the Palms buffet used to be terrible. But ever since the casino was bought out by Station Casinos, everything has been way better including the buffet. We first tried it out soon after the remodel about a year and half ago, and have been coming about once every couple months since then!  Not only are their food stations good, but the quality of the food overall is superior to any other Station Casino or off-strip casino for that matter. My favorites are the BBQ station, and the Asian station. Their salt and pepper chicken wings are just the best! They also often have really good pork adobo and kalbi short ribs, although it's not always on the buffet! We've been for lunch and dinner, and although lunch is cheaper, the food is much better during dinnertime!   My only complaint is that the line is often long, and not because there is not enough seating. It's always because there are only 2 cashiers available... It's kind of stupid to have 2 cashiers when the line is over an hour long. Only reason why I can't give them 5 stars! It never seems like the staff is in a hurry either!

SxdTUpvtXCHrad3fI-F2Kg.text: This place is phenomenal I'm not one for buffets but the food was amazing, they have a great selection and the foods always coming fresh! The smoke and fire has amazing choices, and the meat is smoked to perfection and has amazing flavor! the pasta station is my favorite you choose your toppings and they cook it right there for you! They have a Mongolian grill as well! The dessert bar has amazing selections, not to mention the service! The Waitress as well as the cooks were amazing! Always checking up on us, our glasses were NEVER empty, and they wanted to make sure we had the best experience possible! I will definitely be coming back here!!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stations of food

xTWJt6FwqZOjiMi1ZjSAqg.text: My son eats a lot of protein, so this was the best Dinner buffet for him. It was voted the best off strip buffet. Great select of protein, food is served tapas style and is very good.   Hand made and served Birthday treat tray for my don's 17th birthday! Our waitress was the best, she made this  special, just for him!   We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hand made and served Birthday treat tray for my don&#39;s 17th birthday! Our waitress was the best, she made this  special, just for him!
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food was excellent!

8wYtyvPfu8jLHmVekYoQhw.text: Although it's not centrally located on the Strip, the AYCE buffet at Palms is worth it at its price point, especially since it's ~$16/person for lunch. The wait wasn't too bad for Saturday lunch, about 15 minutes. They have different stations to specify the type of prep/cooking like the Greenery, Revival, World Pan, the Roastery, the Hearth, Smoke & Fire, and Sweet & Light.  The Greenery is more than the basic salad bar. It has a variety of vegetables and greens but also fresh pre-made salads and elegant, gourmet options like an arugula fig salad or pesto mozzarella, one of my favorites. There's assorted breads, fruits, salad dressings & toppings, and cold pastas.  Revival is a vegan/vegetarian station that revamps the traditional vegetarian dishes and included mushroom quesadillas, pita bread and hummus, rainbow chard hash, and zucchini noodles in marinara. Nothing is really special and most of the stuff is pretty bland. At least there's healthy, light options. But let's be real, you're not going to an all-you-can-eat buffet looking for healthy stuff, you're here to indulge.  World Pan is pretty extensive and contains mostly Asian cuisine because it doesn't really fit anywhere else and includes beef & broccoli, dumplings, gyoza, pork buns, fried rice, adobo, poke bowls, and honey walnut shrimp. There's also elotes, paella, and a DIY taco section (al pastor, fajitas, pico de gallo, guacamole, sour cream etc).    There's also the Hearth which is focused on oven baked and/or Italian items like assorted pizza, strombolis, and pasta dishes (penne, mac and cheese). They had a variety of baked macaroni dishes like the traditional one topped with breadcrumbs but also one with Flamin' Hot Cheetos garnished on top. Most of these options are skippable in my opinion. You can definitely get better pizza and strombolis (so flavorless) elsewhere. There's chicken pot pie in individual ramekins (amazing), Thai Red Curry Mussels (not great), and a DIY pasta bar.  The Roastery is more meat-based items like roast beef and fried pollock, calamari steaks, but also sliders, mashed potatoes and many different gravies and sauces.  Smoke & Fire has savory comfort food like BBQ ribs, BBQ pulled pork, borracho beans, collard greens, fried chicken, hush puppies, and biscuits. Just the essential BBQ eats.  Sweet & Light is the dessert station. But like the name suggests, the desserts (cookies, cakes, ice cream, bread putting) aren't too rich and indulgent. They have special desserts like eclairs, cream puffs, cobblers and fruit tarts too. Ice cream was okay and the flavors weren't super extraordinary. Just basic flavors like vanilla, chocolate, coffee, pistachio, caramel, but also spumoni and stracciatella. They offer sugar-free flavors too and you can make an ice cream sandwich. I got a cup of the pistachio and the flavor tasted so artificial and sugary.  There was a variety of sushi (the basic California rolls, etc.) at Revival (vegetarian) and also at World Pan but they were terrible. The rice was not soft enough, like it was either not fresh or just cooked wrong. And so it doesn't possess that melt-in-your-mouth quality. I would skip it. Most of the stuff from Smoke & Fire are pretty good, especially the pulled pork. Hands down, the best dish they have is the Chicken Pot Pie. The pie crust is perfect -- the right balance between flaky and buttery. And the filling was deliciously creamy and flavorful.   TL;DR: newly revamped and renovated space, diverse food selection with some standouts (Chicken Pot Pie), lower than average Vegas prices with minimal wait.
