QIHc-NcPAdJUZsK3QWBsew.text: I'm a huge fan of buffets in Vegas. I mean, isn't that why people come to Vegas?! Normally when we come, we have our select 2 buffets we always go to. This time, I decided to venture out of my bubble and try a new spot. I came across AYCE on yelp, and we just had to see what everyone was talking about. With it off the strip, you're going to need to take a cab, Lyft, or drive out there.   When you get to the Palms, don't go straight to the buffet! Instead, pop over to their players card desk to sign up. You'll get $5 off your buffet! Not everyone needs to sign up in your party. The card works for 2 discounted buffets. The wait for the buffet was not long at all. We waited about 15 minutes on a Sunday afternoon. For $24, the quality was great! The selection was plentiful and there was even a vegetarian section. My favorite was the honey walnut shrimp. I probably had 2 full plates just of it!   I'd highly recommend AYCE not just for the price, but for the quality as well!

LAO7GSPyU_yD-_acLD3w8A.text: The A.Y.C.E buffet at the palms is such a fun experience! Our group went to Saturday brunch and we paid 19.99 for brunch on top of bottomless mimosas (with having a preferred stations card) and with our large party, were able to be seated as soon as we paid.   The options of food are plentiful! There were breakfast options as well as brunch and lunch, the brunch options were delicious! There were different hashes, Benedicts and all were extremely tasty, and not old tasting like some buffets often do.   Only thing that I wasn't too fond of was that the server who would fill our mimosas disappeared towards the end of our meal and we weren't able to get the last few mimosas we wanted out of the meal.   This place gave the best bang for your buck when f comes to brunch buffets. Great food, bottomless mimosas and because it's at the palms it gives you a fancy feel. Loved ending it with the vanilla bean ice cream!

r5MuODszpoVNIzI-ZwhiNw.text: Excellent value for the money.  Good food with a wide variety of options to choose from. I Have been here four times now and I am always very pleased with the food, service, and ambience.

4YnQeS3FKVFmv87SB-5J8w.text: We were debating between going to the Wicked Spoon or China Town. We saw this buffet on Yelp. We were intrigued.  Pros: -cheaper than the famous buffet on strips -very tasty -apply for the player's club and get some $ off  Cons: -small place -less selections -line was super long -3special member parties seated then 1 regular pay customer (go figure the wait time)  The manager, assistant manager were very helpful. They must have been understaffed or something, those higher level helped to bus and set the tables up. Got drinks ready, picked up dirty places. Kuddos Maybe they should consider hiring busser instead of having the server to bus their own tables(taking up too much time/less time serving)  The potpies are just yummy!!! I came back and forth so many times for this. Desserts were good too. Will definitely come back next time we are in Vegas.

eem055yAfWyesu6uWxf-eA.text: The Palms (AYCE) was my first buffet in Vegas. For $19 (dinner) with the player's card, I can say you get your money's worth. I had three plates which I finished along with some damn good bread pudding. I enjoyed everything accept the one rib I got. For $19 buck I can certainly recommend this buffet.

This was perhaps one of the better ones for the price. Nice variety of tasty food. Items include: breakfast, sushi, meats, deserts, salads and much more. For the price it's hard to beat.

vqudmjobjKhemzAKC1CPnQ.text: Best off the strip buffet hands down. And I love the M buffet but this tops it. Went on a Sunday and with the players card it's $19 pp. Great spread and everything was amazingly flavorful. The French onion soup for example tasted like something I'd get at a 4 or 5 star French restaurant. And the Lamb Stew was exceptionally amazing and my favorite thing I ate. Definitely worth a try.

ZWnBGAUPzvyBupcWUMJDBw.text: By far, one of the best Vegas buffets we went to. Came towards the end of breakfast, so we were able to try of the lunch items that rolled out too.   I cannot complain about the price, I cannot complain about the endless variety of foods. Breakfast foods are super delish!   I fell in love with the mushroom breakfast quiche. The crust was flaky and buttery with amazing slices of mushroom and cheese.   Also, the lemon raspberry parfait thing was so good it broke me. So tart, creamy and a lovely way to end (or start) a meal!   Great options for vegetarians. Great options for anyone, really! Definitely would come back again!

VJhiRgTzEATSd-FXpLpCZA.text: I had breakfast here.. it's was less that 10 bucks.  Was underwhelming.  Good service though.   Guess you get what you pay for.  Does have a soft serve ice cream terminal though, so that's the plus point.

G7VGUyrXTIWPrcBJlGcXIg.text: Standard buffet in Las Vegas. Definitely for the price, I'd say it's good. I went with my friend on a Sunday morning so around $17.99 / person plus all you can drink orange champagne (mimosa?).  We originally went because we thought they had ayce macaroons (from what we saw in previous pictures), but they must change out their desserts from time to time. They had ayce cupcakes this time around.  Their carving station with turkey, ham, and beef was great, and they had a good variety of Chinese, Mexican, breakfast, salad, and dessert. I loved the beef brisket, fried chicken, egg roll, cinnamon bread pudding, and fudge brownie.  Service was great! Very kind waiters and kitchen staff. Shout out to the ice cream girl who was patient when teaching me how to say Stratacelli!

IgCxPR9sDpoNq612ZynTkA.text: Service greaaaat food nasty idk if it's a Midwest thing but I let the manager know and she gave me free breakfast haven't went yet! If you like bland things this is for you cornbread is AWESOME tho

MJ6tXQwR-T3uNK6M9LkCCQ.text: ***DO NOT COME HERE.*** their customer service is absolutely terrible. We waited in line for over an hour and they keep you waiting to charge you dinner prices. It was exactly 4 after waiting for over an hour and they refused to honor the lunch price. The manager was a complete jerk  and she LAUGHED at us and accused us of lying about how long we waited after that we got a SO ARE YOU GOING TO PAY OR NOT YOU ARE HOLDING UP THE LINE. Do not let the price fool you. The staff is absolutely terrible and need to learn some customer service skills. There are PLENTY of other places you can eat at on the strip, DO NOT WAIST YOUR MONEY HERE.

xYHLp1P2e_HmcoSEdnt0yQ.text: The lunch menu was only marginally better and the dinner selection was considerably better than the Red Rock Casino buffet.  The Chicken Panang and lemon meringue dishes were outstanding.  We arrived at 2.07pm on a Tuesday and the wait time was 30 long minutes.  The ambiance and decor was inviting but we were not a fan of the Servers wearing jeans.  Given the wait time and overall dining experience we probably won't be returning anytime soon.

sHwinNpRSO425LRg349xKA.text: This buffet has taken the buffet standard to a new underwhelming low. The selections are uber confusing to the point where you're lost in food translation. Their stations don't go by the typical buffet naming scheme, like Asian, American and International Flavors, their naming scheme goes like  "The Revival" and "Hearth". The only saving grace for their buffet is the carving stations and pizza. I personally prefer Bristo Buffet over this underwhelming reimagining.   Their food selections aren't really great, to begin with, it's very limited and subpar, compared to other cheap buffets that I've eaten at. I expected that the food quality would be better, as I was told by a customer service telephone operator a couple of days prior to going to A.Y.C.E. Buffet, however, I've expected wrong. Bistro Buffet had the essential buffet favorites that it needed, such as typical Asian cuisine dishes, Fried Rice and Chow Mein, which is a staple for all casino buffets. I found myself a couple of times, moving back and forth by the buffet line, wondering what am I going to plate and bring to my table to eat. Yes, you can call me a slight picky eater, but looking at the selection presented to me, can you blame me?  My other issue is the Cashiers and Ushers, my mom and I stood in line on our first day there, along with other patrons for almost an hour, before we got to the cashiers. What I'm trying to allude to is that the Cashiers and Ushers are slow to allow the line to progress forward. I saw cashiers, just stand around and/ or count their day's take in the register drawer, when they should focus on getting patrons through the line and seated. I've seen many people who were a few minutes before my us, not stay to eat, they've left and requested their refunds. It's not worth $12.00 plus taxes to eat at a place that doesn't provide a variety of food selections, especially when the selections are confusing or unlabeled.  Palms Resort and Casino is a member of the Station Casino family, they should have built a buffet that matches the successful buffets of such hotels like Green Valley and Red Rock Resorts. Management of the Palms should have studied what makes Feast Buffets so successful and they should have emulated it with their buffet. I understand that Palms wants to set themselves apart from their sister hotels, by providing an alternative, but let's be real here for a second, has their previous buffet proven itself to be a success?..... Maybe, when they were an independently owned entity, however, today they aren't. Bistro Buffet wasn't a huge success, but it was the Palms buffet for many years, despite the ever-changing times and trends.   The reason that Bistro Buffet stayed as the Palms chosen buffet is that it provided its hungry patrons the familiar buffet favorites and it didn't confuse them with eclectic station names. It was easy to understand where to go if you wanted a certain dish or cuisine, if you wanted Asian dishes, you go to the Asian station, if you wanted American, you go to American and so forth. I have a feeling that A.Y.C.E. Buffet won't be a successful hit with its current confusing and limited food selection. The Palms should rethink how they do buffets and change how A.Y.C.E. Buffet works. If they're going with the theme of "All You Can Eat", the food should reflect that, with their limited and portioned out selections, it defeats the purpose of the theme of "All You Can Eat".  As the buffet was transitioning from lunch to dinner, there wasn't anybody standing in line to wait for dinner at A.Y.C.E. Buffet, it was their second day since they opened. I understand that the line will slowly form, but normally at a buffet like Feast or MGM Buffets, as they transition inside, there is already a line forming outside. The line should have started to form a half an hour to 45 minutes prior to opening for the next meal time. A.Y.C.E. Buffet is going to see empty lines happen, if they continue to operate like this. If they don't want to see empty lines outside their buffet and survive, they should change how they do buffets.  I personally don't and won't recommend any of my family and friends to eat here. Like how I said earlier, it's not worth $12.00 per person (if you have a station casino players card) $14.00 per person (without the station players card). It's better to go to the Red Rock and eat there, because it's a "Feast" style of buffet, a True "All You Can Eat" buffet. Yes, it's a bit of a drive if you don't live near the Red Rock and it's a bit pricey, however, it's all worth it in the end, you'll end up leaving with a highly filled and satisfied stomach. Knowing that you've truly had a True All-You-Can-Eat experience at the Feast Buffet.  I know that the Palms is trying to cater to a certain demographic, but that's not what they should do, they should cater to every demographic. Which A.Y.C.E. Buffet doesn't do, unfortunately, with their eclectic and limited food selections.

aKojG3WtnFnZYBDUAq5ErQ.text: Hands down best buffet I've ever gone to. Super high quality food for a low price. The soda is included in the price. Many many food choices.

gGNHw1eclwoni-i_6hwTIw.text: It was cheap and no line, that is a good thing... but with an all day buffet is there any reason to have day old cakes, or cakes that tasted/had the texture of it, pork bar buns with a gram of pork and all dough and chewy, dry roast beef and turkey.  Seriously... even at 23.99,because I forgot my players card, it's not worth it.  And the cafe next door has freshly made food... so that's where I will be next time,

uPxL3Ga8sVK-980HktL_nw.text: We loved our food here everything was awesome!! Ele our server was the vest server we have had for out whole weeks stay in vegas he was so attentive and nice to us anything we needed he got for us!!!

09JUXDXnvBhiU8jh4N6Qcg.text: Great salt and pepper wings, pot pie, ribs, sliders, and gelato.  I'd like a little more variety since I eat her quite often.

aLxi22uRX2X769m1l6llBQ.text: Great food selection all around. Healthy, fried, meaty, vegan, any option you want is here. We came for the great price after feeling ripped off by every place on the strip. VERY glad we came here!

CKZ6wsxE4vGxaSNFBOxYyQ.text: In a word.... AWFUL. First we arrived at about 2pm it was not busy yet we waited to be seated nearly 15 minutes. Now I could understand the wait of they were not fully staffed or if they were busy but neither was the case.  So now lest talk about the food, or should I say the lack of food. First the food had ZERO flavor, the mac and cheese was like eating pasta in cheese water, the pot pie was loose cream with a mushy crust, and when you describe an item as being pepperd you should put pepper on it. Over all food was just bland and bad. Also It seemed that every station had the same items. There was pork, turkey and sushi on every station. A buffet should have a variety and preparing the same item in slightly different ways is not variation. And all the food they picture or show in their commercials is not there. No ribs, no smoke sauage, nothing.  Another big issue was the lack of cooks at any of the stations. We stood at the carving window waiting, and waiting for someone to assist us and nothing. We had to send a busser in back to get a cook to come out. Also when there were empty items I had asked a cook for more tortillas and he said "yeah ok" and NEVER brought them back. I must also mention the dessert station that was again unmanned. We waited along with other guests for over 10 minutes, we asked numerous times if there was someone working here and was told "I will go get someone" and that never happened.  I finally complained to the manager and the chef and was actually told I was the third complainant of the day about the exact same issues.  So they are aware of the problems and yet they continue.  So overall dont waste your time or your money.

wD-a40Fv4dRo4K94kP7RKQ.text: We visited this buffet because we were mailed two free in a promotion. The regular price is something like $11.99 for lunch.  The food selection was fairly extensive and we enjoyed it.  The set up is one with multiple stations featuring various styles of cooking.  Many of them feature small plates instead of bins filled with food.  That is a nice feature compared to other buffets.  It was worth a trip for the freebie, not sure we would choose it for the price.

fxs99oU61dL12_D275W2nw.text: Nice variety of fresh food. Most quality food unlike other places. Service was excellent and price for lunch was reasonable.

q4AZCYsXXfSikuAUotxqzA.text: You would probably have better quality food in the dumpster out back. I found a hair in my sweet potatoes and the salad was all wilted. I really didn't enjoy much of Vegas today because I have been sick from the meat. How do I know it's the meat? Because I have been belching it up all day. If you really dig hanging near a bathroom all day I highly suggest eating this awful food.

DY1RPi5ZbXKdBleCLPtagw.text: Have my first experience at this buffet last night and it was a great start to finish.   Staff were welcoming and on the ball with drinks and clearing our plates.  Great price.   Food was excellent! Hot and fresh.   Definitely will be back.

yjnxin6mCoayoDy-6_RkLg.text: This is the best buffet in Vegas.  The server paid our party a lot of attention and kept coming back to refill our drinks and make sure we were satisfied.  The food was delicious!  My favorite was the pizza and the pork ribs.  The Gelato reminded me of the Gelato I ate in Europe.  I had a wonderful dining experience with my family, and we would all gladly come again.

IzSNAhD0vfjiAQKZ9UvJDw.text: This is such an awesome place to eat. They cater to every taste and will make your food the way you want it. Mary is awesome! She visited our table and made sure she put a smile on our face. Melissa our waitress made sure that we had everything thing we needed while eating. Best birthday experience ever. Thanks to the food, service, and the employees.

YjF_o4cDLHj3tTv-zl8_CA.text: Went here to try because we recieved a BOGO free mailer. Started off great with small but good selections of apps. My wife and I enjoyed the ceviche and NE crab boil. Sushi can be skipped, nothing great. Cod was okay too. When I had meat, that where my disappontment started. Brisket, Ribs and the beef on the carving station (not prime rib) were all dry. Walnut shrimp is great though. Wait staff is friendly. Lastly, the dessert station has good number of selection. May come back, but not too soon.

pA__hvHu4i-Mpg0gZd6oYQ.text: The broccoli soup is the best , also great customer service , if you like thanksgiving dinner you'll love it here fresh turkey and mashed potatoes and gravy !! First time here and I'll be back for sure ! Must try buffet and great price !

7VRnOKwh-wiy4pI5Pc-mEw.text: We tried this buffet for the 1st time. The price is super affordable and the food was good. The highlight for me was the gelato bar.

_HvQFwRMLc3KrM08p-uESQ.text: Ate here and really enjoyed it. Servings are limited to small plates in a lot of cases, which seems to be the new trend lately. Almost everything we ate tasted fresh and was hot, and you don't get to say that very often about a casino buffet. Good middle ground between your regular station casino, and one of the 60 dollar ones on the strip. I think we were in for right around 25 a person for dinner, which is about right for what you get. Not the largest place, but the freshness makes up for a smaller range of choices. Would definitely eat here again.

d1Ltu0gmH7n0u00ltECiew.text: Absolutely amazing place so many options and everything tastes so fresh, staff was very nice and the place was very clean. It's been awhile since I've been to the Palms but this place gives me a reason to go back. New hot buffet in town!!!

PV7wvmRY34iK5edwny-4XQ.text: I came here last week for one people,but they charge me two people fee.What happened? Just because I didn't write down the total,and charge me whatever you want? I won't come here anymore!!

0DfDFrAUNOR5lZ-Lv9IBmA.text: I have eaten at the Golden Corral of Las Vegas. It is known as A.Y.C.E.   Prime rib was medium well. Brisket was dry and lean. Ugh.

fqXHIXAKLrBAg1shUQ3xfQ.text: Wow! I was very impressed with this buffet way better than the Boyd or Station casinos' buffet.  Quality of food isn't dry or taste like it's been sitting out. Their brunch on Sunday was delicious and service was really good. I would definitely come back.

aiasz0xIoLt1zX1YIRWYLA.text: The food was delicious.  Rolled out of the buffet. For affordable prices go during the week at lunch time.

ZYb1z1f0Ss0xaU-ovwiENQ.text: I saw the ads on TV Palms new buffet was open. I decided to try it on Christmas Day. The price was only like $22.00 with the players card. The wait wasn't bad but I'm sure it got longer later in the day. The quality of the food items was on par with Aria and Cosmopolitan but at half the price. The only draw back was the number of selections.  I felt there could have been more Mexican and Italian dishes. The walnut shrimp was to die for. The prime rib also very tender and not as fatty as most in town. The deserts were delicious including  the large selection of ice cream. For lunch this buffet would be ideal where quality and price is more important than an endless supply of tasteless dishes. It's not quantity it's quality! And you can't beat the price with your players club card.

Pom7D4kF5IeCrgCIUBB9qw.text: I watched the reviews and decided to go to this place with friends for Saturday dinner. But both me and my friends  were disappointed with the choice. I usually don't go buffet very often, the only buffet  I went to recrntly was M hotel, about half month ago, compared to M hotel, the selection was half , the food quality was so so, the roast beef should be the best, but the walnuts shirmp which was a side was  the best to me. Besides that one , everything else is just ok, some of them were below my average expectations. I also watched the video " all you can Vegas" before, but there was indeed fewer choices than the video showed. Only the dessert meet.  The service were  nice, the people were friendly. Overall, I won't go there again even though the price is cheap. If you just want to eat and finish fast them go somewhere else , it may be a good choice.

16IOggNbP4NwwRCfuId1DA.text: On Feb 26 2018 Kei or Kai a manager there (don't know the correct spelling of her name) discriminated against me by not accommodating my disability.   I am supposed to be allowed to use the Chairman  line which moves much faster as it serves disabled guests as well ,however she denied me that right and said that I did not look disabled. I was forced to wait in the regular line and when I asked the cashier to call over the head manager she overheard it and became extremely hostile and sarcastically said again" I told you you don't look  handicapped".   Not only did she deny me my right to use a line that's available for disabled people but she discriminated against me because of the way I look, in her mind I did not look disabled. When Edward came over (another manager) to our table I explained to him in detail what happened and he assured me that disabled guests are allowed to use the chairman line as it moves much faster and there is little wait.   When I asked him why I was not allowed to use it and why she denied me that right he said he didn't have an answer and that he would investigate it and he apologized, I also asked him why would she be allowed to say I did not look disabled and I asked him to explain to me what disabled looks like and he said he did not have an answer.   Regardless of his apology I find it extremely inappropriate and unprofessional that she was allowed to stay in the buffet and conduct her routine duties after such an incident. I filled out a report of the incident and as of today I have still not heard anything back from anyone there. The ayce buffet at Palms has conducted itself  in an extremely despicable and vile manner as a business . It is clear that they really do not intend to do anything about the Discrimination when they allowed her to stay there after such an incident.

CuaZpUsr1JetChRnS-iW-w.text: This is probably the best buffet I've ever eaten at. Everything tasted so fresh and flavorful! I honestly did not want to leave! So many options! We went for dinner and nothing disappointed us! Everything was clean. The staff was very friendly. I will definitely be making this a must every time I'm in Vegas!

UWQg4__pXHjo5zoDh2mQ9Q.text: Don't let the price fool you! We had been planning our food for our weekend getaway for some time and was going to go to Bacchanal, but after reading some recent reviews and not wanting to wait hours on hours to eat for $65 a person, we gave this $20 buffet a try. They let us walk through the buffet before paying and decided to give it a go. The only really disappointing item there were the deserts. My wife LOVES deserts and did not eat most of the items she got after taking a bite. The gelato was good so just stick with that and you will be happy. They have a good selection of foods that are sized right with good flavor. Our favorite foods were the Asian inspired items with the chicken wings being some of the best we have ever had. They also had walnut shrimp and a beef based item that was really flavorful. The service was really attentive and made the whole experience great. A great place to eat for sure!

FQcqKiGZXqYI8qloCWzGaQ.text: Lunch Buffet- Lacked variety, food that was available was mediocre at best. The sweets were probably the best part and  our server was great.

-LbDDpYnkMhaJhpZ5fESCA.text: All I can say is :Awesome.  I started with the BBQ &cornbread and tried the lamb and the salmon and the shrimp cocktail. All yummy.  Great dimsum -and sushi.  Salad bar had great choices.  Deserts had no gluten choices  and a large variety.  The price is certainly great.!!!

G1TjUnPFM0NpPUzw_5z-SQ.text: Maralynn was our server and she was awesome. She was extremely attentive with drinks and clearing empty plates. Very friendly. Food was good too for 20 dollars a person. I would go back.

zqC5mky4UfvBzB6A1KZIZQ.text: We looked at yelp reviews to find a buffet since there is an abundance of them in Vegas.   This buffet did not disappoint.  The food was amazing.  Everything was so good and hot and fresh.  Service was excellent.  There was a little bit of a wait to get seated, about a half hour.  But I contribute that to the buffet being so excellent and many people wanting to go.  It was a little pricy for a family of 4, but it was worth every penny.  It was by far the best meal we had in Vegas.  Do yourself a favor and check this place out!

lt0-4-djAqHbm9NqozdTQQ.text: Wow Palms, this place is awesome! Guess where we're staying next time we come to Vegas?? Right here! Fantastic buffet!

I5p7I0JEgD3Q8MxOhkqDDQ.text: This buffet is really good. Pretty reasonable prices compared to other located buffet in Vegas. I love the French onion soup it is superb. I had a great time with my mom on her birthday. Thanks to the friendliness of the staff.

CGxSXgPkMbGQ6p2FJLdiZQ.text: "All You Can Eat" housed at the Palms. $11 per person for breakfast. Chosen because there was an asian section. They have a dessert section, typical breakfast food, carved ham, omelet station, asian section and healthy section. Best was the dumplings per the fam. Came around 9:30 and stayed for an hour. Nothing stood out in a good or bad way. Around 10:30 is when the crowd starts to form and there is a line with hotel patrons.

k5svNy9UprEwpn1JHyOALg.text: 5 star for customer service , 3 for the food.. mostly too salty or sweet for my taste... meat either too dry or lack of flavor. We do love the new decor and friendly staff.

XJSWLnggElI_r6jM36hUXg.text: I tried the breakfast, dinner, and then Sunday brunch. Overall the food was very good. I met the head chef who was watching the front line and was very focused on quality and any special request. I tried as many items as I could and overall give this place a big thumbs up

0CyqfyPyo7vcXlDAbmHYow.text: This is now my favorite buffet in Las Vegas! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that the cashier was very slow at the beginning.  Large variety of food from around the world. Much of the food like shrimp cocktail, onion soup, and lasagna was served in individual dishes. All seemed very fresh.

XQ8sR1siDSvBzD8GhO9MJA.text: I saw reviews that said this place had good price for what it offers, and that seems to be True. My picky parents liked many food items including fried chicken wings (they were truly the best) and fried rice. I liked tuna tartar, wings, pork tenderloin, calamari, and Mexican corn on the cob. Their coffee (nonalcoholic beverages included in the price) was actually quite goos and the gelato was good too! Loved some of their small plate desserts, not too sweet. For $16/person including beverage, not a bad deal.

st87wuWNE1TcfKi0GVaBeA.text: We haven't gone to a buffet in some time here in LV, but last Tuesday we decided to try the new AYCE Buffet at The Palms.  To much to our surprise, overall, the food and selection was good!  I specifically like the individual serving of the French Onion Soup & Chicken Pot Pie :-)  Our server wasn't memorable but she was up on our drinks and clearing our table, so no complaints.

yKCBioRY0vKMY9jNlWT25A.text: I'm sort of torn between a 3 Star or 4 star rating. The renovation turned this place to be more modern, but the quality of food is still, that of a smaller casino crowd. To me, the quality still doesn't compare to WS. The A.Y.C.E. Buffet's similar style to WS by offering small individual servings is a nice feature, but taste and quality of the food is key.  I'm not a big dessert person, but the dessert section was actually my favorite station. Their meat station was mediocre. Their beef selection was just roast beef, not even prime rib. The pork loin however was perfectly tender and moist. A lot of their entrees were dry and over cooked.   I guess overall the price for the buffet is by far a lot less compared to the larger Strip buffet restaurants. The server we had, Marilyn was the best thing from our first experience here at A.Y.C.E. Buffet. Her attention and constant clearing of our used dishes was very much appreciated. Her attention to refilling our beverages and her willingness to go above and beyond made our visit a pleasant one.   I think my 3 star rating is appropriate for its not horrible, but just average.

HBeIUWXYaHEBqkYBPb03MA.text: My wife had a convention at the Palms and when they were dismissed at 9 pm, we went to this in-house buffet to eat a late dinner. I was very surprised when the lady told us how much per person--It was the least expensive one I've heard of in Las Vegas! We were lodged at the Rio down the road and the buffet there was more than twice as much for dinner. Wow. The offering was not too bad as it had a selection of Chinese, Italian, Mexican and American cuisine. I love the breakfast buffet table and the omelet station. Really, for this price, I would definitely come back here especially if we're in Las Vegas with a big group. It's a no brainer.

GHJjxe41KHtjOGfV1plHeQ.text: The Palms Casino is currently advertising a "2-For-1 buffet, daily, 4 PM to 8 PM." However, when you get there, they tell you a coupon is required. I wish I had known that before standing in line for nearly an hour. This is False and deceptive advertising. You can't put up a billboard that says nothing more than what I mentioned above, and then require people to jump through non-disclosed hoops when they get there. I called the buffet manager Monday morning and left a rather detailed message, however 48 hours later I have not received a response.

T7zwTKSnUaGmahKLZm9gfw.text: I wish I took pictures of everything that came to our table. This is the best buffet I've been to in vegas and I'm a picky eater. I was so happy they had Prime Rib and French Onion soup. Do you know how hard it is to find French Onion soup even at a regular restaurant? Our waiter never let our drinks go less the half empty before refilling us. And the desserts are to die for. My favorite was the maccarons and creme Brulee. Sadly the maccarons are not made here but still amazing :)

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice cream sandwiches, creme brulee and maccarons
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The raspberry tea is refreshing
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh made pasta to order

mnWDNyLSLEbzsVkAbuH5xA.text: The aesthetics of this place is really nice. If I could give that 5 stars, I would. Even the presentation of some of the food selection is nice as well!  The quality of food is probably 3/5. It's okay, but not the greatest. The presentation probably makes up for a lot of it but that's why it equals out to 4 stars! Not a bad deal if you have a Players Card at the Palms, which is now owned by Station Casinos!

qNScSGOR7UQpSPlgCswxqg.text: I was very pleased with this buffet, especially because we paid the early bird pricing.   We had several cuisine options, I think my favorite was the Chinese selections which were, ramen, sushi(didn't eat), dumplings and more. I also ate the flamin hot elotes...so good.   They also have a variety of desserts which I got a scoop of coffee gelato.   I couldn't see myself eating here every day but I would definitely add this buffet into my places to go during my next visit.

03IOm5ROqowRaoMeLR-gcA.text: Had a wonderful time and meal at A.Y.C.E buffet. I am sure that the price will go up after it has established its name and the remodeling has completed. Guarantee.   The walk from the strip to Palms is about 20 minutes and it may not be pleasant on hot, cold, or rainy days. We were looking to take the shuttle between Bally's and Rio before walking over to Palms but when I got to the hotel, I was told that the shuttle was closed. When did that happen? Anyway, we walked and were glad that the food was excellent. I ate like a teenager again. They might have lost money on me.

HFiYqHx08zAOLXMS7WXxag.text: Best value Buffett in Vegas. PERIOD. They could use some better service and some quicker seating.... Waited in line for 30 minutes with an empty restaurant.... Very annoying...  But value baby, value.

VcRU1uLtiqmoVZeMOlaZmQ.text: For the last few years, we have visited Vegas lots.  This is the only buffet we go to.  We have been to many over the years, but why go elsewhere when this buffet keeps us happy.  And the price is much cheaper than other buffets that are not as good as this one.  Our family of four has dinner here for $90.  We could spend $120-$150 at other places, but why.  The new decor is nice and has upgraded the overall look.  This visit we really liked; the poke bowls, great carvery selections, freshest ingredients when building our own soft tacos.  The ice cream was top notch.  Quality.

UWgClbO_qk2ur0ji-tF1dQ.text: A step up from the Station Casinos' FEAST buffets. Attractive, well lit setting off the Palms casino floor. Service is attentive. Choices are ample and typical of a Vegas buffet. Fresh ingredients and competent food prep. AYCE loses a full star on the beverage front. Although they provide a mimosa as a brunch beverage, the choice for a Bloody Mary is a premixed version that comes in a can. A bad choice in my mind. In addition, the coffee is about on par with what you would get at a convenience store. So if you don't care about having decent beverage choices, you might consider A.Y.C.E. to be a 4 Star choice. But I give it 3 stars

UKWdm1P9bp2YtzCrpkkFYA.text: I like the old buffet better. One of the managers was so rude, that almost 45 minutes prior to closing, I asked for roast beef and she said they won't make a new one just because I me. The selection is limited and the service isn't on par with other buffets.

4L8Xh6BDDfrFnu4_j5cTcw.text: So we tried to eat there before and the line was to long. Then we received a voucher for my husbands b/day. We came in to town again to use it and they told us sense it was a holiday we could not use the voucher (cinco de mayo) so we left, we've traveled to go to the palms. later that day i called and asked to talk to a supervisor. When Mary came to the phone I asked her if cinco de mayo was a holiday and she said no! so i told her we had been turned away that day. She was so professional. she offered myself and husband a complementary buffet. So we came back she kept her word and we had a great buffet. food was delicious and service very favorable. and i'm not easy to please. Thank-you Mary and staff

Gu6BZLJyO-8GGqj-9FAYfA.text: Food was great! Chefs Sauo & Dayron took the time to help me and my wife understand what we could eat due to our food allergies. Thanks very much for taking the time!

WzbLv0aH3E1MM3b85IvVGQ.text: This place has a great selection, but the best part is the bottomless mimosas for $10 and the service was spectacular. Our server Gilbert was so attentive, consistently checking up on us and even treating my friend super well for her birthday. Gave us desserts and kept us hydrated. Definitely will come back for his service alone.

CjQnr6yuGsEo7smfmwHKGg.text: I have food allergies and find it hard to eat out, especially at buffets. However, on Friday May 3rd.  We went to A.Y.C.E. buffet at the Palms.  As I was looking for food that I could eat, most contained the things that I am allergic to.  I asked MICHAEL SOMMERS if there was anything that did not have black pepper or tomatoes in it.  Then MICHAEL SOMMERS a sous chef had ADRIANE MORA walk me through the entire buffet and tell me what was in the food.  After finding out that most of the foods were seasoned with black pepper, SOMMERS offered and proceeded to make me a fresh plate of food that I was able to enjoy.  This brought me to tears because of his concern, attentiveness and willingness to go above and beyond his duties, I was able to enjoy a meal with my family.  I want to thank SOMMERS and MORA for ensuring that every time I come to A.Y.C.E. I can seek them out and they will make sure that I am expertly taken care of.  I recommend the A.Y.C.E. to everyone living in Las Vegas and visiting here!  THANK YOU AGAIN.

A1vCfZB38BI49MZ-CMNtcQ.text: For the cheap buffet price in Vegas. This buffet is totally worth it. I would suggest to come for their lunch instead of breakfast. Since the buffet has less selection compare to other buffers in Vegas already. Breakfast is even less. My favorite would be their corn with hot chitos. Very clever dish. The fresh cut meat is very dry so I don't recommend it but others are not so bad. If you are coming for a five star meal I wouldn't recommend to come here since the food display is much better than it taste like. Also, do keep in mind that you may have to wait for long time to get seated.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oYjXXCnDn9UNyp78B5cCcg.text: Had the Sunday Brunch and it was fantastic! They had so many things to chose from. Everything was cooked really well. The price of brunch wasn't to bad. Wish it was a little lower for children. Regardless, really enjoyed the food. Everything looked really clean, and it was decorated very nicely. I'll definitely eat here again some day!

b0Ga-9ICHIYMavERt5Blvw.text: I was so glad to find a buffet were they have a section vegan gluten free. The section is very small and no more than 6 items. Unfortunatly the tabasco in the cauliflower and vegetable ratatouille did not do it for me. But what can you expect for a $15 buffet ?

lkUXxDF17MqMPIsurkQxKQ.text: I was disappointed in this buffet, considering it had an overall good review.  The selection was slightly diverse but not as wide as I expected.  I was there for an early dinner, about 5:30 and felt the food was not warm in some of the stations.  The service was prompt and waitress checked on us regularly.  This isn't a bad buffet, at $25, but I doubt I will come back again.

wOC9kf77-zRoj3NoqszJiw.text: First time at this buffet. Surprisingly good. Everything well cooked and unusual selections. Really enjoyed it and price reasonable. Busy place especially on the weekends. Very good service, prompt and friendly.

doUD_j7lqQjAgEFCpLYm6g.text: What a disappointment.  I understand they just remodeled and have been serving for less then one month but the food was below standard.   Turkey legs were cold and dry, asparagus and Brussels sprouts were very uncooked, pulled pork was extremely fatty, roast beef was ok and the helpings for the shrimp cocktails and  crawfish were very very small.  Does the chef taste the food before serving???? Obviously not.    To top that off the salad bar reach was almost impossible to get some of the items I wanted to add to my salad.  If you want to try the soup ( which was good) the way they have it set up makes it very difficult to serve yourself.  Opening the cover to get the soup was a pain.  You think having remodel the place they would make it easy for the customers to get to the selections.     The one thing I liked was the staff.  They were polite and very helpful.   They too were getting ears full of customers complaining.    Too bad... thumbs down for the Palms Buffett.   Not ever returning.   :(

tG3CgYW9vj6jb5_Ja7Y46A.text: This buffet is pretty good especially for their price. The pizza is more of a flatbread with no sauce so it's not the best. They have really good salmon there. They have tons of seating if you want to go their with a big group.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib and cauliflower were really good
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ayce buffet
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ayce buffet

mePFX_Yrs0_0--e_wIDUdA.text: We went for brunch buffet Sunday morning at 9 AM. We were staying at the hotel. Sunday morning buffet, as it is automatically brunch, is more expensive than normal buffet breakfast. Instead of roughly 9 dollars per person, it is a little over $23 per person. Includes bottomless Mimosa or champagne, which are OK, yet to get your moneys worth, you need to be a drinker or just not worth it. The food was average to a few items below average. Nothing was memorable and there is nothing I would want to try again. It is probably one of the lower end quality buffets that I have been to in Las Vegas. I am comparing it to higher end hotels though. We felt that because we had a two for one buffet certificate, it was OK. We would not have been happy had we had to pay the full price per person, because it simply isn't worth that much. Getting there at 9 AM on Sunday was perfect for us because there was no line. When we left around 10:30 AM, having taken our time, the line was very long to get into the buffet. Otherwise, it was just OK. I will say that it is an upgrade from the old buffet when it was under different hotel management. Therefore, it has improved, yet very average.

l3DjsFPwBBFybInG3BArNw.text: Beautiful buffet with comfortable seating arrangements. The food is delicious as well plus a yummy selection of ice cream that they serve for you!    Now let's talk about the main event! And this is not the food, it's about the employees in that location! Great customer service from every one that I spoke to. One in specific is Wendy! Everyone, if possible, ask for Wendy to be your server/waitress! She is fantastic! I believe she must be a coach to all the servers  if she isn't, she MUST be made ASAP! Quick at refilling your drink, take plates away, on top of it all! She would refer us certain combinations with food! Thank you Wendy for your great service!

ej4cxnz5kvz-mdDZ9ztIvg.text: The best buffet I been to in vegas. HANDS DOWN! From beef short rib to creme brulee, they got it all. Top notch service

tDBcywHUJJwwxK3f4EHCfQ.text: I've been wanting to try this buffet since it opened, but just recently the opportunity. The price for the selection was pretty worth it, $17 for lunch is a few dollars less than nearly every other A.Y.C.E. in Vegas and definitely cheaper than every other Vegas buffet. The food was alright, pretty much what you expect for $17, but for the most part the food was good! Our server, Fay was incredible! She was really sweet and consistently checked up on us to make sure we were doing alright. Hopefully I'll get the chance to come try dinner!

XbCwxhTxwRIdJ170kq6yQg.text: Had dinner on Tuesday.  Even before we went in you could smell the liquid smoke from the ribs and briskets.  Very good flavour but so strong that I could only eat one of each.  As the night wore on, the smell became increasingly annoying and clung to clothes.  Other food was quite good, especially for the price.  Not a huge selection but decent.  Staff was good and seemed to know the regulars.

UYVNhj2qoVSMMXTnF1G9Mg.text: I went there for Sunday brunch, the price was $18 per person, however I got two for one price. The wait time was 1 hour and a half, I got there at 1:15 and got seated at 2:45. The food was no extraordinary. I definitely won't come back even I got two for one price. The wait time was not worth it.

0HNOZ_3sT-Um1Q-w9ngNmg.text: This is one of the best buffets I've ever been to. They have anything and everything. Definitely recommend going and it's a good price!

AIsUP8e5ezX4U7JiOcTxMw.text: O my goodness. This outshines Bacchanal any day. $17.99?! Are you kidding me? It does have the same concept as Wicked Spoon. Only problem I had was the beef brisket could be more tender. Flavor was there. Loved how some of the food was portioned out. Prevents wasting. Kevin C. And Christoper were on point. Great service. Friendly. Refills kept coming. Always checked on us. Glad Palms became a Station Casino. Will definitely be back! Was a great birthday dinner with my wife. Corn bread on point. Could use more choices like sun flower seeds and beets for salad bar. Loved the honey walnut shrimp. Rivals LA's Chinese restaurants.

Sn8SWibwSYvOJhou-fi_aw.text: Dinner 02/09/2018  Especially for the price, this is my new favorite buffet in Las Vegas. I love the fact that much of the food is already set out as a serving size, rather than just a free-for-all, grab-as-much-as-you-can. The mini buckets of shrimp and seafood boil were awesome. The mini-tureens of French onion soup and individual plates of blue-cheese wedge salad are ingenious! The variety of foods is ample, and the dessert bar is better than most (the macaroons are awesome). If you like smoky BBQ, you'll really enjoy the beef brisket. They even had duck with white beans, which was amazing. It may not be the biggest buffet in town, but they do a great job with what they serve, and for $20 each, I have zero complaints. We will definitely be going again!

KrChH2veLxgwP_lAffkzmQ.text: I had a family dinner ...loved the interior sitting and dinning  Food was better than Red Rock more flavors than before  I would come again

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SFXqscsKAwOqnHf9TADGTA.text: Food was terrible  No options  Staff was friendly  Paid $16 for lunch was trying for the breakfast but missed it

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-ocDxj0UZxQYfbIbeqrMDA.text: Great value for what you pay! Everything was delicious and you have so much to choose from. I couldn't believe the selection- vegan options in addition to a salad and bread station, a carving station, Italian and southern (I fell in love with the hush puppies guys I had like 8) and Asian cuisine as well! The dessert selection ranges from soft serve and gelato to cookies, pastries, cobblers, brownies and cake. Basically I usually go to Caesar's buffet and while that is incredible, this was just as amazing for only like $20. Go for it! You won't be disappointed.

cR1Kk9Yb_q52SFLhks2iHA.text: Good quality for price, came in sunday brunch, be prepared for wait line, took us about 45 minutes, everything I tried was good, great service, overall good buffet!!

aqgJ783xeZwm3FZWHh8SXA.text: First let me preface this review by stating that this was my first Vegas buffet experience. According to all the reviews he buffet at the palms was the best bang for your buck. (Price point and quality). I came for a late lunch on a Saturday (around 2pm). The wait was ridiculous and to be honest the food was underwhelming. The lack of selection that some mentioned wasn't a problem for me because I value quality over quantity. Maybe this is good for Vegas price however I found the quality of the food to be no better than your regular run of the meal buffet priced at $9.99. For the type of food selection (fried rice, pasta, roasted veggies, sliders, Mac n cheese etc) there is no reason why the quantity can't be expanded. To add the pace that the bar was being replenished was unacceptable, with such a limited selection the bar needs to be replenished regularly. My husband never got to try the sliders because someone got the last one right when we first began our meal and they weren't replenished until we well through our meal. I can't recommend any other Vegas buffers but to those wanting to experience the Vegas buffet I would urge possibly trying another. While the palms is priced better than other buffets it wasn't worth the wait and the food was not satisfying. It was mediocre at best.

kKQM3bD4bLbNsYiNSG52oA.text: Oh yeah! Good food. Good service. What more can you ask for. At least once or twice a week I go to this buffet. I like the kind of food they prepare. I guess many other people would agree, because there is always a long line. I think it's worth waiting for. Anyway, The Palms resort is looking good.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bJIIOnW_PuFlNXyXE2hf3A.text: Long wait, good quality food nice workers.  I would go back but go earlier than 7pm for dinner.

WAEIQCDxgyvjcgdyWo3K7Q.text: Why not name an All You Can Eat buffet "A.Y.C.E. Buffet"? This is the newest buffet in Vegas as they opened their doors on 12/22/17. It's located in the Palms Casino Resort. Price of buffet depends on your player card status. $2 off if you're minimum Good Card status. Alcoholic drinks are an extra charge. Juice, soft drinks and coffee is included. We came here for breakfast so the buffet was only $10.99/person. Lunch is $13.99/person and dinner is $19.99/person.   There are many stations that you pick food from. When you are walked over to your table, a server comes up to take your drink orders. They came around several times to refill the drinks for us and clear out empty or finished plates. Excellent customer service for a buffet. The miso soup, hash browns, country fried steak, sausage, ham and OJ were good. Pulp was in the OJ which was nice. I was definitely not a fan of their pot stickers. Only Asian item I enjoyed was the miso soup. There was also an omelette station which was very popular.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Buffet

BRnKbwOpRrzqEv2eAcbMlA.text: If you can try somewhere else. Obnoxiously slow line (1 hour wait with 38 people in line) for no reason other than to curtail their costs. Less than mediocre tasting with sticky tables. Respond if you got the guts Palms.

FVW0_q-l-dFt1lLFZGwCvQ.text: The newly redone buffet at The newly redone Palms. OK, so here is the only reason this place gets only three stars. When they redesigned this place they had the opportunity to close the restaurant off from the casino and the toxic cigarette smoke. When will the casinos learn that the majority of us not only do not smoke, but find being around it abhorrent. Don't believe me? I've been twice. Both times I had to wait for a seat away from the smoke. That means that area away from the smoke was full. This was a real opportunity lost. All of that being said, the food was very good. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ENOAWSCOEvJl8A8o23fE7Q.text: This may be the best buffet we have ever had.  There was a great variety of foods from Italian to sushi.   The food was tasty and well seasoned, a rare find at a buffet.   The service was great, also rare at a buffet.  The buffet was clean with plenty of staff to stay on top of keep it tidy.  If you can manage enough space for dessert there were plenty of options and lots of mini desserts so you can try a variety of things.  It's off the beaten path but well worth the trip over to the Palms.  Which, we were pleasantly surprised with how nice the hotel and casino were too!

WxwiAdnlrgpit9nBSA_Dog.text: After a movie, I came here to try out the redone buffet.  It was a Monday night and not busy at all at 5 PM.  I like the new design and the setup is very good.  As soon as I was seated, I was greeted by my server and she soon had my iced tea at the table.  I then took the time to walk the length of the areas to see what they were serving.  They have gone to the pre-sized portions with some dishes.  I'm sure this helps cut down on waste because you're taking a small dish or bowl with a limited amount of food.  I passed on some pasta because it looked dry from sitting under the lamps for a while.  I was drawn by their flaming elotes (they weren't very hot) so it was a bit disappointing.  I also had a small shrimp cocktail in a miniature bucket.  Not bad at all.  For dessert, I had some macarons--they have it spelled wrong--a miniature eclair.  I passed on getting a handmade ice cream cookie sandwich because I was full by then.  It seems like a busy night would be the best time to be here as the food would turnover faster instead of sitting under lamps.  The staff was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They make cookie ice cream sandwiches.
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some desserts.
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. He sure has egg on his face!

LGNRM5vFi6TXYVMjAgLVcg.text: Very tasty food with many choices. Clean and friendly with helpful staff. One of the best buffets in Vegas!

NZt39Xe0U52oPlYFJZwAtw.text: The price and overall experience are what a buffet should have locked in, and this place has it done right.  A lot of the local legends and the strip's famous buffet joints as of late have all taken a dive in recent years.   The kings nowadays are the M's Studio Buffet and Bacchanal.  At least in my opinion.   In comparison to both strip and local AYCEs, I'd have to say that this place of business holds it's own well enough.  Food's aight but the service on my first visit was awesome.  I had an issue earlier regarding my status on the card and the price, yet they fixed it very quickly and without rudeness.  Kudos to Nicole and the manager on duty, Facia L. for their service!  They deserve recognition for being amiable and professional!  Pricing is within the $10-$20 marks during lunch and is way cheaper than the Wicked Spoon at Cosmo, BUFFET at Bellagio, and Bacchanal at Caesar's Palace.  If you hold a Preferred card you get a slight discount, and Gold and above is even more of one.  Parking, for now, is still free at the Palms and isn't small and crowded, narrow and claustrophobic, but it's not huge and confusing.  So don't worry about finding places to store your car both inside and outside the garage.  The line is easy to navigate and moves fairly quickly.  You may have younger inexperienced employees, but they get through your orders quick and the managers are always roaming about helping guests with more complicated issues.  Seating was surprisingly cool.  The seats were comfortable, while the tables, carpet, lighting, atmosphere, colors, and spacing were all well planned out and seemingly fancy but without being bougie.  Endless mimosas during brunch, and you can add the liquor package anytime for a bit more for lunch and dinner.  It's not empty nor crowded so that's a plus for me.  Meat and cheese dishes I can't really vouch for, however, they did look fancier then delicious so I won't be reviewing anything.  The cauliflower they serve has a decent sauce, but I personally prefer a creamier sauce with more spice.  Most of my friends who ate the meat and cheese dishes say that the food items were much more delicious than local joints but just shy of comparing to the expensive strip buffet's similar dishes.  Some of the veggie dishes need more items along with some juices or smoothies.  Restrooms in comparison to the older palms previous set up are cleaner, and roomy.  I like the lighting and the particular urinals they chose.  Being a local I can say that I'd come back every now and then especially since I gamble here and can benefit from the discounts and points from dining in-house.  I'll critique more on the food later on more visits because I primarily eat Vegan and won't have the first-hand experience with current meat or cheese items, but for now, I'd recommend anybody to at least try this buffet once!  Also, I just wanted the two mentioned above recognized!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan Jackfruit Enchilada.  Eating with dad and brother
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan peppers
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They have this area for vegetarians.  Some items are Vegan.  They gotta have lettering like at Studio B at M.  Vegan, vegetarian, GF, etc.

5nKMr5MiOsHuLyzRsVxnqg.text: AYCE Buffet was pretty underwhelming considering that Las Vegas is known for their buffets. I opted for AYCE since I don't eat much and I didn't want a spend a crap ton on a buffet that I know will not be worth it to me. I also don't care much about seafood at a buffet so I thought AYCE was perfect for me! I went during lunch time and you pay before you enter the buffet and you wait in line until a host is ready for you to get on a table...the set up is kind of weird in my opinion.  There was really nothing special about this buffet...you could make your own pasta, there was elotes that I was excited about but they were really nothing special, there were sliders and "dim sum"... I would've rather went to Soup Plantation.  A beverage is included with the price you pay and parking is free so I guess that's a plus.

dtXFt7uuFR2VwUvjlC6_vg.text: If you are looking for a super affordable buffet that has actually good food (and not only just a wide variety of food), come here.   We walked by this place while going around the casino. We stayed in the Palms Place so we were really close to here. An Uber driver recommended this place to us. And, based on my experience, when a local Uber driver recommends a place, you at least check it out.  The staff were super friendly and let us do a quick walk around before purchasing a buffet. We looked, we smelled, we got in line.  We stayed for the breakfast buffet, so I can only speak about that, but for about $10ish dollars a person, we couldn't believe that the food could be that good. I'm so glad we were wrong.  I usually think of buffets as "a bunch of average food that makes up for the average taste with the overwhelmingly quantity". This one, however, has a huge variety AND tastes great AND is super affordable. Seriously, this may be the best breakfast buffet I've ever had.  Overall, because of the clean environment, classy decor, tasty food, wide variety of food, friendly staff, & extremely affordable price, I'd say it's worth a shot.   Honestly, I wouldn't be surprised if their prices go up soon. This is easily a $30-40/person buffet at a $10ish price.   The only question I have for you now is: Will you be able to try all the foods you want to try here before you get full?   I almost did. Almost.

Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7f3yY7-wmMy5HWocaSqN7Q.text: The more buffets I go to, the more I realize you get what you pay for.   AYCE sounds like a steal when you see the price, but unfortunately that was the best part of the dinner. Thats not to say it was bad at all, but in a city of buffets, the food just doesn't stand out. The highlight for me though was the cornbread and ribs.   If you're looking to eat a lot of food but not spend a lot, consider AYCE. If you're okay to spend more though, there are plenty of other world class buffets to chose from

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UsyFZWQjWbqdTraTJyj8Yg.text: Food was bland very much tasteless I will never go again not worth the price even for vegas it seems they have never heard of seasoning the meat much better buffets across the strip STAY AWAY!

dGCABvl25fFmU4QqUaEcbQ.text: The food was bland and tasted like something you would get from a school cafeteria, however, two things stood out: the watermelon was fresh and the dessert was good (bread pudding and Oreo mousse.) We came here on Tuesday afternoon and for the entire hour we were there, loud alarms were going off. I think they were testing the system, which is fine but did it have to continue for the whole hour?! I would not go back.

jTzfl2Y7i3BvHwj_Tx5VZg.text: Located in the Palms Casino the A.Y.C.E. Buffet is the newest casino buffet to open in Vegas. Compared to the last casino buffet to open, the Medley at the Orleans, A.Y.C.E. Buffet is way way better. I think it's even cheaper when using the player's card. They were about $20 for dinner.  Where do I start!? How about the last thing I had!? The desserts. They actually have a nice selection of some really good desserts. I probably had one of everything at least once. The Creme Brulee they served was the best I've had in a while. The custard mixture was rich and very tasty. It tasted like more egg yolks were used which I preferred. The chocolate mousse cake was also delicious. I had like 5 of them. They're small pieces. There's gelato, macarons, cookies, sugar-free things, and more.   I honestly ate a little of almost everything except whatever was in the station on the far left.  I'll just mention a few of the items I really enjoyed. Everything in the salad area especially wedge salad. The chicken pot pie, turkey legs, BBQ briskets and rib, kalbi, corn on the cob, pizza, duck, mussels, salmon, walnut shrimp, and everything else. I was easily there for a few hours.  I did like how there were a lot of dishes served in small plates or containers. They're nice to have because it keeps dishes separate from other dishes.   The only knock on them is there wasn't a made to order pasta station or crab legs but I'd definitely be back.

3qhrEMz--IB22yxGkK0OEA.text: The best buffet in Vegas! Micheal and Salvador went above and beyond with their customer service. Truly amazing! The food was equally as fantastic! Also, you can't beat the price. Make sure you sign up for the players club to get a discount ;)

pXYpU6n2xS5axJ4mHrZp6w.text: We have a great time eating in the Palms AYCE, great place and good selection of foods that is very satisfying. All the people working who help us with smile even they are very busy and our server Gilbert was very attentive and very nice. We will surely share this experience to our family and friends and surely comeback to this place.

PpbxuZk-Qw3rk5ymAcyzsQ.text: First time here. Valentines day menu at $17.99 with players card. Food was more on point. Beef brisket was flavorful added with au jus and a little horseradish. Tried the cheeto elote very comfort food like. Revival had vegetarian option from vegetable sushi and tacos. I enjoyed the fried chicken crispy exterior and moist chicken meat. AYCE buffet good for price point and location with free parking.
