ibHYYBzSvrAul9LnSxa_1w.text: **BRUNCH REVIEW** 3.5 STARS  New buffet? New buffet with a location close enough to the strip for some fun, but off the strip so you don't deal with parking?! YASSS.   Okay, so a group of 4 of us decided to try Sunday Brunch here during MLK weekend around 12pm. Needless to say, it was a LONG 1hr+ wait, but we made it with a hungry appetite!   Food selection: 4 stars. Brunch had a LOT of breakfast options, eggs a bunch of different ways, bacon in two areas, biscuits and gravy, French toast, pancakes, sausage, toast, LOX AND BAGELS, prime rib, brisket, etc. They also have a lot of lunch items such as the Asian food, international areas, salad area, small bites on individual plates, etc. Everything was pretty good, but nothing was very over the top that I can remember wanting to go back for. My cousin went to the Omelet Bar which was probably the highlight for brunch!  OH AND YEA UNLIMITIED MIMOSAS FTW!  (BUT FYI, not consistent. Some batches had a lot of juice, other had barely any...at one point I figured I should just get champagne and order a juice to make it myself LOL)   Size: 3.5 stars- the ads make this place seem huge and exciting, as if it were another bacchanal. This is not the case. The place was big, yes, and there were "stations", but It really is just an upgraded version of a station casino. It has the same set up, but obviously a little newer and classier.   Wait: 3 stars. It just opened AND we went for brunch, but waited about an hour or more to be seated.   Service: 4 stars Our mimosas were constantly filled and our plates were taken fairly often. Nothing amazing, but they do their job well and kept us satisfied :)   SUMMED UP:  For the amount of time I spent in line, the price and the food selection, I probably would give this place 3.5 stars, the 4 is for me hoping to come back for lunch or dinner to try.  We paid 19.99 for brunch with our red players card **You only get the larger discount with higher up cards**  The food was good, but not amazing. Some foods were definitely picturesque (individual small plates in lieu of scooping on your own), but nothing wowed me in terms of taste/flavor. The wait was fairly long, but for brunch I really shouldn't complain much. The area was pretty, but seemed like a nicer version of station casinos....where I can brunch for about $11 rather than $20.  I'd like to come back and try the regular dinner and lunch foods. I feel those would be a better deal :)

VYwZuBywDe0HDRbJZqLzSg.text: Man one of the best buffets I have ever been too. My server Ele never let me wait for my next Mamosa. Great food and great service.

aYLhG4Rq5JXCDBdF0Hyn2w.text: First time here since the renovation and it was great. More especially, we really love the service. Our server, Salvador, is probably the most genuinely nicest person we've ever had at a casino buffet. As a local, we eat at buffets often and Salvador is the best! The food was also very good, especially for the price. We will definitely be coming back again. Now if Red Rock Casino can step up their buffet game, we'd love to see that considering we live in Summerlin.

Lc_dww3o0sId8D3hbh28jA.text: This is one of the best buffets in Las Vegas! The food is hot and very fresh! We had Rhonda for our server and she took very good care of us! Our drinks were always full and the dishes were cleaned off our table as soon as we finished! The price for lunch was very reasonable! Lots of food to choose from!

dFLC9eAy5mqCP_daKIl5nA.text: This buffet is new, beautiful, and extremely well priced! There is many different stations including a vegan/vegetarian station which is something I have not seen in any other buffet. The food was always fresh and taste is a 10. The price is probably half of what all the buffets in the strip cost. If you are looking for a fun buffet you should come in and try it.

WXzrypb5QluDuQL6C2FaPA.text: Outstanding service and the food was amazing!!'  Very high quality and cooked to perfection.  The deserts are very well done.  I would highly recommend a trip to the Palms even if just for the buffet.

gnIdTtBJ-8RVtuSm8tSR2Q.text: Went in with some family from out of town, I have tried many buffets in Las Vegas but this one is now my favorite so far, good price great food, lots of choices, they only reason I did not give them 5 starts is because I was not impressed with the staff, the waitress was hovering over us the whole time and kept interrupting our conversations, I have a dessert shot glass that was broken and instead of apologizing and offering to get another she just took it and said I will let the chef know. but otherwise I was impressed.

3nRlVBtiuXAYLWFsZsabfg.text: I really enjoyed the new A.Y.C.E. buffet. The smoked meat choices were my favorite. Very nice healthier choices than your average buffet. But do not over look the wide deliciousness of their desserts. We will definitely be back to dine on our next stay at the Palms.

WVCv4vX7V0PhTz3Ew1IT2g.text: The vibe awsome...the food amazing..price reasonable a complete hit!!!! My new favorite spot!

UgNyfkztzM0aQOfSzybUnw.text: Omg on a scale from 1 to 10 for buffets this is an 11. This is a food heaven. If you want to try all the good stuff you have to come back the day after for round two. Lucky me I work right down the street. Morrocan Lam, Peking duck, Smoked Beef Brisket, Hawaiian Poke, Southern BBQ, French onion soup, Orleans Gumbo, New England Clam Boil Coq Au Vin. I'll get rid of my kitchen and just come here to eat. Whatever diet you are on the Mediterranean, Keto, Low Carb, Vegan  they got it. This is about small healthy fresh cooked plates. Tasting festival of food from all over the world. Nicely done.

wwqEFNrNEoD-v90Q3n1lYA.text: Great buffet to visit if your in Vegas! Price is decent and the customer service is great! The food is also very good!

t66WdYcf68IvSdzM1NavwQ.text: Great Breakfast!  The Eggs were perfect.  Lots of selection. Starting from fresh juice, to vegetarian dishes, to best omelette station. Great price for the quality. Everthing was fresh and great. Highy Recommend!

kWv0MR5xJgQiLtvBzqDsbw.text: Josue P we very much appreciate the service from this young man, very friendly and on top of the table service. Unusual to find someone who can handle buffet service at such a high level.

KOBUDy_HGVAY5UmK-g6HNw.text: This is the 8th time we came to eat breakfast here. But today was very not the best experience we had. Food today was warm but not hot as normal. And we got here at 816am. Everything was ok. But their so called CONGEE was totally so so thick that it was like warm rice pudding. I hope they'd check what they put out before any of us get to it. Don't get me wrong. Service is always great and our server Benji today was awesome as always. But the food today was lack luster.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Supposedly congee!

nq292xYnsK51NIQfhriLrQ.text: Advertise major remodel but value & food quality take a major nose dive from former Palms Bistro Buffet. No real seafood, just bland.

9Kslomk1isUGevJr-UpO7w.text: I've seen the commercials that show this beautiful buffet and new foods and to come on in and try it. Well I did and I took the biggest critic I know, my mom. Well I have to say my mother remembered the old Palms with the small buffet and she said it was not the best. First I tried the Asian food station I must say that the rice was a little off it wasn't that great. Then we tried The Carving Station and the beef was really good. We stumbled upon the fried chicken wings and I have to say they were perfectly seasoned and little spicy and so delicious! Every vegetable dish we tried was delicious the vegetables were crisp and fresh. The mashed potatoes were really good. Now I must tell you the best thing there... they have a smoke station with ribs that are delicious and also you can find wonderful brisket that is both more moist and cooked to perfection. Wholesale treat yourself to fried turkey wings oh my goodness. Now the desserts to me were not good the ice creams were crystalled but the white chocolate covered strawberries were the bomb. We did go on a Sunday so we were able to have the champagne brunch; we got there around 3 and stayed till about 5 pm... just eating everything that we could. If you are new to Las Vegas or if you have been here for a while, you know that buffets in the past used to be really really good now most of them really suck. This Buffet to me compares to The Cosmopolitan here in the Vegas area however they do not carry the Cosmopolitan prices.  Mom and I will try to get to this place as often as we can because we really really really enjoyed it. Well priced $18 per dinner buffet! The staff and manager (who is expecting) delivered excellent customer service!

MRnF8zxpXNNA6LJCwlSIwA.text: The food was ok, but the service was great. We were part of a big group, around 20+ people, our server Joshua (Josue P) was very nice and patient. Thank you.

QpumXCPQf7d9so6_nUFd6A.text: Wow so I have waited over an hour in line for brunch. They are completely understaffed. Once I finally got to the front of the line the cashier just let some random couple cut me. Talking about how they had been waiting so have I we are all in the same line. Seriously disappointed they didn't have it together better than this. The sausage I had was cold, the carved meats were very dry, the only thing I enjoyed was the French toast. I didn't even see my server again until I was finished eating. Just a pretty poor experience all around. I feel like the staff dropped the ball on this one.

bFahD0EsY688oj8P1k222w.text: The food was not very good. I'm giving it 3 stars for the variety and cheap price. There were some okay options but not a lot of healthy food.

JgL1I15SlejDMNxG2iJx8Q.text: First, our waiter was very good.  He gets 4 stars.  The food, 2 stars.  Went for lunch today.  Line at 1pm was quite lengthy. As I am handicapped, our line the wait with 4 people ahead of us took over 15 minutes. The other line could take about an hour.  Once we were seated, up to see the offerings.  I will say almost everything we tasted was either luke warm or cold.  The elote was good, but cold.  The sliders were sitting way too long, buns dried out.  That went to trash, but then they put a new tray our.  It lacked seasoning, no taste at all.  There was no ribs or brisket at lunch.  Just chicken or pulled pork. Overall, I would prefer Green Valley Ranch over AYCE.

8pXWc9ve6tlrI4OIKH3qeA.text: Line was sooo long! So with a line being that long you would think the food was great, right? Wrong. It wasn't that great at all. I would compare it to your average "local" buffet that you would pay $9 for dinner. Selections are minimal and what they do have, well...weren't very good. Won't be coming back here.

EIgobFOexs0cldIzHHaEDQ.text: The best buffet in Vegas. The price is unbeatable. The quality of the food is great. It's always fresh. The service is extra amazing. Especially Rhonda she is the bees knees.

9sw-MdPVqNcIy52oRZHjGw.text: Just a typical buffet. After reading the reviews, I was hoping for a great food experience. I suppose it was confirmation that a buffet is just a buffet! Nothing spectacular and all the meats are always dry and lack good flavor. The best item was the mustard salmon. There was not much else to comment on. For 21.99, go to a non-buffet place and order something you want. On the plus side, the service was very nice.

txEf0ncRcK5DxTgPTA-ZJw.text: This is just another stations buffet don't be fooled. The food sits out all day dries up or gets funky. You were warned.

hocXyrh0TGV6edBqpV5udA.text: First time trying this place. At the beginning of the line seemed normal but within five minutes it seem like we're getting backed up.  They didn't have it quite organized for the seating as both lines were complaining about the wait. When we first approach the food and the sign is the not match the food but I noticed the lady trying to fix them. Maybe we got there st sign changing time. Had a variety but cramped in dining area. Our waitress Ebony was most helpful.

o1ADTd0FBDEbsSp2c96frg.text: While I am a Phat girl, I am not a fan of buffets. But my oldest son was raving about the selections so we gave it a go.   Pros:   lots of vegetarian choices.   some interesting selections like Moroccan lamb - but no pilaf or couscous - and dragonfruit lasagne.   bight, clean & a fair amount of staff.   dessert bar will make you custom ice cream sandwiches using cookies & a very good selection of made on site, ice cream.   pulled pork  mexican street corn  Cons:   very confusing lines to cashier  rude front of house staff - cashier & hostess. We stood for almost 20 minutes for them to decide which side our party of 4 would be seated at. 5pm on a Friday night when most parties are 4+   no where to sit while waiting for the rest of the party.   Selection of food was meh. Typical carving stations, nothing really that stood out. I realize they are only open 1 month but honestly, I thought Station Casinos would have this  down by now  they served a Bloody Mary in a CAN & we had to ask for a glass cuz Im "classy"   food labels were unclear.  I used my Station card but for 2 of us it was $44something. Obviously not that great of a discount if its 19.99 w/o the card. & the cashier with her rude self, walked away when I asked her.   We might go back in a few months, once the casino reconstruction is finished.   Fat girl seating: 5 Large spacious tables & armless chairs.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I didnt lie - an actual Bloody Mary in a can for $8. This is why Vegas is known to locals as the Mississippi of the West.

en8ADisgod0et8PIVdd1oQ.text: My name is Eddy Pinto I've been a chairman with station casino for many years I've had the best experience again and again at the Palms buffet AYCE I went in with my wife and my 2 kids . It all started with your grill station when we noticed there was no meat as my daughter was here from school beak from Indiana, we asked Robert about if there was any type of meat anywhere that my daughter can have and he told us that after 4pm there will be much more displayed and if we could wait a little . All of of a sudden Robert along with Adrian the asst room chef got a piece of grilled meat for my daughter, I did not expect that and I thank them very much . I know that it's a stevenBarr crew and they have been trained the right way to help the clients . I really would like to give them a five star because they went out their way to please their guests . Thank you very much I will always be a loyal client of the palms  Also from the cashier to the hostess to the server and management great job

nZDqw9gvK68B2OdZiSlBjw.text: Voted one of the better buffets in Vegas, was disappointed in their lunch menu. Not as many options as I would have liked. Their Asian section was pretty decent, potstickers were good and spring rolls were also good.

6i9ajcZLGJZwQnEIGlxR7w.text: This buffet was ok.  There were some things that were really good and some things that were not.  The was no prime rib and the roast beef was dry and chewy.  The ribs and roasted turkey was excellent.  We went a little late at 7:30 or 8:00 and some of the food didn't seem fresh.  It was also during the week, maybe it's better on the weekend.  another problem is it's open to the casino and the smoke from the casino was pretty bad.  The palms does not have a good filtering system. The staff was very nice and welcoming.

MKetFrfeVPFSWvha396sUw.text: Much better than the expensive buffets. This is my fourth time here and every time, they add something new love it :)

bhCMLuE-pM3Z3Nqy_I6ylg.text: Stayed at the Palms this past week so I was fortunate enough to have easy access to this affordable buffet. We ended up eating here for breakfast 3 mornings and were told we could add bottomless mimosas for $10 the last 2 days which we definitely indulged in! Honestly for the price this buffet was pretty good and you'd really have to be an extremely picky eater to not find anything you like here. I think they offered a good variety of things, but of course there are some hits and misses as not everything tastes as good as it looks and some things were warm almost cold vs hot. My biggest complaint is that the menu seems to be literally the same every day or it was at the least the 3 mornings we went which is why we did not go again for the remainder of 3 days we were there. Besides that I definitely recommend if you're staying in the Palms and maybee if you're nearby and just really want a buffet or bottomless experience but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A random plate of pesto penne (left, very good!!), Mac and cheese with hot cheetos dust, blackened cat fish and calamari steak on top

Xre11FUp7c8qlKy5RZNPZQ.text: This is a good value buffet! There's a decent selection of meat and dessert, as well as a salad/fruit bar. some tasted better than other, I especially enjoyed the lamb, seafood bucket, and BBQ ribs. Part of the building was under renovation when we went, but still connected to parking. Free self parking.

1oeRoeuaszKHbY5IWYdKfg.text: Went with great expectations, was underwhelmed presentation of the food and ambiance of the restaurant were good I wish the food was fresh it seems as if they had the hype and appearance but lacked the flavor for a station casino it's good. Service was good great staff which is important and impressive overall a good experience just the food was ok and obviously that's what you're going for.

nMXtsjiogd6SAYozk1xMoQ.text: We went for lunch and there were not many dishes for a lunch buffet in Vegas. They never served chicken breasts just thigh and legs. The chili verde had bones in it. The tortillas for the fajitas were cold. The only part that was decent was the desert. For sure not worth the price or the 45 minute wait

y-AIAW9mPkJkAcEaeRt9eA.text: I was requested to show my passport for eating a breakfast. That's so ridiculous!  The staff didn't explain why. Bad experience.

swalKp2yy3dQLXh-jJp4ZQ.text: Really wasn't impressed. Visited on 03/17 for brunch. There was a large variety of food choices however much of the food was very bland or cold. With being a highly recommended buffet, I was excited to try something new however I really would like recommend coming here. Our server however I would give a 5 star. He kept the mimosas coming, and at one point was serving us just champagne (which I was not complaining). He was very friendly and ensured our table was clear at all times however no matter the amount of alcohol, the food was still not impressive. I wish I saw a glimmer of hope and was willing to give this place another chance but I did not.  Side note: the hotel is under construction so beware of excessive noise and maneuvering around work areas.

llDkHfAlb00lw6sfrdidOw.text: I am torn with this New Buffet (fully remodeled room and food stations) Did you know the Palm Casino is now a Station Casino? I didn't know... Yesterday night they had macarons!!!  A.Y.C.E. buffet reminds me of the one in Red Rock Hotel, just smaller. They opened end of december of 2017 so not long ago. You would expect the food quality to be outstanding for at least 6 months (right?) Also Salad's lover, A.y.c.e. doesn't offer a large salad bar selection as Red Rock Casino... Before I talk about my experience let say that when you pay less than$20 for dinner you should not complain right?  Let's be fair and honest, it's was good. Also go sign up for a Casino Players card (takes 2mns) it gives you some discount when you pay :) Choice is decent, what bothered me was that individual serving were close to cold, and stations were not filled appropriately for dinner rush I read some many people writing about the macarons they saw on TV ads and not at the buffet... i might be lucky... it was plenty of them at the dessert station hehehe! The host took us to our table. Nice and friendly. Our waiter offered us great service.   most of their dishes are displayed in individual portion. which is smart, less waste! Frenchy clin d'il with some traditional french dish like Coq au Vin, Cassoulet a la cuisse de canard, soupe a l oignon :) The soupe a l oignon was delicious, enjoyed the melted cheese! The cassoulet was alright, i believe it was displayed for some time, the canard/duck was dry and cold :( the beans were almost perfect The coq au vin was delicious and tasty! translated in english is like Roaster cooked in wine. picked a salmon poke. The rice was hard :(   the funny part is when I look at the salad bar. They offer individual portions of shrimp cocktail, ceviche (lemon doesn't look fresh, it's dried :(() Like i said compare to the Red Rock salad bar... the bar did not offer many choices. so here is the funny.. couple clients were looking for butter... nowhere to be found by the sliced bread. A man was feeling his bowl of "mozzarella mini balls" till the station attendant said "Sir, are you a butter lover?" it was hilarious, I was giggling so hard !!!  so the butter is rolled into small balls like mozzarella ... and placed next to each other... so don't get tricked ah ah ah Pizza/Italian station offers pizza, pasta, calzone pizza... Dessert station is small but offers good variety of ice cream and pastries.  Like the macarons and the vanilla puffs!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. salmon poke - rice was dry and not well cooked
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. orange chicken
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. onion soup

pD66ULtWwExGaFcYzc83PQ.text: Great food and variety. The food is very delicious, everything tastes fresh. The only item that I didn't like was the roast beef. It was very very red in the middle, almost raw. But other than that, everything was great. Also, I sort of felt rushed to finished my meal. But, I still got to enjoy everything that I could eat.

QamXO_8YUp5DzOammYfsSA.text: I'm a local and I come pretty regularly to this Buffett in specific because the offer vegan friendly items, but the last time I went was phenomenal. We had Glenda as our server she was above and beyond! Management had even stopped by the table and checked on how everything was, was very friendly, and when we needed something she went and grabbed it for us! Overall great experience and I know I'll be back!

s6lpvd5UpB2uoAKez1MIig.text: BIG disappointment!!!  After seeing good reviews and pics, looked like a good idea.  Got there on Wednesday before Thanksgiving and the selection and quality were mediocre at best.  I don't know where the good food was hiding but it sure wasn't out when I got there.  No beef, nothing but hot links for sausage and most foods looked like they had seen better days.  Salad bar was boring and uninviting.  Looks like they amped up for the opening and then scaled way back.  Would not return.

OHWwdqcVbfnghQcr61E5Wg.text: We arrived at 3:45, waited to get in, it only have about 6 groups of people in front of us, the cashier is extra slow to drag it to 4pm so they could charge dinner price, when it is our turn which is 3:59, the cashier keep repeating the same questions couple of time when we told her "yes, it is 7 adults and 1 kid", then she key it in after 4pm and told us it is dinner price you know that right? so ridiculous, we have to pay $6 more each person.  Not much choice of food. When they cut you the prime rib, they cut a really really thin slice only. Only 3 kind of fruit to choose, 2 soups and the chicken noodle soup is bitter because of the celery(I think) and salty. For sushi, only have rolls which the rice is hard and the sushi is warm, only 4 kinds of roll to choose from, no sashimi or nigiri. I got a plate of shells put it on the table and then go get food with my little one, when I came back to the table the server took my plate of food that I didn't even have a chance to eat.

o5Bx87sbcw2JwO9cwJigMQ.text: It's just ok..some of the dishes are good but cold. I like that they have a vegetarian station. Workers are friendly.

ABMoXBZQ7tCOC6LbQN7heA.text: Went there for late breakfast and saw them transition over to lunch on a Monday.  I was very impressed with the healthy options, vast selections, and quality of the buffet.  For starters, they have pressed mango juice with chia seeds and gluten free pancakes as part of their healthy choices.  Omelette station and regular pancakes, carved ham and two types of eggs benedict (go for the brisket one).  This was definitely pleasing and the things that they had there makes me want to go there again the next time I visit.  There were no overdried foods.  Desserts were mainly breakfast pastries and ice cream, but when transitioning over to lunch, they've got tiramisu and some other fine desserts.  TBH, I got more excited for this breakfast buffet and got more satisfaction than I did for the Bacchanal.  Maybe it was the price, maybe the quality, maybe both.  Bravo, Palms!

ZY27fywGk8sdqxp3eC4rOA.text: The Server was very nice, but that was all that was good about this buffet. The cashier just stood staring at us waiting in line when the cashier we had been waiting for told us we could go to the one across the way. Poor service on her part. The food is beyond bland, only thing with flavor was the bbq pork from the world pan area and the pizza. Even cream brulee's was flavorless.... not what I expected out of Vegas!

N8-kcUrm6DTPO1sggCagTQ.text: Came here for my birthday and everything we had was great and fresh. I had the smoked chicken and brisket. Did not disappoint. The dinner meal was $21 and was worth every penny. The waitress was good. We did have to go looking to refill our glasses. Will go back.

2JY-0j8UM3hVs6k2wzoibg.text: Great buffet for how inexpensive it is!! Much better then even Wicked Spoon that is twice as much. Food was fresh and hot at all times. Unique dishes. The wait staff was very friendly. Desserts could be a little better but other then that great! Will definitely go again.

X3LEsekeFCPfufY1pCVIIA.text: Fresh food with a good variety. Brisket was really better than expected as was Korean short ribs

U3uldKfdnj7679FFfItEIg.text: This is a solid Las Vegas buffet.  The desserts were definitely the highlight.  I was torn between three or four stars, but chose the former to differentiate it from the decidedly superior buffet we visited during the same trip.

BLvCZ8TyvQWpT_W03pZNgw.text: AYCE is awsome. To go from  perfectly smoked BBQ ribs to vegiterian black bean pasta on one plate  is A foodie dream come True....so Is design ur own ice cream sandwich. Will be back again and again.

P8DsZ9Y138b1wI62_c2JhA.text: The smoked ribs and brisket were phenomenal.  The waitress was nice and sweet, my glass stayed full.  However, the cashiers and hostesses, didn't have a clue.  After waiting for 20-30 minutes, they instructed a few of us into a different line.  Meanwhile, they let everyone that was behind us, to be seated first.  Therefore the people behind us only had to wait approximately 10 minutes vs our 30 minutes.  As soon as I pointed it out, they opened up the flood gates and began seating my neglected group at a quick and frantic pace, like a jail break out. I stated "Wow you have a bunch of tables open now!  Where were these tables 10 minutes ago?"  Sometimes you have to get up, stand up, stand up for your rights.  Get up, stand up, don't give up the fight. Soon, the quality will go down hill.  The tender ribs and brisket will blossom into a fond remembrance, when visiting Memory Lane. Unfortunately, this happens to all LV buffets.

wl23U3qeiMfARswlvSaWjQ.text: This buffet is up among the Buffets in Vegas. The most value is for the price of a regular buffet you get food that can compare to a fine dinning restaurant. Some of my favorites are the duck cassoulet, walnut shrimp,  brisket, and of course for a chicken wing man, the salt and pepper chicken wing. Lots more to mention but my most favorite of all is the pressed fruit drink in a shot glass which is a must. You get the food value and the ambience for the price of a hole in the wall buffet. Special mention are the staff who made our dinning experience every better.

cx_r9mc17vwErtacyMIJvg.text: Very nice food, excellent service. What an experience for this price. The spread was really nice too. Desserts were awesome including sugar free desserts

JHaE5EGz6HLwsTXBaGO_0w.text: okay it's not the Wicked Spoon, but the price was reasonable and some of the offerings like the beef brisket were awesome.

JVNwUJ9tluf2QIj2xm7tPg.text: The food was great (all three of us really enjoyed it), but the service was SO SLOW!! We were there last Friday, for the first time, and waited for over an hour in line just to be seated (and the line was not even long when we got in it)! The cashier said that the wait was due to busy tables but so many tables were empty in clear view from where we were standing in the line. Meanwhile, there were about 3-4 girls at a time just standing by the register... One ringing people up, the others just chatting to each other while "holding the line." If the few waiters on the floor were busy, why didn't these girls help with clearing tables, refilling drinks to move things along? Anyway, once we were finally seated, our waitress was kind, but messed up our original drink order and then didn't even come by to refill our drinks until we had already been seated for about an hour. Because the food was really good, I'd consider going there again IF THE LINE IS MOVING AT A REASONABLE PACE.

2Daw5ls051R_AQAIdFUsrw.text: My fiance and I had lunch much here. We are staying at palms place so it was convenient. They have a descent selection with a few varieties of food available. A small vegan section,an Asian inspired area,some classics like Pizza and wings,a large greens/fruits area,a cutting station with chicken and pork tenderloin,as well as some fish and a large variety of desserts. We had a $5off coupon so the lunch price was very reasonable. Definitely not the best buffet out there but it was enjoyable.

g513Rk6XDgozboqmx2doFw.text: Bad customer service, waited for over 30 minutes, no waiting area, and the lady named Nancy said we are blocking the way,   The reason why we are standing anyway is we are waiting to be seated, and your telling me we are blocking the way, then get  our table ready already!!! , It's my son's birthday and everybody is upset of the bad service we got, not coming back there anymore for sure! Attention to the management, please, train your employees properly. It's customer service business. They should be friendly, nice and with manners.

duGSMx_QLtKWvTNAPu5l3g.text: We ate breakfast at the A.Y.C.E. buffet and the food was delicious!!   There was a wide variety of food to choose from including a cook to order grill.  The staff was also friendly and the wait staff was very attentive.   I would recommend this restaurant to anyone stay at The Palms Casino Hotel.

A3KkVnJfn3uDthGGDUcU4w.text: Came to preview the new place.  Great value, plenty of variety, fresh picks, yummy everything. And we tried pretty much everything. Recommend the brisket, walnut shrimp and the duck. Save room for the french macaroons. Service is wonderful, everyone was friendly. Shoutout to Chris, our server, excellent job.

je6KWzloWZpK9o_NctkElg.text: Went for lunch on Wednesday was 11:30 am was a 30 minuet wait. The food was good but the prices was not what advertised we had a players card still was $ 34.00 for lunch for two. We will not come back

viiNPr2eibFOABKLeq7ffw.text: I would give this a solid four stars or maybe a little higher. Service is the best of any of the buffet. They clean your plates in a timely fashion compared to the studio B or other station casinos. The smoke and fire section has really good ribs But the brisket was nothing to write home about.  Shrimp cocktail, other shrimp dishes, the seafood boil, and some others I can't think of right now were really good.  Duck was extremely dry.  The desserts were amazing and the poke was different than any I ever had but still good.  Overall solid for 18 a person on a Saturday night.

07MP9pb8xlI8QgXQzRCyUg.text: Sorry, Guys, but this buffet isn't worth the time and money.  Dinner was $21.99 with a players card.  We went two weeks ago on a Tuesday evening arriving about 6:30 p.m.  We waited almost 1-1/2 hours to get in...but the kicker is, there were at least six ready-and-waiting tables that were empty plus a high-table with about 10 seats that were totally empty.  We were escorted to the furthest section against the wall.  There was a table for four next to us that was empty the whole time until a few minutes before we left.  We had to ask the waitstaff for spoons, salt, pepper, and refills on our drinks.  She told us that the table wasn't fully set-up because that section was closed off until a short while before we arrived.  What???  Closed???  We waited for almost 1-1/2 hours to be seated.  Why was it closed?  The food was just OK, but we even had to ask for items to be refilled at the salad bar.  The buffet at Gold Coast is right across the street and even though it's not as "fancy" the food is better at almost half the price.  When we left at about 8:45 p.m. there were still people in line and we counted eight empty tables on the side we sat at.  Thanks but NO thanks.  We won't be going back.  I guess they spent a LOT of money remodeling but forgot to hire more people and train them to make for a good meal!!  Almost forgot....the music was awful and too, too loud.

2mmudfNY4Oyy58nhlKUXig.text: Excellent and Ebony was lovely.  She took good care of us with a smile and friendly words.   She made us feel very welcome and we will return and will request Ebony.  A real delight.   The food was very good as well.  They have done a good job and the other employees we talked to were pleasant and helpful as well.

5v5sqPwkF1w7b4Q5st_zuQ.text: O.m.g. the food here was so delicious .and the service jere was outstanding..people were all polite ti me and my family.also the manger was so polite her name was Freshta she treated us like family..thank u palms casino for haven great staff we had a awesome night there also took kids to movies after the buffett...i would recommend the buffett to friends and family..

K_j5VG26hvjAhqoA-q7xbw.text: Lots of variety all great and tasty. Fresh squeezed juice always a plus. Nice to see The Palms coming back up in Vegas. Looking forward to going back soon.

TomFaAV5TmDXf_IO3mwL0A.text: We came here on a Thursday for lunch time and it was not too crowded. The price was decent too. We used my players card and it gave us a discount right away. The food selection had to be one of the best I've seen in buffets and the quality of the food was real delightful. Our server was Rhonda and she was such a blast! She has such a genuine customer service attitude and it was very refreshing. I appreciate her especially because I wanted a raspberry lemonade and instead of giving the run around (like every other place I've gone to) she quickly and kindly told me "I can make one for you." Though it may not seem like much, it was amazing to me. She's a great server!  Unfortunately we were on our way out (as in going back home) after we ate so we didn't get a chance to see much more of the hotel. We heard great reviews of the buffet so we had to see for ourselves before we left and i'm glad we did. The organization of the food selections flowed so well that it was unlikely to bump into people, unless you're super clumsy lol.  Overall we loved this buffet.  Would like to try the brunch here, but that will have to be for our next trip of course

0KvP9GUzpLC08UBOOSO_NA.text: Meh! Not bad but not that great either. Desserts were good. Food selection was kinda boring.

Ey2RYYYlUeQSmVd3-jCwSQ.text: Excellent Buffet great selection and taste and believe it or not the service was superb

VDhUMTkNlfkckF4Te5oyAQ.text: Pro tip: They have Coke Zero!!!    I've been here several times for lunch and dinner.  And once for Sunday brunch.  I wasn't impressed by the Sunday brunch.  Just seemed like an expensive everyday lunch.  That said, I do enjoy coming here for lunch and dinner.  The main reason I come during lunch is to eat their chicken pot pie.  Those little things are delicious!!  But they tend to run out quickly on those.  There is an entire section devoted to vegan/vegetarian items.  I tried and enjoyed a few of the items there.  There is an Asian section and the salt & pepper chicken wings are super tasty!!  Not to mention their mini-poke bowls.  It is pretty much a small ball of poke on top of sushi rice.  I eat at least 10 of these things everytime.  Honey walnut shrimp is pretty tasty.  There is a DIY soba noodle station, but I'm too lazy to make myself one.  The carving station has several different types of meat as well as a roasted cauliflower that they serve as "steaks."  The curry mussels and crawfish boil are amazing!!  They also have a Moroccan style lamb that is pretty tasty.  There is a BBQ section that has smoked turkey legs!!  I closed my eyes and I was transported back to Disneyland.  They have a grilled calamari that is simply devine!!  The calamari has that  nice grilled char and they are oh so tender!!  I have no idea how they get them to be so tender, they super good.  There is a good soup and salad bar, my favorite items there are the shrimp cocktail and wedge salad.  I don't know why, but I am addicted to their wedge salad.  Bleu cheese, real bacon bits, and dressing.  I have jumbled lunch and dinner items.  I have a hard time keeping track of what items are served at lunch or dinner, since we usually come during lunch and stay through dinner (yup, we are pigs!!).  Only for sure thing is the chicken pot pie is lunch only.  If you've ever been curious, give A.Y.C.E. a try.  You won't be disappointed.

ZbXDGJzWnxTJreIQNoArXw.text: Great buffet!  We decided to try this buffet due to its recent renovation and mostly great reviews.  We had never visited this buffet prior to the renovation so I can't offer a comparison but I will say i found it quite satisfying.  We got here around 10 am for Sunday brunch and the wait was not too bad. I really liked the decor and cleanliness of this buffet right from the start.  The staff was really attentive and nice and informed us that our brunch included bottomless mimosas yippeee!     I found that the offerings weren't overwhelmingly endless like in other buffets but the flavor of everything I tried was on point and some of the options were also served individually which I enjoyed.    The dessert was lacking a bit of creativity and not the most memorable part of this experience so definitely could use some help in this area.   I would definitely like to come back to compare dinner offerings but overall this was very enjoyable.

hdDRcUUUAUBZZKSEb_Kf-w.text: I don't expect much from buffets, but for $25 I expect it to be at least average or above.  We've been to 2 other buffets this stay, both cheaper, and both far superior.   The selection here was terrible (they had a quite a bit, but most of it was kind of eccentric.  Not much in terms of just regular food.  Most of the meat we got was tough, the sides, vegetables, etc., were like warm or cold, as if the burners were off.  The stations weren't manned.  We had to look for someone at both carving stations, and the pasta station was unmanned the entire time we were there. Things were mislabeled (see pic.. the Brussel sprouts look suspiciously like broccoli), and the desserts were tasteless.  Other people were complaining while we were there, too.  Definitely needs some food and employee management upgrades.

6blcKu4WdNm9y9zmeMXz_A.text: We showed up at 3 pm. Waited 20 minutes and not one person ahead of us was seated.  Will not come back. Their capacity is extremely low.

Wj8pK93w4JWzLh75l8MP8Q.text: Not one of my favorites my friend was so egear to wat here for lunch got here paid 25.00 for both of us during lunch.  Buffets wasn't flavorful, deserts selections sucked, gumbo was okay but seemed like it was from the day before because of the gloopyness of it. My favorites were the cod's lemon BBQ chicken and mashed potatoes oh yeah and the regular Mexican corn not the other fancy hot Cheetos one. Moral of this review is I will not be going back thanks for the experiance however..

lURBkRQYNBb7E1YSIfc6iQ.text: This buffet is a joke.  From parking to even the simple process of waiting in line to pay/enter you are treated like a second class citizen here.  80% of the parking spaces are reserved for "VIP"  (individuals who've lost 5 figures + gambling).  Then when you arrive at the buffet, there are two separate lines, one for "VIP" and one for the simple "common folk".  The attendees wave in the "VIP" while you are made to wait in a never ending line.  We arrived at 6 pm and were told the wait is approx 3 hours!  The buffet closes at 9pm.  Is this a joke?

1bW3K3LrGoorFQVjNiOvOQ.text: This review is more for those who already are familiar with buffets in Las Vegas.   I decided to go here on the suggestions from Yelp reviewers.  I was not disappointed.  It offers a plethora of great options like other buffets at higher prices.  The Asian/Italian/Mexican/Seafood/American food sections are on par with other buffets in Las Vegas.  It's price after you get the "Boarding Pass" is very reasonable - at the base level a dinner goes from 21 to 19 dollars.  It isn't on the status of the Bacchanal buffet, but it is also much more reasonable and family friendly.  I took my son for his birthday and he was quite happy, and he is a finicky eater.  The pasta dishes, the southern food options, and the Asian options were as good as any other restaurant that solely serves those types of dishes.    At the end - the variety, price, and value for a family is amazing for this newer buffet.  I will certainly return to this one.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great place.  Good quality food for the price.  You just have to get the boarding pass player card for the discount.

hkz3pslpkGxHpN8MdWWN7g.text: sunday brunch this past weekend was the first time we have been here and it was about an hour and half wait so we hoped it was worth it we go in got out food and out of no where our server disappeared we got very disappointed.... but this women working there in a white shirt went out of her way to help us and everyone around us she made everything better with just asking her once that's what GREAT customer service is thank you NAJELLY and GLENDA for saving our experience well for sure be back for you two and we appreciate it !

WDUg3I_6x5jZ-QavlD6SnA.text: Super good and the ambiance is so beauriful.all the foods are great.im coming back here again and I tell all my friends are go there

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7z3jy-6Vep361NymVorKAg.text: I really thought it would be spectacular because the line was long but it was meh, different dishes but no wow factor and lacked taste. For the price its ok.

Epfeqf7pcAkL_9th5MpLUg.text: The best place we've been to for Mother's Day Brunch ever! The wait in line was short, even while seating our party of 10. Our waitress was so great it seamed as though we were her only table. The food was on point! Perfect portions to allow me to fill up my plates and get a taste each of my favorites. Smoked brisket, sausage, yams, walnut shrimp, breakfast quesadilla, cesar salad, oysters, and a bunch of awesome desserts to name a few. To top it all off bottomless mimosas are included!

lNuF6H_2_oRkpsLB33wrYg.text: This buffet started with a brand new menu in December. I've just started going here less than a month ago. Today, I used my points and along with my players card, I didn't have to pay a dollar. This is probably my fourth time this month.   Josefina was my server today. I also spoke with Facia, the manager who was very open and friendly. We discussed desserts and she gave me suggestions that I followed. Cool vibe here and it shows with the food style, which is fresh and vibrant. I hope that they keep this place upbeat and change the menu occasionally. Not that it's bad but I eat here so much, I don't want to get tired of it.   Originally, I gave a 4 star review but this place is consistently good and for a buffet, that's impressive.  Everyone has been very cordial and friendly which is nice. Other buffets can be rude and push people through like cattle. Not here. And, the food is always replaced promptly so rarely is there an empty tray.

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back again
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8dLD9wSAjEF99U0Odeo9vw.text: Good vegan options. Also, such great service! Head chef Michael gave us a tour and told us what the vegan options were. Very knowledgeable about the food. I was very pleased that they carried vegan desserts. I do have a couple suggestions. It would be cool if they had vegan cheese, so there can be vegan pizza as well. Also, maybe vegan ice cream (there are plenty non dairy options you can find. Almond/soy/coconut milk base, etc) and vegan pasta. They did have zucchini noodles, which I did use as a replacement for the pasta (which had egg in it, I believe) and it was pretty good. I really appreciate the kindness and the service. Thanks so much!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lio1dGrZwdEwsXS9--Phzw.text: Disclaimer: review is from my first time here, during breakfast on Saturday.  All I can say is WOW; what a departure from the palms buffet of past. The food is unique, delicious, fresh, and the room is sheek and updated.  My ONE concern; is that being an off strip venue, this may not see the foot traffic it deserves to keep the quality this good, for NINE FREAKIN DOLLARS.  Well done Stations brand. I will happily drive out from henderson consistently to eat here. Dinner to come later this week

jKdBbyR3U66XOsQfRe9y9w.text: By far the worst buffet experience I've had. Very busy, limited selection, ride customer service, freshta the manger and Mary giard assistant manager should find other jobs that doesn't require customer service because they both are horrible and have no service skills. Very dirty and noisy. Bad all the way. Don't come here go to Paris instead

dvm0RmVyWROIm-WVkHz0fQ.text: Loved this buffet! Iv been vegan for a couple years now and was thrilled to finally find a Vegas buffet with more than "accidental" vegan options. They had a whole section that was almost entirely vegan (one dish was just vegetarian) and the head chef even came out and led me around the rest of the stations to point out all the vegan foods. I even had a few special things made just for me! Also some vegan dessert!!! Fantastic service, great food, and will definitely be back!

9KUvk3NXsj1F4DnTHWfpJA.text: Visiting the newly renovated Palms buffet, now known as A.Y.C.E.  Price definitely swaying even the most modest eaters, starting around $8.99 for breakfast and dinner only $17.99 with a players card, it's a steal in comparison to your on strip options at a similar or better quality!  We were coming in at 11am, and therefore some breakfast items had one foot out the door, while new lunch items were showing up on each visit to the line.  A bit exciting to see new variety at each round, although most was due to schedule I am sure.  As with any buffet, you'll likely find many hits and some misses, but my experience leaned towards the former throughout!  Give it a go!

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry Scone, Red Velvet Cupcake, Cookies &amp; Creme and misc desserts. Hard to go wrong here, my favorite being the lemony tart dessert :)
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice Cream Cookie Sandwich, Smores dessert and Bread Pudding hiding in back. Plenty of build your own options for the ice cream sandwich
Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gumbo, Hot Cheeto Street Corn, Poke, Fried Fish, Biscuit, etc. Random goodies going into the lunch schedule

iejowudGmJy6TptN6tOlkw.text: The last time I came here was before it went through remodeling wow what changes! Usually when a place does remodeling they start putting the price on the patrons and decreasing the food quality I'm always scared and skeptical whenever something is closed for renovations. In this case The upgrade not only brought better food service quality and at the same affordable price, with a players card of course-so you know you need to sign up for it!  Breakfast: $8.99 Lunch: $12.99 Dinner: $17.99  These are prices with the players card you swear I wouldn't know what the regular prices are! Doesn't matter because I'm not willing to spend an extra two dollars more just get the card! :p

RLZUA688nVk_wFMKDpKnzQ.text: Food was okay , nothing exceptional . Price was pretty decent . I suggest you come in early and get in line early . We came on a Saturday for dinner and waited for 3 hours . Lines wrapped around the place . Our server was pretty awesome and personable . It was an okay experience.

IZc6KtuFPjeraFXGJlVf-w.text: Mary the assistant manager was so accommodating and polite. Even though the wait is long she was amazing and so was the service and food! THANK YOU Mary!!!

PWAfl2467yfSrofwxhRxKw.text: I really wanted to like this place. Upon researching at after my parents told me they received BOGO coupons to go, it looked AMAZING and it received a lot of good reviews. But 2.5 hours of waiting and then charging us an adult price for my 6 year old that doesn't even eat as much as I do was a big damper on my experience. Presentation of food gave them some brownie points. Presentation helps when deciding on what you want to eat. Food itself, was decent. They didn't offer typical buffet foods which makes it interesting for those who like new things or to experiment with different tastes and cuisines. It was definitely an experience and maybe I would come back but not with my little one that gets charged as an adult.

CgqA6on07i3iCfk8NoRULQ.text: Review is for weekend/holiday breakfast.  This is a lower priced buffet in Vegas, and you definitely get what you pay for. We paid $13 per person for breakfast on Veteran's day, and there was a surprising variety of foods, from sweet to savory. However, the quality of food was just mediocre.   There were a few mini dishes that had a runny egg, (eggs Benedict, etc), and every one of those eggs were a little too runny. Part of the white was still transparent and jiggly, which wasn't super appetizing.   I also had a mini dish with a small waffle bananas foster, and the waffle was super thick and dry - not super appetizing.   The best part of the buffet was the omelet bar - they use real eggs and it's hot and fresh! Definitely stop by that station.   The breakfast pizza and the desserts were nice too, I especially liked the cookies - they were nice and chewy.   Overall, definitely a "get what you pay for" situation, but not bad considering the low price.

XfNR-oXCTjwtChlgSdJ3fg.text: First time trying palms buffet . Waited 40 minutes . Only one cashier . Got into the buffet and food was DISGUSTING! Overly burnt , under cooked . Food wasn't fresh . Waited for pizza because I saw it being made and I was starving because the food was just so bad . The bread or the pizza wasn't cooked . Dominos is by far way better . Absolutely the worst buffet in all of vegas . I wish I can rate it a zero out of 5 stars. horrendous. Will not be coming back. A goegoues hotel but disgusting buffet . When you go to a nice hotel , you expect high expectations. McDonald's is better than this buffet .

Nyub89fte0Mu_Ac79UmXMg.text: I have lived in Las Vegas for over 20 years.  Tonight a friend and I chose to try the buffet at the Palms and we were blessed to have Rosa as our server.  To date, the best service I have EVER received at any buffet.  She was attentive without being intrusive.  We never were out of beverage and our plates were removed quickly.  She served with a smile and truly seemed to enjoy her job.  And, the food selections were very, very good.  Very large selection at the buffet and everyone working from servers, to bussers, to hostesses all were smiling and efficient.  I asked to speak to the Assistant Manager on duty (Facia Lewis) to express our gratitude as well.  She too had a great attitude and made us feel like valued clients.  I will come back and suggest this buffet to all my guests throughout the year!  Thanks Rosa and Facia for making our evening!

KhlcANUj9cOLbcSYV4BU5g.text: Not the best buffet but not bad either. I like that it's not a big and overwhelming place. Every section seems to be lacking something but it didn't bother me at all. I enjoyed the lamb stew. The reason I'm giving them 5 stars is because of our server, Salvador. He was very attentive, silent shy type, not in your face but funny when you talk to him. Every time I asked for something, he'd bring it right away like there's no other customers there even though he has a lot of other ones. He was just as attentive to them. My daughter spilled her drink and he cleaned it within seconds with a smile on his face. He also kept asking if she was ok. My daughter felt bad.  I joined rewards member and got $4 off each for us. I also like that there's a designated line for disabled person. We had my in laws with us who are both in walkers so they told us to skip the line :). Thank you for that!

c6sN3paaTt_GATYIfVpNyQ.text: If I could give these guys a ZERO I would.  Not only was the food horrible, the cooks were ALL rude. I get that it's not a great job but wow.  Food was bland but the ice tea was a solid 2stars smh.

3rYZGrhRegqxKW37CLZ59w.text: Don't waste your time or money. You will spend more time waiting on line than actually eating. $45 for 2 adults. The selection isn't that great. They have a large Asian area which was good & a pasta station - not that great. The salad bar and ice cream were really good. Other than that I want very pleased with the selection.

nO2nIOqcnqh3kVVardNZ0Q.text: Came here Monday night on Presidents Day for dinner and the wait was less than 20 minutes.  The buffet was not that busy.  I heard and saw the past reviews and came in with high expectations.  Maybe I came on an off day.  The buffet is equivalent in size to the other Station Casinos but appeared to have less of a selection.  The good: Roast Turkey with white gravy was moist and flavorful Roast beef also moist Brisket was juicy but needed the BBQ sauce for flavor Asian Chili Pepper wings yum Nice Gelato and dessert selection  The bad: The pork chops, Korean short ribs, sausage, white rice and chicken marsala were dry  Carvery service at the BBQ was almost always nonexistent Creme Brulee was a hard custard   Station Casino pricing beats most of the other casino pricing.  I will have to return for an updated review.

3izWpYUbT8RZ-8AWDNITHw.text: I'm not exactly flush with self-control when it comes to food, so I usually avoid buffets. But a friend had a BOGO coupon for this one, and I also hate passing up a good deal. So we came for Friday night dinner.  Station recently took over the Palms and their renovations immediately focused on the dining options, and this buffet is a huge upgrade from the previous one under Maloof ownership. Space is brighter and more appealing, food is fresher with more variety, and we were pleasantly surprised by the overall increase in quality.  PROS: Several vegetarian and vegan options, including roasted cauliflower steaks at the carving station and jackfruit enchiladas! Their brisket at the BBQ station was on point. Good mix of trendy dishes like Doritos elote and mini poke bowls along with classic buffet staples like prime rib, shrimp cocktail, and a made to order pasta station. $18/adult with players card seemed about right.   CONS: More than a couple of dishes were mislabeled ("mashed potatoes" were actually sweet potatoes until they were switched out, second "brisket" tray actually appeared to be liver and onions, "coffee" flavored dessert was actually caramel, etc) and despite the focus on freshness and healthy options, the greens at the salad bar were past their prime and more than half of that area needed to be restocked. Service was polite but our drinks stayed empty after our first refill, despite us lingering an extra half hour.   It seems they change up their offerings regularly, I'll be back to catch the raclette station, mussel curry, and gelato ice cream cookie sandwiches.

vYfZOl1pax4zLni9EHbSgw.text: Wow what a great selection and delicious food, for such a great price!!!! CHRISTOPHER was the absolute best. Such a delight and so attentive. Thanks for making us have such a great experience!!!!

qXB5VnlZX3gDiKvIDJWNbA.text: I got two "thanks for the great reviews..." from two different "owners" yet neither of them addressed the concerns/quibbles that I had noted.  Just corporate mumbo jumbo...

a0Ia7lPGoeph0qGelFD_uQ.text: This has been once of my most favorite buffets in Las Vegas. The food is fresh, it's clean, the servers are great, but most of all, the entire team is extremely helpful. Even if they don't have something they say to ask the chef and they may possibly have that item. That is so amazing to feel comfortable asking for something that's not being shown!

Unir5i1uOKyPsSOdraiMDw.text: This review is based on a weekday breakfast only. Rarely if ever i give 4 stars to a $14 breakfast but this place really is a hidden gem.  Location: at the Palms casino resort, its kind of out of the way, not near any monorail stations, we had to lyft from the convention center.  Ambience: new, clean and comfortable, open dining areas with a casino view.  Service: excellent, attentive to details. Perhaps it was due to our great server Wendy? Out coffee was always refilled to the brim, even the dining napkins were aligned perfectly on the table with the restaurant logo facing you.   Food: they dont offer any exotic or expensive items here, but using simple fresh local ingredients to come up with creative, fun & artistic eats.  Has vegetarian & gluten free selections. Coffee: it was actually good, less bitter less acidic than most places, smooth although flavor not as strong, perhaps dark roast? Almost but not quite as good as the coffees in Japan. Fresh pressed juices: served in cute shot glasses, its what this place is known for, today it was lemon, i downed 4 of those even though i am not a lemon fan. It was that good.  Actual food: very creative & fun, small servings in cute mini containers: smoked brisket egg benedict, tapioca fruit parfait (excellent), egg white fritatta, chilled glazed tofu (smooth), pina colada fritters, self serving/mixing cold ramen noodle station ( light & flavorful), made to order omelette station was good, gluten free pancake was very dry & a bit hard, bacons were not very enticing, they were dry and lean and in smaller pieces instead of whole strips,perhaps they cut away the fat portions?  Price: $14 each including tax. If u r a member its only $9.   Conclusion: AYCE breakfast at Palms is now one of my new favorites at Vegas. Great bang even for a loser's budget. Simple yet delicious food that are fun & creative. Its unfortunate that its off the beaten path, otherwise there will be a line out the door.

ldt91AahzxOfL5Ed7KAjcg.text: We came to Vegas and went to the A.Y.C.E. Buffet.  We were warmly welcomed by Mary G the manager who made us feel like family and made sure we were happy. We were served by Rafael who couldn't have been more attentive and engaging so much so that we decide to come back and was surprised that Mary again welcomed us and remembered us and we again was serviced by Isabelle who was also very attentive. Again a great experience from the outstanding service right down to the excellent food. I did not know the people's names In the back of the house but my hat goes off to them as well. Plenty of variety for any Diet.

vegLbA1d8G8ewgBXSZktGg.text: Was not impressed by this buffet. We waited 60 minutes to get in. The vegetarian/ vegan section is very small and not enough for an actual meal. They just have bite sized dishes. The macaroni had hot cheeto crumbs on it. Personally, I think this is pretty gross and not the traditional style I am looking for. The cupcakes tasted the same as the ones you get from Vons out of the plastic containers. The only good thing was friendly service, the reasonable price and a few good finds.

EqsjQgjy04PTbReUClz-WA.text: Reasonable priced for great quality food. Wide selection, comfortable seating, and attentive service. Lots of desserts to choose from. Had a great experience.

2pJbcgYfq7X2GeZtBWfESA.text: Since the Palms casino was sold to Stations, transformations have been happening around the resort.  Their buffet is one of them.  I recall the place was dull, small and forgettable.  But A.Y.C.E. changed that with an expensive makeover and completely new menu.   The entrance is more dramatic with high ceilings and its name is bright lights. Stations are named to sound more like a description (ie. Smoke & Fire or Sweet & Light)   Food are mostly served in smaller portions now, similar to Wicked Spoon. This is a kid ch better practice for people to sample more types, while cutting down on waste, I hope.    Food wasn't outstanding in any way but good enough to satisfy.  Small poke bowl; fresh but bland. Salt & pepper wings; flavor was good but I got a piece that was undercooked. Sliders were very dry and well done. These are just a few that needs improvement. Other than these, the food was good enough for us not to complain but not great to be memorable.   A big plus for me is they have hand scooped ice cream. They also serve cookies and premise ice cream sandwiches. Or you can create your own. Other desserts were also in smaller portions.   Our server was great. Wish I remember her name but she's an older Filipino lady.  They also did a good job keeping things full.    I can't believe I didn't know about A.Y.C.E. last time we stayed at Palms Place but there's a pretty good chance we'll go back.  3.5 stars for this new buffet.   Tips:   Prices are dependent on your level of Player's Card. Or if you don't have one, regular price isn't that bad at under $15 for lunch.   If you like macrons & they don't have any on display, try asking.  If there are any left, they'll grab it for you.    Lines aren't too bad earlier, before noon.  It does get busier after 12:30ish.    Don't be a cheapskate, tip your server. Two gals next to us didn't tip at all. Lame.   See my photos and give them a 'like'!

Rx5YF6S9U3ka7JcD8s1alg.text: Love this place. Clean and attentive staff. Great little portions for shrimp cocktails and ceviche.a little pricey but don't mind because all is good. Been here for breakfast lunch and dinner.

ukmbU-M9HgemTLODOcVWMQ.text: Make Palms into a locals Station Casino?  Brilliant!!  This kinda opened the gates for me - I mean, I was OK with the Palms before the management change, but back then the buffet was really kinda lacking.  I mean before it shut down for renovations, it was doing 24 hour duty!  It was an all day buffet/cafe!  Crazy!  Fast forward to 2018 and the finished masterpiece that is now the AYCE Buffet in the Palms.  What an improvement!  They definitely went to a more Station Casinos theme, and for the better I think.    Wifey & I waited a month or 2 before coming to the AYCE Buffet because it seemed to be super busy with all Station Casino player's card members wanting to try it!  Using those points, yo!  Even on the day we finally visited for lunch (with our locals discount), the wait in line was about 30 minutes.  But hey it was worth it!  Such an improvement!  We tried out tons of dishes:  -Duck Cassoulet with White Beans -Moroccan Lamb -Vegan Stuffed Peppers -Calamari Steak -Jackfruit Enchiladas (Yes!  Jackfruit!) -Poke Bowl -Shakshuka -Smoked Brisket Benedict -Watermelon Citrus Salad -Shrimp Cocktail -Ice Cream Sandwich with Cookies & Cream and Butterfinger  They gettin' fancy here!  Some wordy dishes, but some great new tastes!  I was really surprised by the Jackfruit Enchiladas, tasty!  Made for vegans!  Was consistent to actual enchiladas with meat.  The Smoked Brisket Benedict was a standout as well, good smoke from what looked like an indoor industrial smoker!  I could get used to being a local here at the AYCE Buffet in the Palms!  Definitely not disappointed.  Lots of choices for all, and the prices are still consistent with your Red Rock/Green Valley Ranch buffets.  And now with the added benefit of using your Station Casino rewards!!    Oh yeah, we'll be back!

qc9xK2G78lI45GK43q_ABA.text: I was actually very pleasantly surprised with the quality of this buffet! It is located in the Palms Casino and Resort, right next to the casino.   I came for brunch on a Sunday and had to wait ~40 minutes, but their prices are amazing for the food you receive! Some of my favorites that day included the beef brisket, pizza, and poke. My boyfriend looved the brisket as well as the eggs benedict. On top of the food, you also receive free drinks! It was my first time having a mimosa and I didn't quite enjoy it as much as I thought because the alcohol taste was a little too much for my personal liking. I also loved the dessert section as it included different mousses, cakes, cookies, brownies, and my favorite, GELATO! I got 1 scoop of the pistachio gelato and it was delicious as it included a lot of pistachios in it! I would highly recommend coming here for an affordable buffet with good tasting food! :-)

nSLH0yXWC_0PUjIrKbFZ6Q.text: Food is average to good with the exception of the strombolis and honey walnut which are exceptional.   Salad bar is weak.  Dessert bar makes up for it in full.   Play a little and get your buy one get one buffet voucher. Go   Breakfast rocks too

XPloHeA_yc_-p-xNK8wbcg.text: The Palms is now actually a Station Casino which is amazing for locals. The idea behind this buffet is to offer low prices with a quality delivery.   The first time we went took about an hour wait, and I'm assuming that it's because they were so new! The other times we stopped by, the line was quick and we hardly waited which is fantastic because we always come hungry.   The food is great with lots of choices like corned beef hash, elote, bbq chicken, and many other fancy foods that I can't name. My favorite there are the choices regardless of any time you're visiting. It's definitely not Bacchanal Buffet, but it's certainly delicious for the price you're paying for. With that said, I recommend to try bits and pieces of every dish.   The service is a borderline miss, but they really try to get your drinks refilled. I believe there was only one time when our server hardly paid attention to us, but even then, that did not stop us from coming back.   A must try especially when you want to try amazing food outside the Strip.

5NEm32wWNYb9fuubhMY2Dw.text: My wife and i like to consider ourselves Vegas regulars when it comes to food. We visit once a year mostly to see family but also to vacation and when we are here we like to eat. Sometimes we go healthy like we eat at home and sometimes not..  A brief story about our Vegas trips before the A.Y.C.E ( all you can eat) buffet.  One of our favorite hotels in Vegas is the palms place, just off the strip but close enough if you like the the touristy las vegas strip. The palms and palms place were just purchased by the stations casino brand and they are making some amazing changes. One of those changes was to the buffet. Off strip buffets are known for being cheaper and not as quality driven as a Bellagio or cosmopolitan strip buffet. The strip buffets have been increasing their prices over the past 10 years where it's become more economical to just grab something at a cafe or smaller restaurant.  Sorry for the long dialogue but here is the review...The buffet at the palms had not had good reviews until the recent remodel. We decided to give it a try when we saw the $10.99 (with players club card) price. I want to tell you were not disappointed at all. Everything us clean and the food looks every bit as good as any strip casino. The fun thing my wife and i liked is they serve the food tappa style (a big thing in las vegas). I (we) think this is a great way to do things. It creates less food waste and if you find something you like you can always go back and get more. The service was great with a lot of great options for all eaters and fresh.  Excited to find a new place with great options for such a great price.

rHUKGK01mbq9NGl50bSkMg.text: It's a relatively new buffet by Palms Casino, re-vamped at the end of 2017. We had high expectation based on a few Vloggers' reviews . We were all very excited once we paid and got inside because the decors and layout were right on point.  Even the presentations of the dishes were impressive and inviting; many were in individual servings using small bowls and cups.  Everything LOOKED great, and we were so excited, especially when the buffet prices is about $10 cheaper than Aria which we also visited and had great experience.  Unfortunately, the hype quickly deflated when it was time for the tasting.  Most dishes were room temperature cold, and most proteins were tough and dry.  The sushi rice was powdery, not fresh at all.  After 2-3 rounds of nearly unpalatable dishes, all three of us concluded this was one of the biggest disappointment we've ever had!  And we quit in record time for a buffet -- normally we'd loiter a bit when the mind wants more but the stomach runs out of room.  There were a few good selections, such as The Korean style spare ribs, tofu steak, etc.,  but they were all poorly executed for one reason or another. The only half decent dishes we would mention were the salt & pepper chicken wings, the French onion soup, and a few desserts such as the creme brulee and raspberry tarts.  At a dinner price of $21.99, I'd rather either pay $10 more at Buffet at Aria, or $10 less for Ports O Call lunch @ Gold Coast.   A big thumb down.

rKPYsReMKT_pfWElFNBAzw.text: Save your money! First of all they only had 1 cashier on a Friday night we waited in line over an hour. The food was terrible. The service equally as bad, our waitress never cleared our dishes I had to ask for a drink refill. The only saving grace was we had a 2 fer coupon I never would pay full price for that buffet. HR3vOUJ9ZLVUd_re0B5Fgg.text: We were staying at the Palms for the first time because we were watching Lady Antebellum at the Pearl Theatre. Funny enough...it fell on the night before Valentine's Day.    My husband and I both don't put a lot of emphasis on the holiday, so we were mostly just looking for convenience for the night of Valentine's Day. We saw the A.Y.C.E. buffet and thought we would give it a shot.  It was a great experience! Not only were the food options good (I had three of the little personal wedge salads and then an array of choices from each of the themed sections) but the people facilitating (managers, servers) were all super friendly and accommodating.  A huge thank you to Camila, the manager! There was a small misunderstanding with table seating and we ended up needing to move tables (truly not a big deal) but she was so kind and even comped my husband and me each a glass of wine. It was thoughtful and made our experience that much more memorable. If we are in Vegas again, we will be back.

k87tDojSSDGRzTzuYaV_0A.text: the latest incarnation of the Palms buffet was a major disappointment. Quality, quantity, and customer service were all that was missing.  Other than that? I noticed two supervisors standing next to the (empty) plate pick up area and commented to them my observations.  They said, "really" and walked away.  As an example, the limited (very) choice of seafood selections was highlighted by a calamari dish.  I can't tell you how it tasted since it was empty.  I asked the server behind the counter (who was very busy doing nothing) when it might be refilled.  She said about 30 minutes.  30 minutes!  This is a buffet not a sit down and order specialty restaurant.  This was quite typical of our experience. Very small selection, inattentive servers, and indifferent supervisors.  Save your money and wait till they reimagine the buffet (again) in a few years.

rgXcvi7elkX9BnnTSCmvoA.text: In terms of price and value, A.Y.C.E. buffet at Palms is unbeatable! I came for the champagne Sunday brunch, which is $22 and includes bottomless mimosas. Ohh yeah.  Some selections here may not seem too great or appetizing, but here's the kicker - you don't have to eat those! The brunch buffet offers plenty of different options of breakfast foods interspersed with the more savory foods.   The layout of the food type is not straightforward, so I'd suggest doing a lap to check everything out to get your bearings as the section names are confusing. Lemme tell you - I went to town on those mashed potatoes and prime rib. And mimosas.   P.S. the cinnamon bread pudding is DELISH, esp topped with vanilla ice cream! Must get!

diBLKQBJ-qyU3YAcPDR8vA.text: I had a awesome breakfast and great service every time im at the palms I have to eat here thanks

otsFiYdPqA9J3BlTlCWcqw.text: My friend Tim and I came here for the dinner buffet tonight.The 2 for 1 offer was hard to refuse.We tried to come here a few weeks ago for a weekend brunch with a 2 for none coupon but the combined population of Planet Earth was on line and it probably would have entailed about a 3 hour wait and I wouldn't wait that long for a ringside seat to the second coming of Christ ! Tonight's wait was much more reasonable,about 45 minutes or so.The buffet was actually better than either Tim or I thought it would be.I always consider it a negative when Station Casinos take over a property.They tend to convert the buffets to a certain,consistent level of mediocrity.But this one wasn't too bad.They seemed a bit more creative in their choice of dishes then in some of their other places.I can also nit pick a bit and find some small things that turned me off a bit and showed me that the bean counters still have a firm grip on running this place and trying to save the Palms a few precious pennies.I didn't like that the shrimp cocktails were in these containers with only half of the contents being shrimp and the rest being shredded lettuce.Of course,that was easily remedied by taking several of them and just eating the shrimp on the top and ignoring the lettuce below.Another thing was that the soda glass could have been a larger size and would have saved the server some extra trips to the tables.Also,the Asian section left a lot to be desired,with a very limited selection.Not that I ever expect good Asian food at an Americanized buffet.If I want good Asian food,I'll go to Krazy Buffet on Sahara and Cimmaron.(You're welcome,Danny,for the free endorsement).Also,I echo some of the other comments about the limited dessert selections.They didn't have any pie dishes and if you wanted your ice cream in a bowl you had to get it in some small quasi styrofoam construct that only vaguely resembled a bowl.Having said the above complaints,our server was pretty good at bringing us beverage refills and removing the empty plates.If you can get a 2 for 1 discount and manage to get here at some day and time with less than an hour wait,you could definitely do much worse than eating here.I will probably come here again in the future;I'm just not sure when.I have no hesitation in giving them a 4 star rating.I would NOT recommend that you come here on weekends or holidays as I suspect,from past experience,that your waiting time(s) would be horrific.

eckqm4Nhm7_eLVfyZAFMcg.text: High quality buffet at similar levels what you get at the Cosmopolitan or other on strip buffets that are 2X or 3X the price.  Parking is free and convenient and you walk in.  Easy to get in with no line on Sunday brunch  Seating was comfortable.  Endless mimosas.   Not very crowded.  Smoked brisket was good. Chicken wings were delicious. Seafood soup was great.   A lot of different choices.   Restroom at the casino was very clean and very spacious.   We will come back  #12

photos.caption: Photo of A.Y.C.E. Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

suFZaoj20SiarERU-Iiqdw.text: I'm not a huge buffet person so coming from me this is huge! Best buffet I've been too in a long time! Food was great! Service was amazing!  The staff is delightful especially Mary! I will definitely be going back!

6DhKF6vABh705F16lXyBkw.text: I usually don't do too many reviews but I must say! I had an amazing experience here with MARY and the food was amazing. Me and my family will definitely be going back soon!!! Everything from the way we were greeted, the speedy service every time we needed something and the all around vibe of the buffet. We had a great time

1OV1zsVlN77fWCfcMu8qgw.text: I had family in town and they were staying at the Palm's casino so we decided to go to the buffet for lunch / dinner. I can't say how impressed I am with what the Station Casino company is doing with the Palm's Casino. Yes it is under construction but we didn't have any problem parking or walking through the casino.  The A.Y.C.E buffet was impressive for such a great price. The servers were awesome, always bringing drinks even after we sat for 3 hours catching up, talking and snacking. I really liked the duck confit, french onion sliders, salt and pepper wings, vegetable stromboli, french onion soup and clam chowder. We even had the pasta station cook shrimp with garlic in a wine sauce without the pasta which was delicious. I only had 1 cold item, it wasn't that great for a mushroom quesadilla and I didn't like the hummus and pita. For the deserts, I definitely recommend getting a waffle cone and putting some of their ice cream or it might be gelado in it. The mini creme brulee, mini lemon meringue pastry and carrot cake were truly perfect sweet bites and I had to stop myself from getting a second plate of them.  I will definitely be going back to the Palm's Casino for the A.Y.C.E buffet and so I can update this review with other memorable dishes.

naPOf3wJ0W7p2Ezd3p-sag.text: This may be my new top choice for near-strip reasonably priced buffets ($20 dinner price). This place is a good example of the latest Vegas trend of newly remodeled, upgraded buffets with a modern feel and higher quality food. I didn't expect much of a strip buffet under $20, but this place is actually quite good and offers decent selection of great quality food. No crab legs but some good selection of seafood, ribs and beef brisket for meat eaters, and even a vegetarian station. The selection of desserts is also quite good. I would compare the feel and the quality to a more prestigious buffet like M. On the strip I previously preferred Planet Hollywood's Spice Market buffet, but now I may be visiting this buffet at Palms more often.
